allmonsters.description:
These minions are seen flying around in the sky, mainly in Shallow Abysses.

They look like two small, winged child-like Daemons connected by their long intertwined tails. The two are never separated and are therefore considered a single Daemon. Their consciousnesses seem to be completely synchronized, and their coordinated attacks are as threatening as those of a skilled swordsman with two swords.

There have been reports of seeing three or more bodies connected by a tail, but the possibility of misidentification or assumption has not been ruled out, and the information has yet to be confirmed.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: Abyss Minions receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØTwin Daemons
abilities.description:
At first glance, the Right and Left sections are indistinguishable. If the character performs a melee attack, a ranged attack, or a "Target: 1 Character" spell or effect on one of these sections, roll 1d. If the result is 1- 2, the opposite section, which is different from the targeted section, will be affected. If both sections are targeted at the same time, this effect does not occur.

This ability is lost when the HP of either Right of Left sections falls to 1 or less.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Cross Strike/7 (14)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description:
It attacks 1 character with a melee attack from both sections simultaneously, dealing 2d+10 physical damage.

This ability cannot be used when a Major Action has been completed for either its Right of Left section. Also, if it uses this ability, the Major Action of both sections will be completed.

allmonsters.description:
This tree can be found in Shallow Abyss. It does not look much different from other trees and is difficult to distinguish from a distance.

However, it acts with its own will, including casting spells. Its purpose is to maintain the Shallow Abyss in which it lives.

Therefore, it cooperates with monsters protecting Shallow Abyss and takes measures such as sharing HP. Because of its ability to share, it is necessary to find and defeat this tree before clearing the Shallow Abyss.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], [Rune Master], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØAbyss Connection
abilities.description:
When this monster is in Shallow Abyss, it may share HP with a monster existing in the same Shallow Abyss. In this case, as long as the target monster exists in the Shallow Abyss, it can choose to receive the applied damage to its HP as fixed damage that would otherwise be dealt to the Trunk section. The distance from the target is not taken into account, and it is not necessary to be visible. Any number of monsters can be the target of this effect.

The HP of the target cannot be used to heal the damage already suffered by the Trunk section.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 9 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, the Abyss Tree recovers 9 HP. This has no effect if the Abyss Tree has 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
The tree's giant body hinders attacks.

The Trunk section gains a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee and ranged attacks.

This effect disappears when any Branch section falls to 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Toxic Branch/15 (22)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
A Branch strikes "Target: 1 Character" with the Abyss branch and leaves within "Range: Touch."

The target suffers 2d+15 magic damage and, at the same time, randomly loses one of its items if it has any of the following items in its inventory: herbs, potions, or medicine. This effect is a Curse type.

On the turn when any Branch section uses this ability, other Branch sections cannot use this ability.

allmonsters.description: This Mythical Beast is about 2 meters long, with white fur and a llama- like appearance. It is characterized by small horns sprouting from both of its foreheads and jointless hind legs. The creature is highly sensitive and can become aggressive when influenced by the emotions and intentions of others.

abilities.title: ‚è©Intimidating Cry / 3 (10) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
The Achlis makes an intimidating cry and causes enemies around it to panic. Within "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (3m Radius)/All," targets suffer a -1 penalty on Accuracy, and Evasion checks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This effect can be used only once per round and cannot be used in consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØStanding Upright
abilities.description: If the HP of the Rear is 0 or less, Front section gets a -2 penalty on Evasion checks.

allmonsters.description:
This is an undead person with a corpse-like body. They maintain the same appearance as before they were born and are almost indistinguishable from the living.

For some reason, their souls were not reincarnated but remained in the corpse. Some resent the world and try to bring misfortune upon it, while others maintain their reason and intelligence and leave their homes to exist alone in remote places. It is said they gather together in some places to form pseudo-families.

abilities.title: ‚óØNormal Weapon Immunity, ‚óØPoison Immunity, ‚óØDisease Immunity, ‚óØPsychic Type (Weak) Immunity
‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Adapsia is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description: Beasts from another world, Aetherbeasts are loyal to and follow around other daemons. Often taking the appearance of a much larger wolf, they will savagely bite any who threaten them. While the stats given are for this particular form, GMs may also use other stats to represent other Aetherbeast forms.

abilities.description: None.

allmonsters.description: An Afanc is a Mythical Beast that looks like a giant beaver with a somewhat human-like face. It is said to live near lakes and drag all who approach it beneath the waves.

abilities.title: ‚è©Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Bear Muscle], [Cat's Eyes], and [Recovery (7 pts.)] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Double Attack
abilities.description: An Afanc can attack the same target twice in one action with its Claws.

abilities.title: ‚óØHug
abilities.description:
The target is grappled if both Claw attacks hit with [‚ñ∫Double Attack]. The target will no longer be able to move or make melee or ranged attacks. Also, starting from the next turn, the Body section automatically deals 2d+16 physical damage to the target, and Head section attacks automatically hit the target.

When the target tries to escape, use de-bonding (see ML, p. 71).

While entangled by this unique skill, the Afanc cannot attack other characters. If the monster itself wants to release the target, it can do so with a Minor Action.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description: An Afanc's large size helps prevent enemies from attacking it. The Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. When the Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

allmonsters.description:
This Daemon looks like a human without a body from the waist down. Instead of legs, it has four pairs of long, jointed legs from its flanks and moves in a spider-like form.

Its head is red and enlarged, but it has no eyes or ears and perceives everything with its nose. In combat, it attacks by thrusting its legs, but when it concentrates on attacking, it slows down and creates an opening.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttitude Control
abilities.description: Agare cannot fall prone.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Multi-Legged Attack & Twin Strike
abilities.description:
Agare can make two Leg attacks each round. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

If the second attack is made as a risk, it gains a -2 penalty to Evasion and Willpower.

allmonsters.description:
The Airloo is a mythical beast that is more than 3 meters long and has the appearance of a gigantic goat. It has two large, twisted horns on its head, and its hooves are charged with magic power, allowing it to walk on the surface of the water.

Airloos often live in flocks around lakes deep in mountains and forests and are known to attack anything that comes near them. For this reason, they are called lakeside guardians, and it is believed that someone may have ordered them to protect the lakes in prehistoric times.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Loud Roar
abilities.description:
The Airloo can let loose a loud bellowing roar.

Roll 2d, and if the roll is 10 or more, a new Airloo appears on the battlefield. The position of the new Airloo is the rearguard area of the Airloo's faction in Simplified Combat, or 15m away in any direction determined by the GM from the position where this ability was used in Standard/Advanced Combat. The new Airloo will begin to act to protect its comrades after 10 seconds (1 round).

The GM may adjust the number of Airloo appearing from this unique skill (even to 0, if appropriate), according to the situation.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚è©Stratagem & Maneuver / 1 Area (5m Radius)
abilities.description:
Can use [Surging Offense I] (Physical Damage +1).

Every third turn uses [Maneuver: Unexpected Blow I] (Accuracy +2, Damage +2). If there are no characters eligible to be effected by a Stratagem, these abilities will not be used.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional 4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: üó®Taunting Strike I
abilities.description:
A Body can make an attack with reduced damage by -2.

If the attack hits, the opponent must attack (with any type of attack) the Body as much as possible within the next 10 seconds (1 round). This does not work for characters with an Intellect score of 18 or higher or on monsters with "Intelligence: High".

allmonsters.description:
This is a warrior that is proficient in the Alchemist class. It uses a variety of Evocations as well as weapon attacks. They are not as skilled as a warrior but can use both attacks and support depending on the actions of those they are working with.

The color of the material cards obtained as loot is randomly determined if necessary.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫‚è©Evocations/10 (17)
abilities.description:
It can use [Vorpal Weapon], [Critical Ray], [Barkmail], [Paralyzing Mist], [Heal Spray], [Poison Needle], and [Manadown] evocations. All Evocations are used at A rank. There is no limit to the number of cards; Alchemist Scholar can use as many cards as needed.

When used with a Major Action, the Evocation check is performed with the standard value, success value, described in the heading of this ability; when used with a Minor Action, the success value is treated as 0.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides and adding +1 to it.

allmonsters.description: This particular construct has a bacterium that causes the Golden Disease, which eventually turns a person's entire body into gold. While someone with the Golden Disease eventually dies and stiffens into a golden statue, their entire body is not actually gold. However, unscrupulous salesmen will attempt to sell these bodies as golden statues in hopes of duping people out of their hard-earned money.

abilities.title: ‚óØGolden Disease/15 (22)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
If the Bite attack hits, it infects the target with a "Golden Disease" disease.

Target immediately receives a 2d disease magic damage and an additional 1d disease magic damage at the end of each round (no additional checks are needed in that case).

As the disease deals damage, golden spots spread from the wound, eventually turning the whole body gold. If the target dies from this disease, after 24 hours, their entire body is stiff gold, and the character cannot be resurrected.

The Golden Serum earned from defeating an Alchemy Tooth can be used to cure this disease (but not the HP lost). If taken in advance, it will prevent the character from catching this disease for up to 24 hours.

A Major Action is needed to take Golden Serum.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If an Alchemy Tooth successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is a sound device made in the Magic Civilization Period to repel intruders. A large horn is mounted on the top of the pedestal-like body, and it has four short legs for moving and two long, thin hands for operating the device on the top.

When the monster detects an intruder in the house, it lures them with its spellsongs and draws them into a trap. After that, the monster attacks the intruder with its arms and spellsongs.

The type of spellsong that can be played is specified at the time of creation, and it seems that some of them play other spellsongs rather than [Curiosity].

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited 2 Actions
abilities.description: The monster can perform two Major Actions in one round. However, one must be a melee attack with Arm, and the other must be either a [‚ñ∫Basic Spellsongs] [‚ñ∫Special Spellsong] or [‚ñ∫Finale].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Special Spellsong [Curiosity]/12 (19)/All areas (50m radius)
abilities.description: Plays spellsong [Curiosity]. This unique skill can only be used if the current value of this monster's HP is at least half of the maximum value (rounded up).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫[Finale: Screaming Snake-pit Symphony]/12 (19)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
Uses [Finale: Screaming Snake-pit Symphony] within "Range: 2 (50m)" to deal 2d+10 Curse magic damage to up to 3 targets.

This unique skill can only be used if the current value of this monster's HP is less than half of the maximum value (rounded up).

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This archer handles arrows coated with a special narcotic poison. They are characterized by their burnished faces, sharp horns and fangs, and reddish body hair.

It has been hypothesized that a mixture of Bolg and Ogre would result in this appearance.

Some researchers have corroborated this, but it's far from conclusive, and it is not fully accepted.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bow
abilities.description: With "Range/Area: 2 (20m) / Shot," makes a ranged attack with a bow. Accuracy and Damage are the same as normal attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur with [‚ñ∫Bow].

abilities.title: ‚óØPhytotoxin/6 (13)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If a [‚ñ∫Bow] attack hits, the target suffers -2 Evasion for 3 minutes (18 rounds). This effect does not stack with itself. This is a Poison-type effect.

allmonsters.description: Al-Mi'raj is a mythical beast in the shape of a rabbit about 50cm long with a single sharp horn on its head. Using its magic power, it catches prey animals off guard, skewers them with its sharp horn, and then feeds on them. Sometimes, a human who approaches the animal may be fooled by the animal's charm and become a victim.

abilities.title: ‚óØLovely Eyes / 4 (11) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
A character who sees Al-Mi'raj at the start of their turn must make a Willpower check. If they fail, they will be less hostile and receive a -2 penalty to their Accuracy check for the next 10 seconds (1 round).

A character who has received 1 or more points of applied damage from Al-Mi'raj will not be affected by this unique skill for a period of one day. Also, this effect is Psychic type.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional 4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

allmonsters.description: Alraunes are plant monsters that look like small children, around 80cm tall, with large white flowers blooming out of their heads. Very timid, they will attempt to escape immediately when startled, but are curious and will watch from a distance if possible. Alraunes have a child-like personality, and if treated appropriately can be made to be fond of humans.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Piercing Scream/3 (10)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
The Alraune lets out a high-pitched scream and stuns "Target: All Area (20m Radius)/All" within "Range: Caster." This effect is treated as a Psychic (Weak) type.

The target will fall prone as soon as it is stunned.

allmonsters.description:
Amalthea is a fairy who appears in the form of a slightly plump, rounded female figure, holding in her hand's magical horn that can heal and bring luck.

She is called the Mother of Fairies and guards the secluded regions where they live.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], [Rune Master], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Horn of Fertility/Can't
abilities.description:
Amalthea touches "Target: 1 Character" with "Range: Touch" to restore 100 HP.

At the same time, the target gains the effect of automatic success without rolling any dice the first time it performs an Evasion, Fortitude, Willpower, or Death Check afterward. This effect lasts until the automatic success occurs, or for 3 minutes (18 rounds). Suppose the target receives this effect more than once during the duration. In that case, only the HP recovery effect occurs, and the automatic success effect of the check does not accumulate (the target gains the right to automatic success on a different check).

Undead, Construct, and Magitech characters are immune to this ability

allmonsters.description:
This is a two-headed poison snake with a head at each end of its body. It has bat-like wings, but they are small and degenerate, and it cannot fly. It moves by rolling around like a wheel, with one head clamped onto the other.

In addition to having a poisonous bite, it is also known to breathe poisonous gas, Some scholars believe that, like Wyverns, it may have some connection to dragons.

Preferring cold climates, they mainly live in caves. There, they wait for prey to wander in, kill them with poisonous gas, and devour them.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison/10 (17)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If the Bite hits, it deals 8 poison magic damage to the target.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Poisonous Gas Breath/10 (17)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot" spits out poison gas in "1 area (3m Radius) / 5", dealing 2d Poison magic damage to the targets.

This ability cannot be used for consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description: A large snake, an Anaconda measures around 2m in length. Its preferred method of attack is to hide in trees as though it were a large vine, then drop down onto unsuspecting prey. The coils of an Anaconda can constrict and suffocate something as large as a cow. The skin of the Anaconda is prized for its capabilities when turned into leather, and adventurers are often sent to procure such skins.

abilities.title: ‚óØEntanglement
abilities.description:
A successful hit from a Constrict attack entangles the target. In each round, the Anaconda hits the entangled target automatically and makes all Accuracy and Evasion Checks with a -2 penalty.

When the target tries to escape, use the de-bonding rules.

While entangled by this unique skill, the Anaconda cannot attack other characters. If the monster itself wants to release the target, it can do so with a Minor Action.

allmonsters.description:
This monster is a powerful Undead that was created with magic from the grudges of the dead from before the Magic Civilization Period. It is extremely rare to encounter them as they are few and buried inside deep dungeons and ruins.

Like the Ghost, some of them have past knowledge and memories, but their memories are from so long ago that even the source of their hatred is often unclear. Their goals are fuzzy and may appear and disappear from time to time. It is said that if their true desire is identified and fulfilled, their memories will return, and they will disappear.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: The Ancient Ghost can perform 2 Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Tempting Lure/17 (24)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Whispers temptation to "Target: 1 Entire Character" in "Range/Area: 1 (10m)/Target". If the target fails the Willpower check, the Ancient Ghost may have that character move according to its own whim. If no instructions are given, the target will just stand there. A target under this effect moves slowly and cannot make any attack or cast a spell.

This effect is treated as Psychic type (Weak) and lasts for one day.

abilities.title: ‚è©Fear Aura/18 (25)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Whispers sinisterly to "Target: All Areas (50m Radius)/All" within "Range: Caster", causing them to cower in fear. Targets that fail the Willpower check take a -2 penalty to its Success Value when making melee, shooting attacks or casting a spell against this monster or while in a skirmish containing this monster against any other character inside. If a character fails the Willpower check with a Success Value of 21 or less, they must move as far as possible to get out of range of this unique skill (If the movement is blocked by a skirmish area they need to prepare to withdraw). This effect is treated as Psychic type, and lasts for 10 seconds (1 round).

This unique skill can be used only once per round

allmonsters.description:
These odd Barbarous have a humanoid upper body growing out of the lower body of a giant scorpion.

Living in deserts and around ruins, Androscorpions are reasonably capable Artificers in their own right. They will often be seen carrying and wearing the various spoils of their expeditions, whether armor, weapons, or strong magical artifacts.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Gunfire/6 (13)/Evasion/Neg
abilities.description: An Androscorpion can attack with a readied gun, whose Max. Magazine is 4, range is 2 (20m), and Critical Threshold is 10.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison/5 (12)/Fortitude/Neg
abilities.description: If the Androscorpion's Lower Body hits with their Tail attack, the target will receive an extra 6 poison-type damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØWeakening
abilities.description: When the Lower Body section is reduced to 0 HP or fewer, the Androscorpion receives a -2 penalty for Evasion.

loottable.loot: Poison Stinger with Intact Poison Sac (800G/Red A)

allmonsters.description:
This is a mythical beast that looks like an antelope. Its mouth resembles a human-like shape, and it can speak Humanoid languages.

Its goal is to protect the deep and quiet environment of the forest. When an invasion occurs in their territory, they will try to guide invaders out of the forest and, if impossible, eliminate them.

In some cases, they have been seen spending time with Humanoids and others who have chosen to live in symbiosis with the forest.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control].

abilities.title: ‚è©Wrath of the Forest
abilities.description:
It expresses anger at those who disturb the forest.

For 3 minutes (18 rounds), its Accuracy and Spellcasting checks get a +1 bonus.

This ability can be used only when its HP is less than half. After using this ability, Antar cannot cancel the effect by itself and will not stop fighting until it eliminates the enemy.

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Regional Dialect, Learned Magic Language
allmonsters.description: A young person who has just started taking on assassination work. They have little experience in actual combat, and try their best to eliminate enemies outside of combat.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

abilities.title: üó®Desperate Strike I
abilities.description:
Add +5 damage to a successful Weapon attack. At the same time, the Apprentice Assassin receives 5 points of fixed damage to HP.

If the attack is not successful, the Assassin does not receive any fixed damage.

allmonsters.description:
Arakcruders are a type of Barbarous with their entire body is covered with feathers, and heads resembles a bird of prey. It has a pair of large wings growing from their arms. It is about 2 meters tall, but its wing span is twice that when flying. Although their ability to manipulate objects with their hands has degenerated significantly, they can use their legs like hands while flying, and they mainly live in this way. When they have no choice but to walk, they walk upright.

They are territorial and live in groups, building primitive dwellings in caves, cliffs, or on the tops of large trees, often using floating rocks (see CR I, p. 341) as their strongholds. Although belligerent and ferocious, they revere Garuda (see p. 97) as the King of the Flying Barbarous, and many serve them.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: This monster receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØSpear Pursuit
abilities.description:
A monster's spear can be used as a melee attack against an opponent who has been attacked with a beak.

Accuracy check and damage are the same as those of the beak. This effect is effective only when the monster is Flying.

allmonsters.description: Among the Arakcruder (see p. 77), these are the ones most skilled with spears, who lead their tribes in hunting and eliminating foreign enemies.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: This monster receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØSpear Pursuit
abilities.description:
This monster's spear can be used as a melee attack against an opponent who has been attacked with a beak.

Accuracy check and damage are the same as those of the beak. This effect is effective only when the monster is Flying.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave I
abilities.description: This ability can only be used with [‚óØSpear Pursuit]. It can attack up to 3 characters within reach with melee attacks, but the damage will be reduced by -3. If more than one is hit, the damage is determined individually.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Cat's Eyes], [Bear Muscle], [Gazelle Feet], and [Beetleskin] Techniques.

allmonsters.description: It is a very powerful Arakcruder (see p. 77). They justify their violent nature by defining justice as simply being strong. When cornered, they go berserk and begin to rampage without restraint.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: This monster receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØSpear Pursuit
abilities.description:
A monster's spear can be used as a melee attack against an opponent who has been attacked with a beak.

Accuracy check and damage are the same as those of the beak. This effect is effective only when the monster is Flying.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave II
abilities.description: This ability can only be used with [‚óØSpear Pursuit]. It attacks with a weapon up to 5 characters within the skirmish in which it resides.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Cat's Eyes], [Bear Muscle], [Gazelle Feet], [Recovery (5 pts.)], and [Beetleskin] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚óØRage
abilities.description:
This effect appears automatically when this monster's current HP becomes less than half its maximum value (rounding up) and disappears automatically when its HP recovers to more than half its maximum value.

The monster becomes frenzied and attacks indiscriminately and without regard for the consequences. In all melee attacks, the target is randomly selected from among possible targets, friend or foe. When declaring [üó®Cleave II], select 5 targets at random (or all of them if there are fewer than 5 suitable targets).

All melee attacks gain a +2 bonus to Accuracy checks and +4 points to damage. At the same time, the monster receives a -2 penalty on Evasion checks.

While this effect is in effect, this monster cannot use the [Recovery] Technique.

allmonsters.description:
Arbors are Barbarous that live deep within the forest. They resemble Humans but have white skin like snow and white or light green hair. They have large eye-like patterns on their forehead and all over their body.

Arbors are considered close relatives of Meria. Although they do not have flowers, their ecology and body structure are similar to those of the long-lived Meria. According to legend, during the War of the Gods, the trees in the forests that Dwarves burned to make large quantities of armor took human form with the hatred fueled by Ignis. Arbors especially hate Dwarves and are also enemies of Artificers, since their forests were massively cut down during the Magitech Civilization Period.

Arbors are skilled at spy missions and may engage in intelligence, reconnaissance, and sabotage in cooperation with Drakes and other Upper Barbarous (see ML p. 60).

They have a small number of soulscars and are not affected by Swords of Protection, so they may lead Ogres (see p. 83) to infiltrate the city. However, since Arbors themselves do not have the shapeshifting ability, it is relatively easy to detect their disguise. Even if they are discovered, Arbors are not only excellent sword-wielders, but also fearsome Fairy and Nature magic- users with the ability to make people feel the fire of rage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Magic (1 system) 5 Level / Magic Power 8 (15)
abilities.description:
An Arbor can cast either Fairy Magic or Nature Magic at the 5th level.

In the case of Fairy Magic, the types used are "Earth" and "Fire".

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Weapons of Raging Fire
abilities.description:
Sows weapons with its own angry fire. The Arbor empowers up to 5 targets within an area (3m radius) centered on itself with fire. Empowered targets now deal Fire-type damage, and their melee and ranged weapons are treated as magical weapons for 3 minutes (18 rounds), granting +2 points to physical damage (not magic damage).

Using this effect consumes 8 points of MP.

allmonsters.description:
This is the chief of the village of Arbors. At first glance, there is no difference from the young Arbor. However, their eye-like patterns have increased, and their skin shows bark-like cracks.

They are even more adept at magic, and their ability to control fire is also formidable.

In large Arbor villages, several elders may rule in the council. These settlements are very powerful and dangerous. The elders may serve as counselors to Drakes and other Upper Barbarous and are skilled at intelligence work.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Magic (1 system) 10 Level /Magic Power 13 (20)
abilities.description: Arbor Senior can cast either Fairy Magic or Nature Magic at the 10th level. In the case of Fairy Magic, the types used are "Earth" and "Fire".

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Metamagic/Targets],[Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Roaring Fire Armor
abilities.description:
Arbor cloaks in its rage themself and its surroundings in a suit of flaming armor. Up to 10 targets in 1 area (3m radius) around the Arbor Elder treat their weapons as fire-type magic weapons (that still deal physical damage) and gain +2 points of damage for 10 seconds (1 round). At the same time, the target's Defense is reduced by 12 points.

This effect can be used only once per round, and it costs 10 MP.

allmonsters.description:
This is an Arbor leader, an experienced member of the clan. The number of eye-like patterns on their body has been increasing with age, and they look more mischievous.

They lead the younger Arbors and Ogres in attacks and sabotage of Humanoid cities and strongholds.

They are skilled defenders and fire fighters, adept at surrounding their targets and ensuring that the job gets done.

They also seem to be able to mate with long-lived Meria, and long-lived Meria have been seen living together with Arbor Seniors in captivity.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Magic (1 system) 7 Level / Magic Power 10 (17)
abilities.description:
An Arbor Senior can cast either Fairy Magic or Nature Magic at 7th level.

In the case of Fairy Magic, the types used are "Earth" and "Fire".

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Hawk Eye], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Flame Shield
abilities.description: The Arbor Senior creates a wall of fire with his anger. It is placed in front of up to 5 targets within a 3m radius of the Arbor Senior, and the target gains +3 Defense for 3 minutes (18 rounds). Also, any character who uses a melee attack or "Range: Touch" effect against the target during the duration of this effect will receive 5 fire magic damage after the damage or effect applied. There is no resistance against this damage, but reducing magic damage and fire damage are effective.

allmonsters.description:
A Barbarous with a frail body but a plump abdomen. By pounding its belly like a gong, it boosts the morale of its surrounding comrades.

Its stomach contains a high density of crystallized mana, which it can explode at will.

abilities.title: ‚è©Stratagem & Maneuvers/1 Area (5m Radius)
abilities.description:
Can use [Surging Offense I] (Physical Damage +1).

Every third turn, uses [Maneuver: Unexpected Blow I] (Accuracy +2, Damage +2). If there are no characters eligible to be affected by a Stratagem, these abilities will not be used.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Self-Destruction/7 (14)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: "Range: Caster", "Target: 1 area (3m Radius)/5" deals 2d+5 Bludgeoning magic damage, and then the Areigo's HP becomes 0 and it dies.

loottable.loot: Explosive Reactant Crystal Debris (600G/Red Black A)
Fragment of Explosive Reactant Crystal (1600G/Red Black S)

allmonsters.description: An Areigo who holds the rank of leader. They are sometimes charged with giving orders and maintaining discipline with Barbarous legions, but it is rare that they are able to fully fulfill this role.

abilities.title: ‚è©Stratagem & Maneuvers/All Areas (30m Radius)
abilities.description:
Can use [Surging Offense II: Whirlwind] (Accuracy +1).

Every third turn uses [Maneuver: Unexpected Blow I] (Accuracy +2, Damage +2). If there are no characters eligible to be effected by a Stratagem, these abilities will not be used.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Self-Destruction/10 (17)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: "Range: Caster", "Target: 1 area (6m Radius)/20" deals 2d+8 Bludgeoning magic damage, and then the Areigo's HP becomes 0 and it dies.

loottable.loot: Explosive Reactant Crystal Debris (600G / Red Black A)
Fragment of Explosive Reactant Crystal (1600G / RedBlack S)

allmonsters.description: An Areigo Tactician. Areigo rarely command from the vanguard of the army, so it is considered to be the de facto highest rank amongst them.

abilities.title: ‚è©Stratagem & Maneuvers / All Areas (50m Radius)
abilities.description:
Can use [Surging Offense IV: Blaze] (+3 Physical Damage).

Every third turn uses [Maneuver: Unexpected Blow II] (Accuracy +4, Damage +4). If there are no characters eligible to be effected by a Stratagem, these abilities will not be used.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Life in Death / 15 (22) / Fortitude / Half
abilities.description: At "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (6m Radius) / 20, deals 2d+12 Bludgeoning magic damage. This ability can be used only once, and Areigo Daved HP is reduced to 1 HP after it is used.

loottable.loot: Noble Barbarous' Banner (5500G Red Green S)
Explosive Reactant Crystal Debris (600G / Red Black A)
Fragment of Explosive Reactant Crystal (1600G / Red Black S)

allmonsters.description: Argagis is a Daemon that resembles an armadillo covered with a hard shell. It is characterized by its extreme strength and sturdiness. Its defense is further strengthened by its rounded back, which forms a considerable sphere that crushes its enemies. It does not have a high intellect and often follows other Daemons as a guard.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If a monster successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: üó®Ball Roll
abilities.description: Argagis increases its Defense by +3 points and movement by +15m. At the same time, its damage is reduced by -3.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover I
abilities.description: Can use [Cover I] combat feat.

abilities.title: üó®All-Out Attack
abilities.description: A Slam can deal an additional 8 damage on its next attack. However, any Evasion check made by this section this turn receives a -3 penalty as a risk.

allmonsters.description: An arms-bearing merchant. They have learned a number of self-defense techniques to use against opponents, and make use of their wits to protect themselves when in danger.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Barricade
abilities.description:
Places an improvised obstacle in front of the merchant to hide for 10 seconds (1 round), granting +4 Defense, and rendering them unable to be targeted by ranged attacks or magic from a different area (Simplified Combat) or from a distance of 10m or greater (Standard/Advanced Combat). This improvised obstacle is treated as a Wooden Fence (thickness: 2cm) (see CR III, p. 122)

This ability can only be used once.

allmonsters.description:
Hoodlings are a small Youma common on the Alframe continent. They are ugly and have grayish skin. They have large heads, long, slender limbs, and walk with a forward slant.

They hate their look and hide by wearing hoods. Also, they hate beautiful things and especially enjoy killing Humans and Elves.

Arrow Hoodlings are armed with bows and prefer to surround their prey in groups, shooting and killing them all at once.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bow
abilities.description: Shooting Attack with a bow at "Range: 2 (20m)". Accuracy check and damage are the same as a normal attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

allmonsters.description: A high level marksman and Magitech user, with enough skill and attack power to slay foes with a preemptive strike. In combat, they prefer to split away from their allies and strike down their opponents from hidden vantage position.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic/Gunfire Aptitude
abilities.description: Knows [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], and [Hawk Eye] Combat Feats.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Gunfire / 16 (23) / Evasion / Negates
abilities.description: Performs a Ranged Attack using a gun with the following data (Name, req. Strength, etc. are omitted).

allmonsters.description:
The upper body of this fairy resembles a beautiful human female figure, while the lower body resembles that of a fish, similar to the mermaid in legends. They are often mistaken for humans, as they are often seen bathing in water.

These fairies possess the ability to freeze or slow down the movement of those who approach or touch them. This ability leads them to appear primarily at night, in order to avoid encounters with people.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater Specialization
abilities.description:
Can move in water without penalties and restrictions.

Conversely, all action checks are subject to a -2 penalty on the ground.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚óØCold Skin / Can't
abilities.description: A target attempting a melee attack against this monster and dealing damage suffers 1d+4 Water/Ice type magic damage after the damage is dealt

allmonsters.description:
These bandits carry weapons and attack merchants and travelers. If they go out in the wilds, they are called thugs or bandits; if they go out on the sea, they are pirates. This data represents those who use bows as weapons among them.

They are the lowest level in a large organization, but they may operate in groups of three to five people. Such small groups mainly target those with low protection and are unlikely to challenge strong or numerous enemies.

This data can also be used to represent lower level soldiers or villagers who use a bow.

abilities.title: ‚óØBow
abilities.description: An attack with a Bow is treated as a Shooting Attack with "Range: 2 (30m)".

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

allmonsters.description: This is a leader of bandits. They always have three to five men or priests with them. They fight with their weapons on the frontlines.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional +4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

allmonsters.description:
Armed with weapons, these thugs attack merchants and travelers. They are armed only with mundane one-handed melee weapons and crude leather armor.

This data can be used to represent lower-level soldiers, villagers with weapons, etc.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

allmonsters.description: A spirit that takes the appearance of a nude woman, Banniks are subservient fairies found around hot springs and other naturally occurring warm water. They only wish to see cleanliness and may even offer to create a hot spring in order to help travelers wash away dirt and grime. However, Banniks are known to become irrationally angry if someone dirty refuses to head to a hot spring and will lash out in anger.

abilities.title: ‚óØWater Body
abilities.description: Blunt weapons treat the Bannik's Defense as 3 points higher.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When Bannik is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: üó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Bannik can use the Combat Feat [Metamagic Distance].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Healing Hot Spring
abilities.description:
The Bannik can change water into a hot spring at the optimal temperature for bathing at a rate of 2 MP per 50 liters of water to be changed.

Soaking in the waters for an hour will recover 5 HP and MP, but staying longer than an hour will not recover any more

allmonsters.description: A Banshee is the vengeful spirit of a woman who died in sorrow after suffering a terrible betrayal, seeking to share her fate with others. Its screams can shake even the most stoic of adventurers, and it is said that death comes to those who've heard the wail of a Banshee. Though they tend to appear as a beautiful woman, Banshees turn as ugly as a mummy when unleashing their wail on others. Upon defeat, a Banshee will disappear entirely, leaving behind only beautiful crystals, physical remnants of their powerful emotions.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Banshee can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: üó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Banshee can use the Combat Feat [Universal Metamagic].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Maddening Scream/13 (20)/Willpower/ Negates
abilities.description:
The Banshee makes a high-pitched wail within "Range: Caster," causing everyone within a "Target: All Areas (20m Radius)/All" to go mad. A character affected by this effect must randomly select a target for their attacks, casting spells, and other effects. The character is free to choose actions, use Minor Actions, declare active combat feats, etc.

The target of an action taken by a frenzied character is chosen at random after checking possible targets by the range and other conditions just before the Skill Check for the action is taken. This effect lasts for 3 minutes (18 rounds), but it also disappears when the affected character inflicts a total of 45 points of applied damage to a character in their own faction. A character released from the effect of applied damage accumulation cannot receive the effect of [‚ñ∫Maddening Scream] for 1 day afterward (if the effect is released by any other method, it may receive the effect anew). If a character who has been affected by this effect is affected again, the duration of the effect is refreshed, but the accumulated applied damage is until the effect is removed as it is.

This effect is treated as Psychic type.

Banshee can use this ability only once per round.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
During the Magitech Civilization Period, the tactic of attacking from the air to the ground in large-scale field battles and sieges was devised, and the Barba series of Magitech was developed to realize this tactic.

It looks like a spider about 50 cm in length and moves by floating with a small air sac on its back. It holds a Bursting Shell between its legs, which it drops to attack a wide area.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bursting Shell Drop/6 (13)/Willpower/ Half
abilities.description:
The bursting shell is dropped on the top of the target.

With "Range: Caster," this attack deals 2d+5 Fire magic damage to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius)/5".

This ability can only be used once.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is a large Kagner specialized for transporting Maris Barba and capable of storing three Maris Barba.

It was assumed that Kagner would move to the vicinity of the operation area and launch Maris Barba to attack the base, but there is no record of its actual use in battle. The number of Barba Kagner found at ruins is extremely small, and they are also known as "phantom Magitechs."

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚óØGun
abilities.description: The Machine Gun is treated as a gun weapon with a "Range: 2 (20m)" and a maximum magazine of 3.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting & Hawk Eye
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur. It also can aim through skirmishes at targets on the other side.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Reload
abilities.description: Reloads bullet into the Machine Gun.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Maris Barba Launch
abilities.description:
One stored Maris Barba is launched. The launched Maris Barba appears in the same position (area, coordinate) as this monster and performs movement and actions starting next round.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns. It can be used up to 3 times.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Sprinkle Repair Liquid/Can't
abilities.description:
Applies Magitech restoring liquid to "Target: 1 Character" (including itself) with "Range: Touch," and if the target is a Magitech, its HP is restored by 2d+10 points.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØStranded
abilities.description: If the HP of the Cart section becomes 0 or less, the Right Side and Left Side receive a -4 penalty on Evasion checks.

loottable.loot: Trove of Magical Components (7,600G/Black White S)

allmonsters.description: This is an even larger version of the Dorn series, with a mobile mechanism attached to its base. It was prepared for combat, and there are records of its use in large-scale battles against Barbarous. Few still exist, and their remnants are sometimes found in ruins or Barbarous territory.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: üó®Red-hot Blade
abilities.description: Blade becomes red-hot. If the attack hits, the damage dealt will be fire type, and the target's Defense will be treated as halved (rounded up).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Hammer Throw & Pull Back/7 (14)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description:
It can throw a hammer and immediately pull it back.

With "Target: 1 Character" and "Range/Area: 1 (10m)/ Shot" deals 2d+7 physical damage.

The section that uses this ability takes a -1 penalty to its Evasion check until the beginning of its next turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØSlalom Drive
abilities.description: Wheel attacks can be made on up to two targets at the same time; Accuracy checks are made only once at a time, and damage should be determined individually.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Random Drive
abilities.description:
Until the beginning of the next turn, the Right Side and Left Side gain a +2 bonus to Evasion checks.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description:
Barusa Biyone is an upper Daemon that takes the form of an upright white bear wearing black full-body armor. It stands 7 meters tall and has glowing red eyes, like a bright fire.

Legend has it that it lived in a frozen place in the Daemon world where everything was at absolute zero, which may explain its preference for silence (oddly enough, the armor that covers its entire body makes no sound). If anything disturbs the silence, it will attack mercilessly.

Barusa Biyone is immensely confident in its armor and is accustomed to mocking those who cannot break it, treating them like small insects. However, if an enemy manages to break its armor, Barusa Biyone will acknowledge them and destroy them first.

abilities.title: ‚óØMargin of Strength
abilities.description: The [‚ñ∫Blizzard Breath], [üó®Power Strike II], and [‚è©Mobile Form] abilities are not used until any section has less than 100 HP.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Blizzard Breath/18 (25)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
The Barusa Biyone vomits a mass of cold air with "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/ Shot" in "Target: 1 area (Radius 6m)/20", dealing 2d+20 Water/Ice magic damage.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Soul Freezing Roar/17 (24)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Barusa Biyone lets out a soul-chilling roar, terrifying everone within "Range: Caster" "Target: All Areas (Radius 30m)/All". The target must move farther than 30 meters from Barusa Biyone if possible, or if movement is not enough, Full Move to get as far away as possible. Any affected character in a skirmish must always declare to withdraw. The affected targets cannot attack Barusa Biyone with melee or ranged attacks, nor can it be directly targeted by the "Target: 1 Character" magic or effects.

This effect lasts only for 10 seconds (1 round) and is Psychic type.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike II
abilities.description: A Barusa Biyone can deal an additional +12 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Barusa Biyone can make two Iron Claws attacks each round. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚è©Mobile Form
abilities.description:
The armor covering the entire body transforms, making it easier to move and attack. The Body section gains a +4 bonus for Accuracy, Evasion, and +4 for Damage. At the same time, Defense is reduced by -10.

This unique skill, once used, cannot be deactivated until the combat is over.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible, +4 & +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Barusa Biyone's size precludes attacks. The Head section cannot be the target of melee attacks and gains a +4 bonus on Evasion checks against ranged attacks.

The Body section receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

When the Legs fall to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Basilisk, Drakish, Youma, Arcana
allmonsters.description:
Indistinguishable from Humans at first glance, a Basilisk is a Barbarous with the power of petrification. Basilisks often wear blindfolds to suppress their petrifying gaze until they find the right target.

Even then, the petrifying gaze can be used through the blindfold.

Often found in deserts, they collect various lesser Barbarous as followers and enslaved people, though they have a rivalry with Drakes regarding who is stronger.

Petrified animal fragments and other debris are often found near the Basilisk's birthplace.

For the Monstrous form of this monster, see Basilisk (Monstrous Form).

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Universal Metamagic], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚è©Petrifying Gaze/9 (16)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 50m / Target", it stares at the enemy and gives the effect of Petrifaction (Dexterity or Agility/-6).

If the target of this unique skill is the one who holds the mirror, and if their Willpower's success value is 4 or more points higher than the Target Number, the gaze can bounce off them back to the Basilisk, always affecting them without a check even if the Basilisk is blindfolded. This unique skill is of Curse type.

This unique skill can be used only once per round.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison Blood/11 (18)/Fortitude/Neg
abilities.description: Anyone who deals damage to this monster in the same skirmish will receive 2d Poison magic damage at the end of their turn.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Monstrous Form
abilities.description:
The monster transforms into its monstrous form. For data on the monstrous form, see Basilisk (Monstrous Form). HP and MP are restored to their maximum values, and all effects of spells and the like are removed. When [‚ñ∫Monstrous Form] was activated, only the Body section is treated as if it made a Major Action. The Head section may still take a Major Action on this turn. Also, the Evil Eye can use [‚è©Petrifying Gaze] if it has not already used it for its turn.

[‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after using [‚ñ∫Monstrous Form].

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Basilisk, Drakish, Youma, Arcana
allmonsters.description:
The true identity of a Basilisk, this eight-legged beast looks like a lizard 5m long. While the Basilisk's intelligence and speed are a little lower in this form, the ability to petrify foes has increased, making the Basilisk even more dangerous.

Most Basilisks feel that this form is quite ugly and hate being seen by others in this form. As such, they will almost certainly try to kill or petrify those who see this hideous form.

For the Human form of this monster, see Basilisk (Human Form).

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison Blood/12 (19)/Fortitude/Neg
abilities.description: It is the same as the unique skill of Basilisk (Human Form), except for a different target number.

abilities.title: ‚è©Petrifying Gaze/10 (17)/Willpower/Neg
abilities.description: It is the same as the unique petrifaction skill of Basilisk (Human Form), except for a different target number.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Universal Metamagic], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Humanification
abilities.description:
It instantly transforms into Human form. Refer to Basilisk (Human Form) for data on the Human form. If the Body section has suffered HP or MP damage or has been affected by magic or other effects, these are carried over to the Human form. If its HP is less than 0, it immediately falls unconscious.

[‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after using [‚ñ∫Monstrous Form].

abilities.title: ‚óØWeakening
abilities.description: When the Body section is reduced to 0 HP or fewer, the Evil Eye and Head sections of the Basilisk (Monstrous Form) receive a -2 penalty for Evasion.

allmonsters.description:
This Magitech is a guard for important places and objects, shaped like a humanoid with a series of small and large cylindrical cans awkwardly interlinked together.

If anything approaches the place or thing it is guarding, it warns in Magitech, and if the warning is not heeded, it will attack to subdue it.

abilities.title: ‚è©Shock Baton
abilities.description:
For 10 seconds (1 round), attacks are treated as Lightning magical weapon attacks and deal +4 damage.

While this skill is active, a Death Check made by any character reduced to 0 or lower HP by a weapon attack from the Beep ARC will not fail, except if double 1s are rolled.

Using this ability consumes 2 points of MP.

abilities.title: ‚óØLow Power Operation
abilities.description: If the Beep ARC's MP becomes 0, both its Accuracy and Evasion receive a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

loottable.loot: Crude Magitech Components (100G / Black White A)

allmonsters.description:
A Belladonna appears at first glance to be a green-skinned Humanoid, but upon closer investigation is actually a plant whose vines have been so entwined with each other they can take the shape of a human. By taking a humanoid shape, the Belladonna can move much more easily to attack prey and will drain nutrients from anything it has killed, animal or otherwise. It will also hide in forests, using its plant body to disguise itself before surprising prey.

The vines of a Belladonna contain a horrific poison, causing high fevers, nausea, and even death from just a touch. However, the leaves from the Belladonna's vines can be turned into an antidote for this contact poison, so it is recommended to slay the Belladonna before the poison spreads throughout the victim's body.

abilities.title: ‚óØPersistent Poison/16 (23)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
If the Belladonna melee attack hits, the target will be poisoned.

A character affected by poison immediately suffers 2d Poison magic damage and continues to suffer similar damage every hour (without Fortitude checks). This effect persists unless the poison is removed, but it is not cumulative.

The Belladonna Leaves characters can get when they kill this monster contains a counterpoison that can remove the effects of this poison without contested checks. One leaf can heal 1 person.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Snaring Vines/14 (21)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
As a Major Action, the Belladonna can use its Vine to ensnare a target in the same skirmish. If the target fails to resist, they are ensnared, unable to move, and receive a -4 penalty to Evasion checks.

When the target tries to escape, use the de-bonding rules.

The monster has a large number of vines, and even if it has already entangled a character with [‚ñ∫Snaring Vines], it can still make a Melee Attack or a new [‚ñ∫Snaring Vines], regardless of the number of vines, even if it has already entangled a character with [‚ñ∫Snaring Vines].

allmonsters.description: This plant hides on the ground, similar to Needle Archers. However, the needles launched by Big Archers are much more resilient and can carry a couple of different debilitating poisons as well.

abilities.title: ‚óØVine Network
abilities.description:
A Big Archer has thin vines stretching out 2-3 Areas (10m Radius) around itself. If characters don't successfully make a Danger Sense check against Target Number of 16, they will step into it unknowingly and become surprised by Big Archer.

In the event of a Surprise attack, the Big Archer is placed in the Frontline Area in Simplified Combat. In Standard and Advanced Combat, all PCs are placed within a 10m radius of the monster.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlying Needles
abilities.description: A Needle attack can also be performed as a shooting attack with "Range: 1 (10m)."

abilities.title: ‚óØNo Blind Spot
abilities.description: Within the [‚óØVine Network], a Big Archer can ignore shielding (Standard/Advanced Combat) with Needle attacks, and will not suffer Stray Shots if it shoots into the skirmish.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison Needles / 8 (15) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
The Big Archer has two possible poisons it can use with its Needles. If the Big Archer deals 1 or more applied damage with their Needle attack, the target must immediately make a Fortitude check.

Rotting Poison: If the target fails to resist, they receive an extra 7 Poison-type damage.

Paralyzing Poison: If the target fails to resist, they receive a -2 penalty to Accuracy and Evasion checks for 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is not cumulative.

abilities.title: üó®Million Needles
abilities.description: A Big Archer may attack all characters (enemies and allies) within range of the [‚óØVine Network] simultaneously during its turn.

allmonsters.description:
It is a small magical machine, about the size of a small bag, that also serves as an alarm beacon. Floating at low speeds, they emit a loud alarm if they detect an intruder. They come in a variety of shapes, but most are cone or triangular pyramids with a tapered end.

There are often cases where multiple Bits accompany other Magitech machines to provide support.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Blitz / 2 (9) / Fortitude / Half
abilities.description: Fires an electric shock at "Target: 1 Character" within "Range: Touch," dealing 2d-2 Lightning magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

loottable.loot: Old Recording Device (100G / Black White A)

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Regional Dialect, Learned Magic Language
allmonsters.description: A Humanoid archer who prefers black clothing in order to fade into the shadows of the night. They have some experience in combat and are quite threatening when firing from the rearguard. If precautions are not taken, adventurers could find themselves facing unexpected difficulties in dealing with them.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

abilities.title: ‚óØBow
abilities.description: Attacks with a Bow are treated as Ranged Attacks with Range 2 (30m).

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

abilities.title: ‚è©Technique
abilities.description: Can use the Techniques [Cat's Eyes] and [Bear Muscle].

allmonsters.description:
This fairy has a shadowy texture and takes the form of a hound. It stands about 2m tall and is more proficient in melee attacks than Fairy Magic.

It can communicate with others in Sylvan, but it tends to make others uncomfortable with sarcastic remarks.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: Can make two Bite attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +7 points

allmonsters.description:
It is a small ferret whose entire body is covered with steel gray body hair. The fur is as sharp as a blade, and can slice through skin just by touching it. The ferret's front paws are covered with stiff hairs that resemble blades. The ferret will attack its prey as it passes by, capturing it when it is vulnerable.

They are ferocious for their size and will attack large opponents without regard to their size in order to protect their territory.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫3 Attacks (Flexible)
abilities.description: The monster uses multiple weapons and makes three attacks in one round. After making one attack the monster can choose whether to make the next attack on the same target or on a different target of their choice.

abilities.title: ‚óØSleeping Poison / 13 (20) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
If the Paw Blade attack hits, the target is put to sleep. This effect is of the Poison type, and countermeasures against Poison are effective.

After the target falls asleep, the effect is also treated as a Psychic type. It is possible to bring the target back to consciousness with the [Sanity] spell. However, since this effect is not a Psychic type (Weak), the target cannot be simply woken up using Major Action.

allmonsters.description:
This huge elephant-like animal continuously emits fire from its entire body and stands about 6 meters tall. It is adapted to volcanic regions, and the fire on its skin is not emitted from its own body but is ignited by rubbing its body against the surrounding magma to keep the fire going.

When angered, they secrete a viscous liquid from their skin, increasing the intensity of their flames.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fire Shower/19 (26)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Raising its snout high, it blows fireballs. The fireball deals 2d+25 fire magic damage to "Target: 1 area(3m Radius/5" within "Range: Caster."

This ability can only be used once every 20 seconds (2 rounds).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Throw/17 (24)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: The Blazing Mammoth attempts to grab a "Target: 1 Character" within "Range: Touch." If successful, the target is thrown to the rearguard area of their faction (Simplified Combat) or in any direction chosen by this monster at 30m (Standard Combat) and falls down, taking 45 points of fall damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Blazing Mammoth's height prevents enemies from attacking its head.

The Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. This effect disappears when the Body section falls to 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Trample with Both Feet
abilities.description: The Blazing Mammoth may Trample twice during the same turn but must attack two different characters.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlame-clad/Can't
abilities.description:
The body surface of the Body section is always covered with fire. Any character in the same position (area, coordinate) as this monster will receive 6 fire magic damage at the end of this monster's turn.

This ability is lost when the HP of the Body section becomes less than 0.

abilities.title: ‚è©Burning Rage
abilities.description:
The damage caused by [‚óØFlame-clad] is increased by +2 points for 3 minutes (18 rounds). This bonus is accumulated up to 3 times (max +6 points).

To use this ability, the monster must spend 5 points of HP. Also, it can use this ability only once per round.

loottable.loot: Crimson Lotus Ivory Tusk (6,600G/Gold Red S)

allmonsters.description: A Blob is a translucent, light-green jelly that is highly acidic to the point of being able to dissolve metal. Originally the result of a magical experiment gone wrong, it now mindlessly divides itself to increase its population. Occasionally, an expiring Blob will release a harmless miniature version of itself without the acidity. This "mini-Blob" can be taken as a pet.

abilities.title: ‚óØEngulf / 7 (14) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
If a Slam attack hits, the Blob engulfs the target into its body. The target cannot move or perform any Major Actions and suffers 2d+1 magic damage at the end of each of the monster's turns.

An engulfed target can only perform one Fortitude Check on its turn, and if it sÏ≥Æds, it can escape. After this check, the target's turn ends immediately, regardless of the result.

abilities.title: ‚óØSoft Body
abilities.description: Bludgeoning weapons treat the Defense of Blob section as 5 points higher. Also, Throw or similar attacks deal no damage and have no effect.

abilities.title: ‚óØAcidic Body
abilities.description: Anyone who attacks or receives an attack from a Blob will have their weapon or armor dissolve into nothing after 24 hours. This can be avoided by washing the affected weapon or armor with alcohol or wine within that 24 hours.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
A person drained by a Lesser Vampire then revived into a subservient unlife, a Blood Sucker is still a dangerous monster to encounter.

With pale skin and bloody eyes, they lack the grace of their sires and stand out as something unnatural. Their memories are distorted. They will attack humans and animals alike to stave off hunger and thirst.

Due to their vulnerability to sunlight, Blood Suckers move and attack solely at night.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If a Blood Sucker successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚è©Gaze/7 (14)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Blood Suckers may attempt to paralyze with "Target: 1 Character" within "Range/Area: 50m / Target". If the target fails to resist the Gaze, they are paralyzed for 10 seconds (1 round) and cannot take any Minor Actions or active combat feats.

This unique skill can be used only once per round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Vampire Bite/7 (14)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: The Blood Sucker bites a target in the same skirmish, dealing 2d+4 Physical damage. The Blood Sucker heals HP equal to the applied damage dealt.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 3 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Blood Sucker recovers 3 HP. This has no effect if the Blood Sucker is at 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØVampire Body
abilities.description: As long as a Blood Sucker is under sunlight, it takes 6 magic damage at the end of its turn and receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks. This damage cannot be reduced in any way, and the Blood Sucker cannot use their [‚óØRegeneration] unique skill.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description: This is an irregularly shaped mass of reddish-black liquid. It is believed to be the result of the thoughts of people who have sunk into bottomless swamps. The liquid moves about and constantly changes its shape. It can harm living beings due to its toxic composition.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttitude Control
abilities.description: It does not fall prone under any effect.

abilities.title: ‚óØMorphogenesis
abilities.description:
It is constantly wriggling and changing its form.

At the beginning of its turn, roll 1d, and for 10 seconds (1 round), the damage is increased by the rolled value, and Defense is decreased by the rolled value.

abilities.title: ‚è©Blood Strike/10 (18)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: Within "Range: Touch", Blood Swamp showers "Target: 1 Character" with his/her own blood, dealing 2d magic damage and blinding it for 3 minutes (18 rounds). This effect is Poison type. This effect can be used only once per 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
They are upper-level Dark Trolls and are in charge of leading the Trolls. They are always ready to fight without compromise to not disappoint their enemies.

Fighting is the highest priority in their life, and they teach other Trolls how to fight and defeat any opponent.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Blood Troll can use the Combat Feats [Metamagic/Targets], Multi-Action, and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: üó® Mana Strike = +17 damage
abilities.description: A Blood Troll may deal an additional +17 damage to their next melee attack. If they do, at risk, they receive a -2 penalty to Fortitude and Willpower checks until their next turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØDark Regeneration = 10 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Blood Troll recovers 10 HP. This has no effect if the Blood Troll is at 0 HP or lower or is under sunlight.

abilities.title: ‚óØWeakened
abilities.description: As long as a Blood Troll is under sunlight, it receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks.

allmonsters.description:
Bloodlings are a species of Blood Suckers created by Nosferatu, but it is clearly an inferior species. When Bloodlings are born, only a certain percentage of them survive, and the reason for this is unclear.

Bloodlings take on the form of a human with bat wings for arms. At night, they fly around, emitting a high-pitched, sad cry, targeting the weakest enemies.

Nosferatu can be expected to be nearby wherever these creatures are found.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Vampire Bite/4 (11)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: Bites an enemy character in the skirmish in which it resides, dealing 2d-1 physical damage. The Bloodling heals HP equal to the applied damage dealt.

abilities.title: ‚óØVampire Body
abilities.description: As long as a Bloodling is under sunlight, it takes 3 magic damage at the end of its turn and receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Bloodling receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
Plants with large petals as red as blood, these root-less plants will chase prey down, albeit slowly. Also referred to as "flesh-eating flowers," these plants will capture both animals and Humanoids alike, slowly dissolving their prey for nutrition.

If the flower is in full bloom and fed a healthy amount of blood, the petals of the plant can be distilled into quality medicine. Rarely a few fruits of the bloody petal can be found as well.

This monster has only one Trunk but has 3 to 5 Petals. The GM can use 2 + (half of 1d) to randomly determine the amount of Petals, if necessary.

Hoodlings like to feed Humanoids to these flowers and may lure them in by pretending to flee.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 5 points
abilities.description:
