At the end of each round, the Body and all remaining Petal sections recover 5 HP. If a Petal has 0 or less HP, it has no effect on this unique skill.

If the Body has 0 or less HP, this effect disappears.

abilities.title: ‚óØParalysis Poison/7 (14)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
If a Petal attack hits, the target suffers a -1 penalty to Accuracy and Evasion check for 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is not cumulative.

This effect is of the Poison type.

allmonsters.description:
Bolgs are Barbarous Youma which are larger, stronger, and hairier than Humans.

They have bluish skin, and most of their body hair is white. They are characterized by their large fangs and ferocious nature.

They prefer swords, spears, long-handled weapons, etc. Their intellect is low, they love a fight, and they will fight to the death because they believe they can turn the tables no matter how unfavorable the odds are.

They are also good at training animals and mounts and can force a mount or other inferior Barbarous to serve them.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

allmonsters.description: This is a Bolg Youma assassin who specializes in fast attacks. Their role is to target and strike the key commanders of the enemy army.

abilities.title: ‚óØFast Action
abilities.description: During the first round of combat, if the monster wins initiative, it may take two Major Actions that round.

abilities.title: ‚óØShadow Sneak
abilities.description: Can leave, pass through skirmishes without movement blocking and Prepare to Withdraw action.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Double Attack
abilities.description: It can attack the same target twice in one action with its Weapon.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

allmonsters.description: These are heavily-armed warriors of the Bolg tribe of Youma. Armed with a shield and a greatsword, they will do their best to crush their enemies without fear of being wounded.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional 4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

allmonsters.description:
These are the leaders of a small group of Bolg Youma tribesmen.

Armed with a two-handed greatsword, they exhibit overwhelming combat prowess.

They make their home in underground labyrinths and ruins and repeatedly attack Human settlements. Bolgs believe that the bigger the weapon, the stronger they are, and they are more daring and bold in their fighting style.

abilities.title: üó®Repeated Strike I
abilities.description: Can make two Accuracy checks; if one hits, the damage is dealt once.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Bolg Youma fighter who has trained their body to the utmost limit and is filled with a strong presence beyond ordinary people's reach. Although they are hand-to-hand fighters, it is said that they can do more than an ordinary army just alone, and they are trusted by the upper Barbarous as a trump card in local battles.

Bolg Suppressors specialize in striking enemies with the heels of their palms, knocking them down in the process. They then look down fiercely at their fallen opponent, defeating their spirit.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: Can make two Fist attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØCounter
abilities.description: This is the same effect as the combat feat [Counter].

abilities.title: ‚óØCrushing Palm Strike (Fall)/17 (24)/Fortitude/Neg
abilities.description: If the target is hit by a Fist attack, the target will fall prone on failed Fortitude check.

abilities.title: ‚óØCrushing Palm Strike (Withering)/17 (24)/Willpower/Neg
abilities.description: If the target is hit by a Fist attack and fails the Willpower check, the target may not speak or declare any Minor Action or active combat feats for the next 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is of the psychic type.

abilities.title: ‚è©Pressure Point/17 (24)/Willpower/Neg
abilities.description:
Roll 1d. Bolg Suppressor hits the target with its powerful aura, receiving 10 fixed damage to its MP if it rolls "1-3" and to its HP if it rolls "4-6".

This effect can be used only once in 10 seconds (1 round) and consumes 10 points of its own MP when used.

allmonsters.description: This is a golem made from the bones of an animal, and all that remains is the skeleton of the original animal.

abilities.title: ‚óØBone Body
abilities.description:
Bone Animal is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.description:
Tiger's Eye Rivet (Small) (150) (‚óØContinuous Attack)

Spinel Horn (Small) (150) (‚ñ∫Charge)

allmonsters.description: A Bone Hound is an Undead grotesque quadruped. Its body is stripped of flesh, except for the face, the only remaining part. The skeletal creature is unnervingly agile and emits poison from its face, which still clings to putrid flesh.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Poison Breath/6 (13)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 1 (10m)/Shot," spits poison at "Target: 1 Character", dealing 2d+2 poison magic damage.

This effect cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description: The monster can use its tail to attack up to 3 targets in the same skirmish. This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description: At first glance, this appears to be a mounted knight in armor. However, as the Bone Knight draws near, it's easy to see the skull peering out of the armor, its malice towards the living almost tangible. An old knight from the Magic Civilization age is searching for their lost lord and will let nothing get in their way. Though dead for a while, a Bone Knight's swordsmanship and magical prowess remain as sharp as they were, making the undead knight a truly fearsome foe.

abilities.title: ‚óØNormal Weapon Immunity, ‚óØPoison Immunity, ‚óØDisease Immunity, ‚óØPsychic Type (Weak) Immunity

Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], and [Universal Metamagic].

abilities.description:
The enormity of the Horse prevents foes from attacking the Knight.

The Rider receives a +2 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. When the Horse falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

allmonsters.description:
This is a monstrous bird without feathers, with a wingspan of an adult of 7 to 10 meters. It has a reptilian-like body and is said to be a kind of pterosaur. They are ferocious; when they catch their prey, they go on a rampage and kill, pecking it. After the meal, it often becomes a paradise for carrion-eating animals. Such animals can be seen running in flocks on the ground, following this monster bird soaring in the sky.

Its membrane is prized as a material for leather goods.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Gale Breath/11 (18)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 2 (30m) / Shot", it exhales a violent wind in "1 area (3m Radius) / 5", dealing 2d+8 wind magic damage to the target.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
The monster can use its tail to attack up to 5 targets in the same skirmish. An Accuracy check is made on all characters at once, and damage is determined individually.

This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ Impossible
abilities.description:
Its body hinders attacks on the head.

The Head section cannot be attacked, whether melee or ranged. When the Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight II
abilities.description:
All sections receive a +2 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

This unique skill is lost if the Wing section is reduced to 0 or less HP.

allmonsters.description: This bird-shaped golem is made by layering thin sheets of brass.

abilities.title: ‚óØBrass Body
abilities.description: A Brasswing is immune to criticals from edged weapons and all magic damage, except for Energy-type damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description:
A Brasswing receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.description:
Bright Red Ruby (Medium) (1,600)

‚ñ∫Flame Breath/8 (15)/Fortitude/Half

Golem spits out the fire with "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot" and "Target: 1 area (3m Radius)/5," dealing 2d+6 Fire magic damage. This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns. It also cannot be used on the turn immediately after using [‚ñ∫Lightning].

Amethyst of Purple Lightning (Medium) (1,600)

‚ñ∫Lightning/8 (15)/Fortitude/Half

Golem unleashes an electrical bolt with "Range/Area: 30m/Line", dealing 2d+6 Lightning magic damage to the target. This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns. It also cannot be used on the turn immediately after using [‚ñ∫Flame Breath].

abilities.description:
The Bronze Golem is immune to criticals from edged weapons and all non-Energy-type Magic damage.

[[div class="golemitems"]]

allmonsters.description:
A giant monster about 1m in diameter, a Buckbaird has one giant eye in the front and many much smaller eyes around its body. It's covered in fine black fur and floats using a mysterious power. The front eye has incredible magical power and can fire five different rays at targets in front of it. Due to the structure of the eye, only one ray can be used at a time. In combat, the Buckbaird combines the usage of these rays with incredibly fast tackling attacks, making it dangerous both in melee and at a range.

There are many mysteries about the ecology of the Buckbaird, and it is thought that they are the creation of some mad wizard during the Magic Civilization period. However, their origin and diet are unknown, and even their thoughts and possible breeding habits are an absolute mystery. What little is known is they enjoy the spaces in underground labyrinths.

Although it can speak Arcana for guidance, it is unable to communicate and speaks a stream of unintelligible gibberish one-sidedly.

abilities.title: ‚óØTriple Attack & Inconsistent
abilities.description: Buckbaird can take three Major Actions in one round. They are chosen randomly from among Slams and five types of eye rays.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Eye Ray/15 (22)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
With "Range: 20m" and "Area: Shot," a ray of light is shot from the magic eye at one enemy character. Buckbaird has five types of rays. A character cannot be targeted by more than one Eye Ray but can be targeted by Slams and one Eye Ray.

1: Paralyzing Ray

The target reduces their Dexterity and Agility by 12 points (to a minimum of 0) for 30 seconds (3 rounds). For fixed value characters, each paralyzing ray adds a -2 penalty to Accuracy and Evasion checks, respectively. This effect is cumulative.

2: Sleep Ray

The target falls into a deep sleep for 3 hours. This effect is Psychic type. Target cannot be woken up by normal means. This effect can be dispelled via magic means by contested check.

3: Frost Ray

Frost Ray deals 2d+20 Water/Ice damage to the target.

4: Brainwashing Ray

Those affected will follow the Buckbaird's orders and move to protect it for the next one minute (6 rounds). Orders given cannot be harmful to the target. Without a specific command, the target will act to protect the Buckbaird. This effect is Psychic type.

5: Rust Ray

Those affected lose all metal objects of A-Rank or lower, including weapons, armor, shields, and accessories.

S-Rank metal objects, as well as those from the Magic Civilization and earlier, remain unaffected.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight

allmonsters.description:
This Daemon has long arms, a burly body, and large horns on its head. They are as tall as 5 meters, and their arms are as thick and sturdy as logs.

Bugaradre's poisons, which are released from his shoulders, have the power to destroy anything and everything. Almost anything except stone and metal will melt away and turn into a swamp. This swamp will have the same poisonous gas as Bugaradre itself.

Bugaradre feels compelled to expand the swamp, moving about it and corrupting its surroundings. One unchecked Bugaradre can destroy a nation.

Once a swamp has been created, it can only be patiently purified with [Cure Poison] or [Purification], or it will recover naturally in decades or centuries.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Putrid Poison Shell / 13 (20) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
Fires projectiles filled with deadly poison from the humps on both its shoulders within "Range/Area: 2 (30m) / Shot", scattering poisonous liquid in "Target: 1 Area (6m radius / 20)". A struck target receives 2d+5 points of Poison magic damage for every Normal Move, Full Move, and Major Action it performs thereafter (without Fortitude checks). This effect is of the Poison type, permanent, and is not cumulative.

The Demon's Detoxification Gland loot received from this monster automatically removes the effect of the poison (one gland per person).

Bugaradre cannot be used against melee attacks or ranged attacks that have multiple targets at the same time.

This magical device was created as a "dream food table" in the Magic Civilization Period. Underneath the four-legged rectangular table, storage is installed to store foodstuffs. The table is equipped with a long, thin arm that serves the food to the table.

Many of those that remain today have malfunctioned. It restrains those seated and does not release them until all the food that appears endlessly has been consumed. Those who try to force their way out or harm them are punished with serving arms and stored in the storage as food for the next visitor. Malfunctioning storage will also most likely lose its ability to keep food fresh.

allmonsters.description:
A Catoblepas is a mythical beast about 3 meters long with the head of a pig and the body of a buffalo. Its eyes are iridescent and shiny, and it petrifies people by looking at them, regardless of their intentions. It can sense its surroundings even while blinded, so it usually lives with its eyes closed.

Self-righteous and solitary, it regards anyone who approaches them as an enemy. Its skin has power that repels evil, and in rare cases, the effect remains even after death and can be sold for a high price.

Catoblepas stares at 1 character with "Range/Area: 2 (50m) / Target". On failed save target is petrified (Dexterity, Agility/-6) (see ML p. 71).

This effect is treated as a Curse type.

This unique skill can be used up to twice per round, but targets must be different.

Despite their youth, Centaur Impalers are the equivalent of knights in their hierarchy and will often have subordinates following their commands. In combat, a Centaur Impaler will often seek out and fight the most potent enemy in the skirmish, looking to prove themselves in battle.

allmonsters.description: A three-headed daemon dog, a Cerberus is really more the size of a horse. Able to conjure up breath weapons of fire, ice, and poison, it can be a dangerous foe in combat. Also known as the Watchdog of Hell, Cerberuses are typically seen guarding something, whether the entrance to a labyrinth, a vault inside, or something else. While its intelligence is that of an average dog's, a Cerberus will remain loyal to its orders and will fight to the death to carry them out.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Three Breaths
abilities.description:
Its mouth spits one of the following breaths: Fire Breath, Blizzard Breath, or Noxious Breath. All of them have "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (6m Radius)/20" around the head.

The Head can choose any breath to use (or whether to attack with Bite without using breath). If more than one head breathes the same kind of breath, it is treated as a single attack with increased success value. If two heads breathe the same breath, the breath's success value has a +2 bonus, and the calculated damage is increased by +4. If all three heads breathe the same breath, the success value has a bonus of +4, and the calculated damage is increased by +8.

1: Fire Breath/11 (18)/Fortitude/Half

Head exhales fire, dealing 2d+12 Fire magic damage to the affected targets.

2: Blizzard Breath/10 (17)/Fortitude/Half

Head spits out a blizzard, dealing 2d+8 Water/Ice magic damage to the targets and reducing their Defense by -5 points for 30 seconds (3 rounds). This Defense reduction is non-cumulative and does not reduce Defense below 0.

3: Noxious Breath/9 (16)/Fortitude/Half

Head spits poison, inflicting 2d+6 Poison magic damage to the targets, and each target incurs a -3 penalty to their Evasion checks for 30 seconds (3 rounds). This effect is not cumulative.

These are palm-sized rocks found at Magic Civilization Period sites, etc. They are monsters that were moved out of the ground during the mining of mako stone, etc. They were called scrap stones or cheap stones and were considered of little or no value.

When a creature with mana approaches, it may start to move. It does not fly but only rolls and scoots along the ground.

They have no purpose for their behavior but move around and sometimes bump into each other. However, they are sometimes found clustered together in piles of soil, and there have been sightings of them gathering at the feet of people in ruins.

allmonsters.sections: 5 (Lion's Head / Goat's Head / Dragon's Head / Body / Wings)
allmonsters.description:
Chimera is fearsome in appearance, with the heads of a lion, goat, and dragon, the body of a snake used for a tail, and the wings of a massive bat on its back. Their origin is unclear, but it can only be assumed that a crazed wizard from the Magic Civilization period came up with this beast as part of some deranged experiment.

With multiple heads comes incredible intelligence, and Chimeras excel in cunning strategy. They are also ruthless and will offer hope to their opponents only to snatch it away at the last second. Chimeras also tend to have Undead and Constructs under their control and will have each head sleep at different times, making them formidable opponents to take advantage of. However, Chimeras tend to be overconfident, and it is said that this hubris may be their downfall.

abilities.description:
If the Snake's Bite attack hits and deals at least 1 point of applied damage, the target's Accuracy check will be reduced by -2. This effect is not cumulative.

This effect is treated as a Curse type and is permanent. This effect can be removed with a spell such as [Remove Curse], but it is also automatically removed if the Body section of the Chimera that bestowed the curse falls to 0 HP or less.

allmonsters.description:
This fairy is approximately 30cm tall and resembles a human child wearing a pointy hat. They have a cheerful and friendly demeanor and excel at using a hammer that is larger than their own body length to build and break things.

They have a fondness for searching for treasures, often found in caves.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.description:
Upon leaving, the summoner and their companions are granted good luck.

If present at the end of the combat, all characters in the summoner's faction gain +1 on the 2d Loot Determination roll for 10 minutes (60 rounds).

This effect is automatically applied at the end of the battle, but it will not be applied unless the current value of this monster's MP is 15 points or more

allmonsters.description: This large lizard is frequently spotted at the seashore. It is well-suited to saltwater environments and can often be seen swimming in shallow waters. Although it can survive in freshwater, it may also migrate upstream beyond brackish water areas in certain cases. These lizards are carnivorous and will attack anything they encounter, often causing damage to seaside towns and villages.

Resembling a giant chicken with the legs and tail of a lizard, a Cockatrice is a dangerous beast, able to petrify anyone with its beak. Standing taller than most humanoids, Cockatrices are often hostile to anyone they perceive as threatening them or their nest. However, they absolutely hate Basilisks with every fiber of their being and will break off combat with others to attack one on sight.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack II
abilities.description: If a monster successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack. It can make a third attack against the same target if a second attack hits.

abilities.title: ‚óØPetrifying Beak/11 (18)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
If the Beak attack hits, the target becomes Petrified (Agility-12) (see ML p. 71).

This effect is the Curse type.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Beetleskin], [Meditation], and [Recovery (5 points)] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Cockatrice receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

allmonsters.description: The monster is a spiral-shaped, thick vine. It moves by leaping and expanding itself like a spring. It usually wraps around the trunks of other large trees and is considered a threat on offense. It can convert its elasticity into striking power.

abilities.title: ‚óØElasticity
abilities.description: On a successful Evasion check against melee attacks, the Coiled Ivy gains +3 damage points on its next turn. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description: This is a subspecies of Medusa that appears to have a body made entirely of translucent ice. Its snake hair has white scales, and it prefers to wear white garments. These creatures inhabit cold regions, such as snowfields and ice-covered caves, and are known as "Evil Spirits of the Snow" in some areas.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Cold Medusa is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØMelting Fangs
abilities.description: If the target receives 1 or more points of applied damage of Fire type, it loses the ability of [‚óØFreezing Fang] for the following 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Simultaneous Attack
abilities.description: A Cold Medusa's Snake Hair attacks all characters in the same position.

abilities.title: ‚óØFreezing Fang/7 (14)/Fortitude/Neg
abilities.description:
If a Snake Hair attack hits, the victim is petrified (Dexterity/Agility ‚Äì12).

Characters whose stats are reduced by 0 due to this effect (or, if the character has monster data, receives this effect 3 times), become ice statues. The ice sculpture will melt in 48 hours at room temperature, in 12 hours in heat equivalent to a bonfire, or 24 hours in heat equivalent to a torch. If the character melts, they will die and their corpse will be permanently destroyed.

The effect is Curse + Water/Ice type. Even after becoming an ice statue, a character can survive as long as the curse is removed. However, normal methods of removing petrification are ineffective.

abilities.title: ‚óØDelicate Loot
abilities.description: If the Cold Medusa is slain while [‚óØMelting Fangs] is active, the Loot "Frozen Fang" cannot be gained.

allmonsters.sections: 4 (Right Upper Body / Left Upper Body / Front Lower Body / Rear Lower Body)
allmonsters.description:
This is a Colossus, a figure that is relatively small figuratively speaking, although its overall height is over 10 meters. Designed for mobility, it has a warrior-like appearance of a Centaur, with a horse-like lower body and an armed humanoid upper body.

Its main role was to forcefully trample armies and break enemy formations with its long spears and rushing power. Equipped with destructive ray weapons, it was difficult to approach even from close range.

The Colossus may roam the wilderness or deserts in search of enemies, but it is reported to ignore only small numbers of opponents. It may be sleeping in ruins, attacking those who enter. When it awakens, it heads straight for its destination, causing serious damage to settlements and towns along the way.

Some Colossi were defective, or the hangars were targeted by the Barbarous, and if found in ruins, Colossi should be neutralized or destroyed as soon as possible. However, there have been past tragedies where people have awakened them by trying to destroy them, and now Knights still roam the surrounding lands.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØMana Coating (4)
abilities.description: Reduces magic damage received by -4.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Colossus Trample
abilities.description:
Colossus: Knight attacks with "Area: Breakthrough".

All targets within range will be hit with Colossus: Knight, one of the sections' Melee Attacks. All section Accuracy checks gain a +2 bonus, and damage is increased by +6.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Spear attacks each round, though each attack requires its Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØStranded
abilities.description:
If the HP of the Front Lower Body or Rear Lower Body section is 0 or less, Right Upper Body and Left Upper Body sections suffer a -2 penalty on the Evasion check.

If both of them have 0 or less HP, the penalty is -4.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Eradicating Ray/19 (26)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
The Front Lower Body fires ray of light at "Range/Area: 2 (50m)/Line", dealing 2d+20 Energy magic damage.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Emergency Maintenance
abilities.description:
It restores its own body. This effect restores the HP of one of the sections by 2dx5 points.

This effect cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Smoke Cover
abilities.description: The monster creates a cloud of smoke around it, making it difficult to see. For 10 seconds (1 round), the monster's Evasion, Fortitude, and Willpower checks for all sections of this monster are increased by +2 against characters who are in another area (Simplified Combat) or 10m or more away (Standard Combat, Advanced Combat) from Colossus: Knight.

loottable.loot: Colossus Blue Core (8,000G/Gold Black White S)
Trove of Magical Components (7,600G/Black White S)

allmonsters.description:
Colossus was a giant Magitech created on the Alframe continent during the Magitech Civilization Period. It is said to have taken various forms with unparalleled destructive power. Today, most of them are inactive and have been abandoned in multiple locations. However, it is unknown whether some of them have been destroyed and will never operate again, or whether some remain in a dormant state, programmed to start working again at any moment. A few Colossi are found in working conditions at ruins.

The ones listed here are among the smallest Colossi. They look like a human upper body mounted on a hexapod base. It is said to have been used to eliminate simple threats quickly because of its low cost (for a colossus), easy maintenance, and mobility.

Although small for a Colossus, it is still a giant, more than 10 meters tall, and a formidable enemy.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØMana Coating (3)
abilities.description: Reduces magic damage received by -3.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Light Ray/16 (23)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 2 (50m)/Line," fires a Light Ray, dealing 2d+15 Energy magic damage to targets.

This effect cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Self-Destruction Protocol/15 (22)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
This unique skill is always performed if either the HP of the Core sections is 0 or lower or the HP of this section is below 30. Otherwise, it is never executed.

It self-destructs with "Range: Caster;" "Target: All areas (30m Radius) / All" will be damaged "the section's current HP value" of Bludgeoning magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If the section successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: üó®Aimed Attack
abilities.description: When attacking, the section can gain a +1 bonus to Accuracy. This ability does not affect characters equipped with metal armor.

abilities.title: ‚óØStranded
abilities.description:
If the HP of any Leg section is reduced to 0 or less, the Arms section and Core section suffer a -2 penalty to their Evasion checks.

If the HP of all Leg sections is 0 or less, the penalty to Evasion check becomes -4.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Trampling Down/15 (22)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Colossus stomps around the area. It deals 2d+12 Earth physical damage to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius) / All" with "Range: Caster."

This effect cannot be used by any other Leg section in the same round after it was used by any Leg section.

loottable.loot: Colossus Red Core (5,000G/Gold Black White S)
Trove of Magical Components (7,600G/Black White S)

allmonsters.description:
The souls of warriors who died without redemption have merged and become Undead. The corpses of the warriors can move and wield weapons, but their bodies are anchored in the mysterious light they carry, which connects each warrior seamlessly.

They have lost most of their sense of self, but they can still communicate. They harbor a deep hatred of the living and are willing to fight as slaves if they are promised to kill the living. However, if they feel that promises are not kept, and their desire to kill is not fulfilled, they immediately begin to rebel.

abilities.title: ‚óØCursed Light
abilities.description: A character who makes a melee attack against this monster, regardless of success or failure, suffers 3 curse fixed damage for each attempt.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØHP Sharing
abilities.description: Whenever this section receives damage to HP, half of the applied damage (rounded up) is allocated as fixed damage to any Corpse section so that the section itself receives only the rest of the damage. The damage cannot be allocated to a Corpse section whose HP is already 0 or less, but it is acceptable if the HP of the Corpse section becomes 0 or less as a result of the allocation.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Raise Dead
abilities.description:
Resurrects one Corpse section whose HP is 0 or less, with the maximum HP.

Using this ability consumes 20 points of MP of the Colored Light section.

abilities.title: ‚óØCoordinated Attack
abilities.description: If an attack on a Corpse section is evaded, the other Corpse section's attacks on that target gain a +1 to the Accuracy check against that target. This modifier is accumulated for each evaded attack. However, once any Corpse section attack hits or the monster's turn is ended, it is lost.

allmonsters.description:
Cotton Crowns are very similar to Pamana Bees, with the only difference being the presence of white cotton wool on their heads. This cotton wool is actually a parasitic fungus that infects the Pamana Bee.

When parasitized, Pamana Bees become aggressive and start feeding on meat to gather more nutrients. Even the normally docile worker bees, except for the Nest Guards, begin to attack other creatures indiscriminately.

Parasitized bees often become solitary and rarely return to the nest. However, in some cases, they do return and contaminate the entire hive. This leads to the production of a large number of Cotton Crowns, which aggressively consume and destroy the surrounding ecosystem.

Fortunately, the range of the Cotton Crown is limited to less than one kilometer in radius, compared to the original Pamana Bee. In addition, as the fungus-infested Queens lose their ability to lay eggs, the number of infected hives gradually decreases over time.

The mycelium of this fungus is prized as a material for "Cotton Crown Cushions" (see Natural History of Burlight p. 42). Some people even risk their lives to venture into the prairie in search of Cotton Crowns, often accompanied by the search for Pamana Bee nests.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Cotton Crown is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 points of damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Cotton Crown receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison / 6 (13) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: If a Poison Stinger attack hits and deals 1 or more points of applied damage, the target is dealt an additional 8 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØDisease Spores / 5 (12) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
Whenever this monster receives more than 1 point of applied damage to HP, except Fire type, it sprays spores that cause disease within "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (3m radius) / All". All targets must perform Fortitude Checks immediately. If failed, the target's maximum and current values of HP and MP are both reduced by 3 points (not less than 0). This effect is cumulative, and a character whose maximum HP falls to 0 will die immediately without making a Death Check.

This effect is treated as Disease type and does not heal on its own. When curing with the [Cure Disease] spell, the spell's Success Value must be compared to the initial attack score.

abilities.title: ‚óØDelicate Loot
abilities.description: If Fire-type damage is dealt to this monster at least once, the roll of 2d for Loot Determination is reduced by 2.

allmonsters.description: These giant bears appear in forests and low mountains. They are known to be fierce and dangerous. They are especially dangerous in the fall before hibernation. Still, suppose they fail to hibernate and are active during the winter. In that case, they can be so dangerous that adventurers must be immediately dispatched to their habitat area.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚óØThrow
abilities.description: If the Claws attack hits, it slams the target into the ground and causes it to fall prone.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fall On/Can't
abilities.description:
This ability can only be used if the target is character prone.

The target receives 2d+18 physical damage.

allmonsters.description: This Construct is similar to a small pile of gold coins; about 20 gold coins make up one Creeping Coin. If any of them is unintentionally approached, it will jump up and spit fire. There is no end to the number of new adventurers who are burned to death by what they believed were large gold coins. Rarely, real gold coins are mixed in.

abilities.title: ‚óØMimicry / 12 / Danger Sense / Negates
abilities.description: It disguises itself as gold coins. While it is mimicking, characters cannot perform a Monster Knowledge check on this monster. If a character approaches it unintentionally, they need to make a Danger check with Target Number 12, and if it fails, they will be surprised. Mimicry will automatically end once the monster starts to act.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Flame Breath  / 3 (10) / Fortitude / Half
abilities.description: Within ‚ÄúRange / Area:1 (5m) / Shot," spits fire at "Target: 1 Character", dealing "2d+2" Fire-type magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This maggot is a larva that has grown to about 1m to 1m 50cm in length without becoming an adult. They are reddish-black in color and move with surprising agility.

It has a symbiotic relationship with Fossil Chrysalis and preys on small animals that approach it.

In times of crisis, they tend to eat the allies around them, enhancing their abilities.

abilities.title: ‚óØBloodsucking
abilities.description: If a Bite attack hits, the monster's HP is restored by a value equal to the applied damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Cannibalism
abilities.description:
Within "Range: Touch," this monster preys on other Crimson Maggots with "Target: 1 Character".

The target dies immediately. At the same time, the monster's HP is restored to its maximum value.

For the next 3 minutes (18 rounds), the Crimson Maggot using this effect, gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks and +2 points to damage. This effect is cumulative up to 4 times (Accuracy check +4, damage +8).

abilities.title: ‚óØSplashing Bodily Fluids/Can't
abilities.description: If this monster dies (including when it is targeted by [‚ñ∫Cannibalism]), it sprays hot bodily fluids to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius) / 5" at "Range: Caster" and deals 1d Fire magic damage.

allmonsters.description:
Crocodiles inhabit murky waters near rivers and swamps where they can hide from prey. Their speed while in water is incredible, and their jaws will crush any game caught within. Once dragged underwater, there is no escape.

It is said that Superior Crocodile Skins can be used for a number of goods, such as luxury bags and wallets.

This Barbarous, commonly found in the Diggad Mountains, is approximately the size of a Human and has transparent ice needles covering its body surface, similar to porcupines. As their appearance suggests, these Barbarous are well-suited to cold environments and have established their strongholds in frozen barren lands. They intermittently attack Humanoid settlements.

The "Ice Needles" that adorn their bodies serve as the material for Head Cooling Needles.

abilities.title: ‚è©Freezing Stance
abilities.description:
This effect lasts for 10 seconds (1 round), does not accumulate, and consumes 3 MP when used.

Damage caused by a Weapon attack becomes Water/Ice type and increases by +2. If the Cryoblaz is hit by a melee attack, the attacker will be dealt an additional 1 point of Water/Ice fixed damage for the duration, regardless of the success or failure of the melee attack.

This effect ends immediately after the Cryoblaz receives 1 or more points of Fire-type applied damage without waiting 10 seconds (1 round). If it is caused by a melee attack, the effect disappears first, and the attacker will not be dealt fixed damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØDelicate Loot
abilities.description: If Fire-type damage is dealt to this monster at any time during combat, the roll of 2d for Loot Determination is reduced by 2. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description: This is a Cryoblaz with high combat power. They are the core of any raiding party.

abilities.title: ‚è©Freezing Stance
abilities.description:
This effect lasts for 10 seconds (1 round), does not accumulate, and consumes 3 MP when used.

Damage caused by a Weapon attack becomes Water/Ice type and increases by +2. If the Cryodibraz is hit by a melee attack, the attacker will be dealt an additional 1 point of Water/Ice fixed damage for the duration, regardless of the success or failure of the melee attack.

This effect ends immediately after the Cryoblaz receives 1 or more points of Fire-type applied damage without waiting 10 seconds (1 round). If it is caused by a melee attack, the effect disappears first, and the attacker will not be dealt fixed damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØDelicate Loot
abilities.description: If Fire-type damage is dealt to this monster at any time during combat, the roll of 2d for Loot Determination is reduced by 2. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description: This is a leader of the Cryoblaz, appearing in large raids. They are not the type to lead from the rear but prefer to take the lead in destroying the enemy.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Weapon attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚è©Freezing Stance II
abilities.description:
This effect lasts for 10 seconds (1 round), does not accumulate, and consumes 5 MP when used.

Damage caused by weapon attack becomes Water/Ice type and increases by +2. If a Cryodicobraz is hit by a melee attack, the attacker will be dealt an additional 2 Water/Ice fixed damage regardless of the success or failure of the melee attack.

This effect ends immediately after the Cryodicobraz receives 1 or more points of Fire-type applied damage without waiting 10 seconds (1 round). If it is caused by a melee attack, the effect disappears first, and the attacker will not be dealt fixed damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØDelicate Loot
abilities.description: If Fire-type damage is dealt to this monster at any time during combat, the roll of 2d for Loot Determination is reduced by 2. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description: With a large body that stands out from the rest of the Cryoblaz, these are the ultimate guardians, protecting their allies with their huge bodies.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover II & Guardian I
abilities.description: This is the same effect as the Combat Feat [Cover II]. Multiple targets can be selected at the time of declaration, and [Cover] can be executed up to 3 times per declaration.

abilities.title: üó®Decoy Attack I
abilities.description:
It gains -2 to Accuracy checks, but the damage is increased by +2 on hit.

If the declared attack is evaded, the enemy receives a -1 penalty to Evasion checks for the next 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is cumulative up to -4 but is lost if the target fails an Evasion check even once.

abilities.title: ‚è©Freezing Stance II
abilities.description:
This effect lasts for 10 seconds (1 round), does not accumulate, and consumes 5 MP when used.

Damage caused by weapon attack becomes Water/Ice type and increases by +2. If a Cryodilcobraz is hit by a melee attack, the attacker will be dealt an additional 2 Water/Ice fixed damage regardless of the success or failure of the melee attack.

This effect ends immediately after the Cryodilcobraz receives 1 or more points of Fire-type applied damage without waiting 10 seconds (1 round). If it is caused by a melee attack, the effect disappears first, and the attacker will not be dealt fixed damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØDelicate Loot
abilities.description: If Fire-type damage is dealt to this monster at any time during combat, the roll of 2d for Loot Determination is reduced by 2. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description:
Cu Sith are fairies in the form of large dogs, covered with long green fur, and are said to act as guard dogs for the fairies, often appearing with other fairies or guarding the entrances to their hiding places.

Because of this role, they are very paranoid about visitors. When they perceive you as an enemy, they will attack you mercilessly.

abilities.title: üó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feat [Multi-Action] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚è©Terror Roar/12 (19)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
It roars in "Range: Caster." A character who is within "Target: All Areas (20m Radius) / All" a 20-meter radius and fails a Willpower check suffers a -2 penalty to all checks for 3 minutes (18 rounds). This effect is of Psychic type.

This ability can only be used once per round, for a total of three times per day

allmonsters.description: This is a Mucus construct that can grow up to 1 meter long. It inhabits places where the smell of decay is present, and is believed to have been created to clean up dirty areas such as dark walls and sewers. It absorbs anything it comes into contact with and takes it into its body, giving it a black and muddy appearance like sludge. When discovered, it is typically exterminated by burning it with fire.

abilities.title: ‚óØSoft Body
abilities.description: Blunt weapons treat the Defense of Culvert Slime as 5 points higher.

abilities.title: ‚óØMucus of Disease/4 (11)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
A target hit by a Slam has its Dexterity and Agility reduced by -2 points. For monster characters, roll 1d. It has its Accuracy check reduced by 1d if the roll is "1-3" and its Evasive check reduced by -1 point if the roll is "4-6".

This effect is Disease type and lasts until it is removed.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: This is a sub-species of the Sandworm. iIs territory includes muddy rivers and dark marshes. They are green and brown in color and move freely through the mud.

loottable.loot: Green Sandworm Gem (200G/Gold Red A) x 1d

allmonsters.description:
This is a figure of a past musician who could not let go of their obsession with their own music and became undead, continuing to perform even after their death. This is the result of a musician of the Magic Civilization Period who tried to use their strong spellsongs.

They are eccentric and stubborn and will not tolerate anyone who interferes with their playing. They are known to have several types of musical instruments in their hands, including a large keyboard. There are various theories about the source of their obsession, the musician or the instrument.

abilities.title: ‚óØConcealed Main Section
abilities.description:
The Main Section of this monster is randomly selected from Musician and Instrument section at the time of its appearance and is kept secret.

In the Monster Knowledge check during Combat Preparation, if the success value is equal to or greater than the Weakness, in addition to applying weak points, Main Section will be identified.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Universal Metamagic], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], and [Hawk Eye].

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØIntoxicated by Music
abilities.description:
The body is activated in response to spellsongs.

If the Musician section is under the effect of any spellsong, its HP is recovered by 8 points at the end of its turn.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Basic Spellsongs 10 Level/15 (22)/All Areas (50m Radius)
abilities.description: In addition to Basic 5th level Spellsongs, it can use [Dare].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫[Finale: Dance of the Fire Dragon]/15 (22)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
It uses [Finale: Dance of the Fire Dragon] at "Range: 2 (50m)", dealing 2d+15 Fire and Wind magic damage to up to 5 targets.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØMagic Repeat
abilities.description: The same magic cast by the Musician section in the same round is cast by the Instrument section with the exact same target and the same success value. The same amount of MP is consumed from the Instrument section.

allmonsters.description: This is a type of Magitech used for excavating caves and underground areas. It was designed to melt and vaporize bedrock using heated left and right blades. However, it can only be used under specific conditions and seems to have only been used in areas where urban development was active during the Magitech Civilization era.

abilities.title: ‚óØCutting Blade
abilities.description: Any attacks with Cutting Torch treat Defense as halved (rounded up).

abilities.title: ‚óØCool Blade
abilities.description: If the Cutting Torch's HP is reduced by 1 or more points due to physical damage or magical damage of Water/Ice or Lightning type, the Cutting Torch's damage is reduced by 4 points until the end of the next turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is one of the Living Tree species, which walks using its roots as legs. It has an eerily twisted, humped trunk with countless thin branches.

This evil plant does not use leaves, but has excellent mental sensitivity and communicates its will to others in a kind of telepathy. The weak- minded are overwhelmed by it and become unable to act.

This tree communicates with the Otherworld, and Daemons can be summoned by opening the Abyss Gate. Scholars suspect, from its bizarre appearance, that it may be a creature that has been modified by the Otherworld Daemons to invade this world.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Open Abyss Gate
abilities.description:
Opens an Abyss Gate and summons a Daemon, just as a Warlock does. Only Daemons with monster level 13 or lower can be summoned. When a Daemonwood uses this ability, it spends "Monster level x 2" points of MP for the Daemon it summons. This ability cannot be used if a Daemon has already been summoned by this tree.

The summoned Daemon acts according to the Daemon Action Chart (see ML p. 46), but if the roll is 1, the Daemon is sent away without doing anything (this monster does need to spend MP for canceling its action).

When a new Daemon is invoked after the Daemon is returned, it cannot be the same Daemon as the one that was summoned immediately before. It must be a different type from the previous one.

When this monster is defeated, the summoned Daemon is automatically sent back, and the Abyss Gate that was created disappears.

abilities.title: ‚è©Oppressive Will/18 (25)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 2 (30m) / Target," pressurize the spirit of the "Target: 1 Entire Character" with its own thoughts.

A target who fails a resistance receives a -2 penalty to any action check for the next 3 minutes (18 rounds).

This effect is of a Psychic type and is cumulative without an upper limit.

This ability may be used up to three times per round but may not be used more than once on the same enemy in the same round.

allmonsters.description:
The Daemonwood tree can shed its branches that have become too thick, which in turn can transform into a humanoid creature. These creatures, known as Daemonwood Branches, are naked and wander the forest hunting animals (and occasionally Humanoids, Barbarous, or Mythical Beasts).

They bring their catch to their master, the Daemonwood, burying them in the ground for nourishment.

Despite their low intellect, Daemonwood Branches have good instincts to detect danger. If they feel that the person they have found is too strong for them, they will attempt to lure them to their master, leaving obvious tracks behind.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Daemon Transformation
abilities.description:
The monster transforms into any type of Daemon of 12^^th^^ level or lower, and all HP and MP are restored, and all effects it had been receiving are also lost. From its next turn, it acts as the Daemon completely.

If it dies, it returns to its original form. In that case, when looting this monster, use this monster table instead of Daemon's with added +2 bonus to the loot rolls.

allmonsters.description:
Armed with a dagger, this Hoodling excels in close combat.

Hoodlings are short-sighted Youma, unable to understand the battlefield, and are so eager to fight that they are blind to their surroundings. They act in groups and obey stronger Barbarous such as Goblins and Bolgs. They have no fear of death and are mainly used as slaves for their bigger cousins.

abilities.description: None.

allmonsters.description: These thorns are as tall as a Humanoid. They are constant rustling and shaking, even when there is no wind. When an animal approaches, the thorns detach their roots, curl up and spin around, and strike the animal, attempting to tear it apart with the numerous thorns on their stems. If the thorns are defeated or driven away, they may reestablish their roots and grow again with renewed vigor, so it is hard to get rid of this weed.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +3 points.

allmonsters.description: Standing at 2m tall, the Dark Bully appears entirely in shadow. A long claw grows from each hand instead of fingers, giving the appearance of the scythes of the god of death. It also has a powerful Continuous Attack unique skill and is recognized as a fearsome assassin.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack II
abilities.description: If a Dark Bully successfully hits a target in melee, they may make a second attack. They can make a third attack against the same target if a second attack hits.

abilities.title: ‚óØFatigue Poison/9 (16)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If a Claw attack deals at least 1 point of applied damage, the target's Evasion is reduced by a -1. This effect is Poison type and lasts for 1 hour. It is cumulative if the same effect is applied within the duration.

abilities.title: ‚óØShadow Cross
abilities.description:
During a Normal Move, it temporarily disappears and appears from within any shadow at the destination. In the absence of light, it can appear from anywhere in the darkness.

It does not suffer any movement blocking and is free to leave the skirmish.

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description:
This is an evil hierophant, who worshipped and glorified the evil gods, and became undead by involving their followers. Even in death, they are still worshipped by the souls of the dead.

The hierophant themself has no special abilities, though they are a high priest. However, they are strengthened by the palanquin that carries them, and their power baptizes the living into death and makes them new believers.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic], [Double Cast], [Critical Cast II], and [Rune Master].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫3 Attacks (Free)
abilities.description: A countless number of ghosts swarm and attack three times per round, with separate Accuracy checks and choosing whether to attack the same target again or a different target.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
The Body cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when the Palanquin section falls to 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØWall of Believers
abilities.description:
The Body section cannot be a target for the effects with "Target: 1 Character", "Target: 1 Character X", and "Target: X area (YY radius)/Z" unless it wishes to be (it still can be targeted by "Target: 1 Entire Character" and "Target: X area (YY radius)/All).

This effect is lost when the Palanquin section HP falls to 0 or less.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Praise the Hierophant
abilities.description:
The departed sacrifice themselves and offer distorted prayers to the being above the palanquin. This ability costs 10 HP and MP to the Palanquin section.

The Body section heals HP and MP by 10 points immediately and gets a +2 bonus to action checks for 10 seconds (1 round).

loottable.loot: Holy Symbol of the Evil God (600G/Black White A) x 2d

allmonsters.description:
This is a giant water spider about 2 meters long. Although it can swim underwater, its main means of transportation is to walk on the water using its water-repellent legs dexterously.

They nest under bridges or underground in places where water flows and prey on fish and other aquatic animals.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Slime Vomit/6 (13)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Up to "Range/Area: 1 (10m) / Shot," this beast spits out a mass of water mixed with a sticky substance to attack "Target: 1 Character,"

The target suffers 2d+5 Water/Ice magic damage and takes a -2 penalty on Evasion checks for a total of 3 minutes (18 rounds). The penalty to Evasion check is not cumulative and is removed if the target wipes off the sticky water with a Major Action.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description: Much leaner than a typical Troll, a Dark Troll has an excellent sense of fighting and a strong religious belief. A high-ranking member of Troll society, they stand out with their jet-black skin and dangerous aura. Dark Trolls greatly hate cowardice and will respect those who show their strength, even Humanoids who dare to stand up to the Dark Troll's immense power.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +10 damage
abilities.description: May deal an additional +10 damage to their next melee attack. At risk, they take a -2 penalty to their Fortitude and Willpower checks.

abilities.title: ‚óØDark Regeneration = 5 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Dark Troll recovers 5 HP. This has no effect if the Dark Troll is at 0 HP or lower or is under sunlight.

abilities.title: ‚óØWeakened
abilities.description: As long as a Dark Troll is under sunlight, it receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Troll priest who is not only a skilled priest but also a capable warrior among the Dark Trolls.

Interestingly, Trolls are sworn to serve the gods rather than to fight themselves. They serve as judges of the divine battles within the Troll clan and preside over rituals. They can also serve as advisors and bless Troll officers, providing spell support to allies when confronted with powerful enemies.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +13 damage
abilities.description: May deal an additional +13 damage to their next melee attack. At risk, they take a -2 penalty to their Fortitude and Willpower checks.

abilities.title: ‚óØDark Regeneration = 7 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Dark Troll Adept recovers 7 HP. This has no effect if the Dark Troll Adept is at 0 HP or lower or is under sunlight.

abilities.title: ‚óØWeakened
abilities.description: As long as a Dark Troll is under sunlight, it receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks.

allmonsters.description: This is a Dawn species that has developed its skills and abilities through its work. Many Humanoids mistake these monsters for Humanoid assassins or vampires, and there have been confirmed cases where such rumors were true.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +9 damage
abilities.description: A Dawn Ripper can deal an additional 9 damage on their next attack. However, any Fortitude or Willpower Check made by the Dawn Ripper this turn receives a -1 penalty.

allmonsters.description:
Dawn Walkers are Barbarous creatures that wear black cloaks and infiltrate humanoid habitats. They are about 1.8 meters tall, with stout, rounded backs. Their bodies are entirely covered in dark-colored body hair, and they have long, sharp claws on both hands.

They possess knowledge of stealth and carry out their duties unnoticed at the request of the Upper Barbarous. Loyal and modest, they prioritize the accomplishment of their mission above all else.

They follow Dalkhrem, Zeides, and Eiryak, and sometimes act as liaisons between their Barbarous followers and their pagan cults of Humanoids.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Multi-Action].

allmonsters.description: A tortured spirit trapped within a sword, the Death Sword possesses a decaying body to carry out its foul grudges. When encountering a stronger opponent, the Death Sword will seek to slay the stronger and possess that body, so it often looks for stronger and stronger foes to face.

abilities.title: ‚óØ‚ñ∫Blade of Death/5 (12)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: The Death Sword slashes a "Target: 1 Character" within "Range: Touch" with a vengeful blade, dealing 10 Curse magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description: A Deck Chest Trap can disguise itself as a variety of ordinary furniture, such as bookcases, doors, beds, etc. It can move its strong arms and two small legs in and out at will.

abilities.title: ‚óØMimicry/15/Danger Sense/Negates
abilities.description:
It can mimic treasure chests, furniture, and doors. While mimicking, characters cannot perform a Monster Knowledge check on this monster. If a character approaches it unintentionally, they need to make a Danger check with target number 15, and if it fails, they will be surprised (see CR I, p. 144). Mimicry will be automatically ended once the monster starts to act.

This monster can be detected with [Sense Magic].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description:
A Deck Chest Trap can make two Smash attacks each round.

They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØCapture
abilities.description:
If both Smash attacks from [‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack] hit the target, the target becomes entangled by Deck Chest Trap. The target will not be able to move, and from the next round on, any attack from this monster to the entangled target will automatically hit.

When the target tries to escape, use the de-bonding rules.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Regional Dialect, Magic System Learned
allmonsters.description: This is a human wizard with a certain amount of experience. They may be encountered in a variety of situations.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Magic (1 System) 5 Level/Magic Power 8 (15).
abilities.description:
Dedicated Wizard has mastered any one of the following at the 5th level: Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic, Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, or Summoning Arts.

The types used in Fairy Magic are generally "Fire", "Water/Ice", "Wind", and "Light", but the GM may arbitrarily change to any four.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

allmonsters.description:
A mythical beast, combining the appearance of a bird with that of a beautiful woman. Quietly interacting with Humans since the Magic Civilization period, Deela Harpy now lives deep in mountains and forests. If one happens to know either the Arcana or Elven languages, it is quite possible to converse with Deela Harpy.

Often mild-mannered, a Deela Harpy avoids fights with Humanoids unless there is a compelling reason to do so. In addition, some prefer reading to talking, and some carry manuscripts of books dating back to the Magic Civilization period.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Enchanting Song / 3 (10) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
Deela Harpy sings a song with "Range/Area: 2 (20m) / Target" to "Target: 1 Character". The target obeys Deela Harpy's commands in the song's lyrics.

The commands must be in a language that the target understands. The commands must be simple, and the target will not obey any commands to harm themselves.

This effect is treated as Psychic (Weak) type.

allmonsters.description:
A variant of Gremlin (see CR I, p. 397 or ML, p. 72), these Barbarous have strikingly purple skin. They are also a bit larger than their kin, ending up roughly the size of a human child.

Deep Gremlins are also much more brutally cunning, going above and beyond what would normally be considered harmless pranks. For example, a Deep Gremlin "prank" will see them kill some livestock, [Disguise] itself as one of the dying animals, and call out to human children in order to scare and terrify them.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Deep Gremlin receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

allmonsters.description: This sturdy Kagner is designed for transportation over rough terrain, such as mountains and wastelands. The extra fence to secure the Magitech to be transported is added to protect the Magitech even more firmly.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted Magitech = 2 Characters
abilities.description: Up to 2 Magitech characters (2 sections) can be mounted.

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted Person Protection = +2 ‚Ä¢ +2
abilities.description: A character mounted on this monster has a +2 bonus to Evasion checks against melee and ranged attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is a giant scorpion that inhabits the deserts of the Alframe continent. Its body length, including the tail, exceeds 10 meters.

These lords of the desert usually lurk in the depths of the sand. When it recognizes an intruder in its territory, it approaches the intruder from the sand and kills it with a single strike of its deadly tail.

The shells are valuable as armor and building materials. Still, few people attempt to kill a living Desert Scorpion to steal it, instead obtaining it by searching for its rotting carcass in the desert or by picking up anything that falls by chance.

abilities.title: ‚óØMany Legs
abilities.description: It is not subject to penalties due to poor footing.

abilities.title: ‚óØHide in the Sand
abilities.description: If the character approaches within 15 meters of Desert Scorpion, if they fail the Danger Sense check with target number 18, they will receive a surprise attack (see CR I, p. 144).

abilities.title: ‚è©Dusting Sand
abilities.description:
For 10 seconds (1 round), all attacks against all sections of this monster have a -1 penalty on Accuracy checks against them and Evasion checks against attacks from them. Characters with Magic perception are not affected by this.

To use its ability, 5 points of HP must be consumed.

abilities.title: üó®Decoy Attack II
abilities.description:
It gains -2 to Accuracy checks, but the damage is increased by +8 on hit.

If the declared attack is evaded, the enemy receives a -2 penalty to Evasion checks for the next 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is cumulative up to -8 but is lost if the target fails an Evasion check even once.

abilities.title: ‚óØDead Angle Attack
abilities.description:
If the Body section is the target of a melee attack, an Accuracy check by Tail can be performed instead of an Evasion check of the Body section. See [Counter] for the detail of the process, CR II, p. 209. In failure, the Body section suffers damage as with [Counter] feat.

This ability can only be used once per 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison/13 (20)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If the Tail attack inflicts 1 or more applied damage, it inflicts 10 Poison magic damage to the target.

allmonsters.description:
This is a giant Diablo Cadet. Its form is reminiscent of a Daemon, and it is more powerful for it. It symbolizes awe for both the Humanoid and the Barbarous and is the cause of why Diablos are feared. The fear is also heightened by the giant Diablo becoming more aggressive and brutal.

However, after taking this form and releasing it, they cannot Daemonshift again for some time.

For the Human form of this monster, see Diablo Cadet (Human Form).

abilities.title: ‚óØTough Skin
abilities.description: Whenever it receives physical or magical damage of the bludgeoning type, it is reduced by -3 points.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Daemonic Eyes/Can't
abilities.description:
With a sharp look in its eyes, it shrivels enemies.

With "Range/Area: 1 (10m) / Target", select any number of targets and deal each of them 2 curse magic damage. Afterward, Diablo's HP is restored by the sum of all applied damage dealt to the targets.

Using this ability consumes 2 points of MP per character targeted.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Chain of Curses/8 (15)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
Diablo injures themselves to curse an enemy.

They can select an arbitrary number of targets with "Range: 1 (10m)" and "Area: Target" and deal each of them 2d+6 Curse magic damage.

To use this ability, 8 points of HP and 4 points of MP per number of targets must be consumed (HP consumption is always 8 points, regardless of the number of targets).

All sections receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If the Body section falls to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave I
abilities.description: It can attack up to 3 characters within reach with melee attacks, but the damage will be reduced by -3. If more than one is hit, the damage is determined individually.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Humanification
abilities.description:
It changes into its Human form. For data on the Human form, refer to Diablo Cadet (Human Form). If the Body section has suffered HP or MP damage or has been affected by magic or other effects, these are carried over to the Human form. If its HP is less than 0 after this transfer, it immediately falls unconscious.

[‚ñ∫Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after [‚ñ∫Daemonshift] was used. Also, [‚ñ∫Daemonshift] cannot be used for 3 hours immediately after the [‚ñ∫Humanification] was used.

allmonsters.description:
It is said that this race was created at the end of the Magic Civilization Period as a result of a fusion experiment between Barbarous and Daemons. Known on the Alframe continent as the upper Barbarous along with Drakes, Cadets are young candidates for leadership.

They have blue-colored skin, large and prominent horns, and black jewels in which the mana is condensed in various body parts. Although they do not have wings, they are able to float with the power of their jewels. Their facial features resemble those of Humans and Elves, and they are intimidating and highly charismatic at the same time.

While flexible, their skin instantly hardens to protect the body against strong attacks, and sharp prongs extend from the shoulders, elbows, knuckles, and fingertips (the presence varies from individual to individual). These protrusions can be pulled out to create their own weapons (mainly swords and spears).

Diablos have the ability to transform into a form similar to that of a daemon. This transformation makes them twice their size and gives them incredible power.

With numerous Bolgs (see ML p. 75) and Goblins (see ML p. 73) in their ranks, they attack the Humanoid realm with their prowess and guile.

For the Daemon form of this monster, see Diablo Cadet (Daemon Form).

abilities.title: ‚óØTough Skin
abilities.description: Whenever it receives physical or magical damage of the Bludgeoning type, it is reduced by -3 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: Receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave I
abilities.description: It can attack up to 3 characters within its reach with melee attacks, but the damage will be reduced by -3. If more than one is hit, the damage is determined individually.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Daemonic Eyes/Can't
abilities.description:
With a sharp look in its eyes, it can shrivel enemies.

With "Range/Area: 1 (10m)/Target," select any number of targets and deal each of them 2 Curse magic damage. Afterward, Diablo's HP is restored by the sum of all applied damage dealt to the targets.

Using this ability consumes 2 points of MP per character targeted.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Daemonshift
abilities.description:
The character changes into a Daemon form. For data, see Diablo Cadet (Daemon Form). HP and MP are restored to their maximum values, and all effects of magic, etc., are negated. In the turn in which [‚ñ∫Daemonshift] is performed, only the Body section of the Daemon Form is treated as having completed a Major Action, and the Head section can make its own Major Action this turn.

[‚ñ∫Daemonshift] cannot be used for 3 hours immediately after the [‚ñ∫Humanification] was used. Also, [‚ñ∫Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after [‚ñ∫Daemonshift] was used.

allmonsters.description: This is the Daemon form of the Diablo Captain (Human Form).

abilities.title: ‚óØTough Skin
abilities.description: Whenever it receives physical or magical damage of the bludgeoning type, it is reduced by -3 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited 2 Actions
abilities.description: The monster can perform two Major Actions in one round. However, the monster must choose two different actions from the melee attack, [‚ñ∫Daemonic Eyes III] or [‚ñ∫Daemonic Cursed Rain].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Daemonic Eyes III/Can't
abilities.description: Same as for Diablo Captain (Human Form).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Daemonic Cursed Rain/20 (27)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
First, the Head must spend 10 points of MP to use this ability. Then, roll 2d, and calculate the Intensity of the effect as "roll + 5".

The Diablo Captain receives fixed damage of Intensity points, and at the same time, at "Range: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (30m Radius)/All" receive "Intensity x 3" curse magical damage. Any character within this range can be excluded from the target.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Humanification
abilities.description:
It changes to the Human form. For data on the Human form, refer to Diablo Captain (Human Form). If the Head section has suffered HP or MP damage or has been affected by magic or other effects, these are carried over to the Human form. If its HP is less than 0, it immediately falls unconscious.

[‚ñ∫Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after [‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Daemonshift] was used. Also, [‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Daemonshift] cannot be used for 3 hours immediately after the [‚ñ∫Humanification] was used.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight II
abilities.description:
All sections receive a +2 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If either the Right Side or Left Side section falls to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave II
abilities.description: It attacks with a weapon up to 5 characters within the skirmish in which it resides.

abilities.title: ‚óØDaemons Strengthening
abilities.description: All Daemon monsters within "Range: Self" and "Target: All Areas(30m Radius)/All" receive a +2 bonus on all action checks except Evasion checks, and the physical and magic damage they cause is increased by +2 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØBarbarous Strengthening
abilities.description: All Barbarous monsters (except this monster) within "Range: Self" and "Target: All Areas(30m Radius)/All" receive a +2 bonus on all action checks except Evasion checks, and the physical and magic damage they cause is increased by +2 points.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Diablo who has led an army through age and many combat experiences.
