allmonsters.description:
About one meter in length, this fairy is shaped like a bonfire flame. It has eyes and a mouth in the middle of the flame, and long, slender limbs extending from the outer edge of the flame.

They are skilled in using their own flame for cooking and excel at turning raw ingredients into delicious dishes with perfect heat control. In some regions, they are spoken of as a being that resides in stoves and hearths, granting household safety and food security.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚óØSkillful / 7 (14)
abilities.description: Various checks in the "Technique check package" (see CR I, p. 114) can be performed with Standard Value 7 (Success Value 14)

allmonsters.description: This is simply an undead pair of hands flying around from the elbow to the tip. It is said that the hands move only in search of the enemy as if they are wandering around in regret for the death of a fighter who could not exert their strength in battle.

abilities.title: üó®Decoy Attack I
abilities.description:
It gains -2 to Accuracy checks, but the damage is increased by +2 on hit.

If the declared attack is evaded, the enemy receives a -1 penalty to Evasion checks for the next 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is cumulative up to - 4 but is lost if the target fails an Evasion check even once.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
A green-skinned race of Giants that stand approximately 5 meters tall, the Fomor are said to be a noble race of Barbarous who once led Goblins, Bolgs and Ogres in battle. However, they were deprived of their positions by the plotting of Drakes and now possess low status.

Fomors are said to be the bravest of the Barbarous, always taking the lead in battles. In this sense, they get along with Trolls. However, where a Troll tends to be guided only by its own strength as a warrior, Fomors excel at commanding troops. It has even been said that "a Goblin army led by a Fomor will defeat a Troll army led by a Goblin."

The Drakes, who now occupy the upper echelons of Barbarous society, highly value the abilities of the Fomors but are wary of conspiracy of rebellion amongst them. For this reason, Fomors are not allowed to assemble in groups larger than a family unit, and their children are forced into independence at an early age to be incorporated into Barbarous armies.

In such armies, they are often given command and staff positions in small units composed of Goblins, Bolgs, and other Barbarous. Several Fomors do not usually appear together in these units.

abilities.title: ‚óØChain Attack
abilities.description: After an attack, Fomor can attack the same target again, regardless of its success or failure. This ability can add only one additional attack per round.

abilities.title: ‚óØCounter
abilities.description: Identical effect as the Combat Feat [Counter].

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Technique & ‚óØMuscle Mystery
abilities.description: Can use [Cat's Eye], [Beetleskin], [Bear Muscle], and [Recovery (7 points)]. These Techniques have twice the normal duration.

abilities.title: ‚è©Stratagem and Maneuver/All Areas (20m Radius)
abilities.description: Can use [Surging Offense II: Whirlwind] (Accuracy +1). Every third turn, they can use [Maneuver: Unexpected Blow I] (+2 Accuracy, +2 Damage). This monster cannot use Stratagems if no other allies will be affected.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle +4/None
abilities.description:
Fomor height prevents enemies from attacking it.

The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. When the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

allmonsters.description: A lesser daemon, Foregones are 6m tall giants, with red-black skin, with one horn protruding from their forehead and the lower body of a goat.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Foregone can use the Combat Feats [Metamagic/Targets], [Multi- Action], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Foregone can make two Claws attacks each round. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
Foregone size hinders attack.

The Head cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

When the Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

abilities.title: ‚óØKneel
abilities.description: If the HP of the Legs section is less than 0, the Body section receives a - 2 penalty on Accuracy and Evasion checks.

allmonsters.description:
This is a giant about 6 meters tall who lives in the forest. It is usually found deep in the forest, living with nature, and is rarely seen. They are usually calm and quiet among giants, but once it considers someone an enemy, it has no mercy for them and will crush them with its well-trained strikes and techniques.

They are by no means stupid and can negotiate. However, they are very territorial and will not tolerate intrusion by others. They usually live alone, but rarely travel in search of mates. They have no concept of money and consider everything as their own, so they sometimes get into trouble by eating livestock without permission.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: A Forest Giant can use the [Gazelle Feet], [Strong Blood], [Cat's Eyes], [Bear Muscle], and [Recovery (5 points)] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫War Cry / 12 (19) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description: The Forest Giant unleashes a mighty yell, causing fear in those who fail to resist within a 10-meter radius around them. This fear, treated as a Psychic effect, gives a -2 penalty to all Skill Checks for the next 30 seconds (3 rounds).

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
A Forest Giant's height prevents enemies from attacking it. The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description: This giant ape is found in forests throughout the Alframe continent. They are about 2m 50cm long, and their arms are more developed than their legs. They use their arms and legs to move more quickly than they look. They are so strong that they can easily snap off an ordinary tree with their arms.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Swinging
abilities.description:
This beast hangs from a branch or other object above its head. The monster receives no penalty due to poor footing until the beginning of the next turn. It also gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks and has its Damage reduced by -2 points.

This ability can only be used in environments with something to hang overhead, such as a forest.

allmonsters.description: These are the leaders who unite the Formica tribes. Many of them are believers of Dalkhrem, the God of War. They usually stay in the nest, often guarding the nurseries, and if an enemy appears that they lead soldiers to defeat them. They may also help their tribe coexist with nearby Androscorpions.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Formica Chief can make two Weapon attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Formic Acid / 9 (16) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: A Formica Chief can spit acid at an enemy character in the same skirmish, dealing 2d+8 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØShared Senses
abilities.description: If there is another Formica (of any type) in the skirmish this monster is in, it gains a +1 bonus to all of its Accuracy checks. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description:
This is the king of the Formica tribe. He is the largest of the Formica, has better intellect than the others, and can even negotiate for the tribe. However, he is still emotionless and thinks rationally. They are also strong believers of Dalkhrem, the God of War, and are powerful priests. They are the leaders of the entire tribe, and their subordinates absolutely obey the orders of the Formica Lord, even if they are suicidal.

The Formica Lord's greatest love is the Formica Queen, and the highest priority for them is to increase the number of the entire tribe. If the Queen is harmed or killed, he will likely fly into a rage and attack everyone. If the Queen is taken hostage, he may be willing to negotiate if it is the last Queen in the tribe.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Formica Lord can use the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Formic Acid / 13 (20) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: A Formica can spit acid at an enemy character in the same skirmish, dealing 2d+12 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØShared Senses
abilities.description: If there is another Formica (of any type) in the skirmish this monster is in, it gains a +2 bonus to all of its Accuracy checks. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description:
She (Queens are always female) is the mother of an entire Formica tribe. She has a huge abdomen and lays two to three eggs per month. She can hardly move and remains quietly at the back of the nest to lay her eggs. In the absence of Formica Lords, a Queen can become the chief of the tribe.

Formica juveniles spend about five years in the egg, most of which are born as Formica Soldiers. Formica live around 30 years; when the Queen feels that her death is near, she lays a special egg to produce the next Formica Queen.

They have low intelligence, and they have no interest in anything other than gathering food and producing more offspring. However, they are blessed by Dalkhrem, the God of War, and use powerful magic to heal their allies or rebuke their enemies.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Magic Assurance], [Targeting], and [Metamagic/Distance].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Formic Acid / 10 (17) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: A Formica can spit acid at an enemy character in the same skirmish, dealing 2d+9 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØShared Senses
abilities.description: If there is another Formica (of any type) in the skirmish this monster is in, it gains a +2 bonus to all of its Accuracy checks. This effect is not cumulative.

abilities.title: ‚óØDistress Call
abilities.description: If this character suffers even a single point of damage, all Formica within a 500m radius will sense it, along with the exact location of this character.

allmonsters.description:
Formica look like an upright ant with four arms. Covered with a hard outer shell, their bodies are extremely tough. They are not much taller than humans, but with four arms, they can masterfully wield two weapons.

Their language is difficult to learn, and even if someone can speak it, they can hardly communicate with them. They are pack-driven and follow the orders of their leaders. They have no emotions and feel no fear. Although their intelligence is low, they are able to communicate quickly and empathically with other animals, and they work in groups to hunt down their enemies.

Their biology is also similar to that of ants, building huge underground nests in deserts and dry areas. They consider all living things other than themselves as food and attack them. They also have an excellent sense of smell to track their prey.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Formica Soldier can make two Weapon attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Formic Acid / 7 (14) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: A Formica can spit acid at an enemy character in the same skirmish, dealing 2d+6 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: üó®Sensitive Smell
abilities.description: Any Track check made by a Formica is performed with a standard value of 9 (fixed success value of 16) when tracking prey.

abilities.title: ‚óØShared Senses
abilities.description: If there is another Formica (of any type) in the skirmish this monster is in, it gains a +1 bonus to all of its Accuracy checks. This effect is not cumulative.

allmonsters.description:
This gigantic chrysalis, about 3 meters long, is often found in old ruins. Because of its huge size, when it is found, it is often only exposed partly in a ruin's room, and its full extent is rarely revealed.

The body surface of the chrysalis is so hardened that it could be mistaken for a mineral. Moreover, it can move while still in its pupal state, making it dangerous to be caught in its movement. Black tentacles extend from the tip of the chrysalis, and while the body remains motionless, the chrysalis uses the tentacles to defend itself.

It is said that they hatch when some conditions are met, but there is no reported case of witnessing the moment of hatching.

They never appear alone but are always surrounded by several to a dozen Crimson Maggots living in symbiosis.

abilities.title: ‚óØBlock
abilities.description: The same as [Block] Combat Feat (see CR II, p. 202).

abilities.title: ‚óØChrysalis Body
abilities.description: It is immune to critical hits from edged weapons and slashing-type attacks. It also reduces all magic damage it suffers by -6 points.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Soporific Scent/9 (16)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
It releases a soporific scent, putting all the characters in the skirmish it resides to sleep.

Poison and psychic (weak) type countermeasures are effective against this effect (for example, this effect can be removed with damage to HP or MP). If the target is protected or resistant to both types, the target may choose either type.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover I (Chrysalis only)
abilities.description: Has the combat feat [Cover I] (see CR I, p. 256). The Cover is limited to the Chrysalis section.

abilities.title: ‚óØLong Tentacles
abilities.description: It can attack with Tentacle with "Range/Area: 1 (10m) / Target".

allmonsters.description: A Frau is an ice fairy in the form of a woman. It has pure white hair and a half-transparent body. It is said to seduce men who climb snowy mountains and freeze them to death, but it is also said to help travelers in distress in some regions.

abilities.title: ‚óØIce Body
abilities.description: If a Frau takes damage from a blunt weapon, it is treated as if the Frau had additional 5 points of Defense.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Frau receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When a Frau is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: üó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feat [Universal Metamagic].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Cold Storm/10 (17)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: The Frau creates a cold storm within "Range: Caster." Within "Target: 1 area (6m Radius)/20", they deal 2d+8 Water/Ice magic damage. A target that fails resistance is frozen for 30 seconds (3 rounds) and suffers a -2 penalty to Accuracy and Evasion checks. This penalty is not cumulative. This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns

allmonsters.description:
This is a dangerous large predator of the cat family that roams the snowfields. Its pure white fur is almost invisible in the middle of the day. The skin provides more than enough warmth to keep the monster waiting for its prey in the snow for hours.

Because of its whiteness and warmth, its fur is valuable as the finest clothing material.

abilities.title: ‚óØSnow and Ice Mastery
abilities.description: On snow and ice, it has no penalties due to poor footing.

abilities.title: ‚óØMimicry/16/Danger Sense/Negates
abilities.description:
It blends its white body into the snowfield. While mimicking, characters cannot perform a Monster Knowledge check on this monster.

If a character approaches it unintentionally, they need to make a Danger check with target number 16, and if it fails, they will be surprised (see CR I, p. 144). Mimicry will be automatically ended once the monster starts to act.

This monster cannot be detected with [Sense Magic].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Triple Attack
abilities.description: Frost Panther can attack the same target with three attacks.

allmonsters.description:
This monster is a humanoid covered in parasitic mushrooms, feeding the mushroom as it decomposes. Typically found in dark, damp places, the Fungal Parasite will attack any humanoid or animal passing by, hoping to infect them and use them as a new host. Fungal Parasite hosts will last for a year or two before becoming desiccated husks, drained of all vital nutrients.

It is possible to save a victim of the Fungal Parasites, though it involves casting a [Refresh] spell on a host whose HP has been reduced to 0.

Rarely, a mushroom called "Forest Marvel" may grow among the various Fungal Parasites. This mushroom is non-toxic and quite delicious, so it is valued by many in the culinary community. Additionally, it is thought to have anti-aging properties, and some elder priests have sent out adventurers to look for these mushrooms.

abilities.title: ‚è©Sporulation/11 (18)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
This unique skill can be used only once per round.

The Fungal Parasite spreads reddish-purple spores in "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (6m Radius) / 20", infecting the target with a disease called sporotrichosis. This effect is treated as a Disease type.

Character infected with sporotrichosis will have small reddish-purple mushrooms sprouting from all over their body after 1 day, and their all ability scores will be reduced by -6 points. Fixed characters suffer a -1 penalty to Accuracy, Evasion, Fortitude, and Willpower.

If any ability scores reach 0 or 3 full days have passed since the spore infection, the character will fall into a severe hallucinatory state and cannot act at all. The character in this state will spread spores every round, regardless of their will.

After a few days of infection, the characters will be lost entirely, and the character becomes a Fungal Parasite. If the character has fallen into this state, it cannot be recovered by effects that heal disease, such as [Cure Disease].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Hallucinogenic Spores/13 (20)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
These blue-violet spores are scattered around the Fungal Parasite, and all those in the same skirmish must make a Fortitude check. Those who fail will see the Fungal Parasite as someone close to them and will move to protect it from anything and anyone who wishes to do it harm (and will do nothing else). Even if the Fungal Parasite attacks an affected character, it will remain under the effect of these spores.

This effect is treated as a Disease type.

allmonsters.description:
Fylgja is a fairy in the form of a young girl just before coming of age. She wears light armor, and her entire body is enveloped in a pale light. Although she has no wings, she can fly freely in the sky and has been seen dancing in the wind.

They prefer strong humanoids (regardless of genderounds). When they find one they like, they become their guardian fighting for them.

The problem is that these women are thoughtless and prefer to settle everything by force. When this happens on battlefield, the worst-case scenario is that they immediately turn on the enemy.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Hawk Eye], and [Universal Metamagic].

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Fylgja receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØHarbinger
abilities.description:
This unique skill is only used in the first round of a battle when Fylgja goes first.

It can make a Full Move, but it is treated as Limited Move, and a Full Move does not incur a penalty modifier (-4) to Evasion

allmonsters.description: A variety of golem with both claws and wings, a Gargoyle is a beast of stone animated by long-lost magic. Gargoyles were famous guardians of the Magic Civilization period, and most seen today are still following instructions given to them from that time. While Gargoyles seem to act as living beings, they can choose to camouflage themselves as stone, taking advantage of unaware and careless adventurers.

abilities.title: ‚óØMimicry/12/Danger Sense/Negates
abilities.description:
It mimics a stone statue. While mimicking, characters cannot perform a Monster Knowledge check on this monster. If the character approaches it unintentionally, they need to make a Danger check with target number 12, and if it fails, they will be surprised (see CR I, p. 144).

Mimicry will be automatically ended once the monster starts to act. This monster can be detected with [Sense Magic].

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: Receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
A 3m tall barbarous with a bird-like head and large wings on their back, Garudas are masters of the winds.

In fact, they are known as "Sky Kings" among the lower ranks of the Barbarous, and with good reason. They despise any others flying in what they consider their airspace and will often go out alone to drive out or kill the interlopers.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack II
abilities.description: If a Garuda successfully hits a target in melee, they may make a second attack. They can make a third attack against the same target if a second attack hits.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: A Garuda can use the [Cat's Eyes], [Bear Muscle], and [Beetleskin] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚è©Turbulent Winds/15 (22)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
It creates turbulence in a 6m/20 radius around itself, dealing 2d +12 wind magic damage to the targets and causing them to fall prone.

This unique skill can be used only once per turn, at the end of each turn.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Wind-Edge Blade/15 (22)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: With "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/Target", Garuda uses a blade made of feathers to deal with dealing 2d+15 slashing magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight II
abilities.description: All sections receive a +2 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks. This unique skill is lost if the Body section is reduced to 0 or less HP.

allmonsters.description:
This goat-like daemon is one of the highest-ranking daemons, subservient to only the Daemon King. Geldams are large, muscular goatmen, 5m tall, and carry a massive glaive. These glaives are larger than adult humans, and magically bonded to the Geldam that carries them, so it is impossible to claim one as the spoils of battle.

Consummate commanders of other daemons, Geldams have hundreds of lesser daemons at their command. Because of their service to the Daemon King in the Daemon Realm, they will rarely appear in Raxia themselves, preferring to send any number of lesser daemons in their stead.

abilities.title: ‚óØMiasma Shroud/25 (32)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Strong poison gas swirls around Geldam. Each time a character attempts a melee attack against this monster, they suffer 2d+10 Poison magic damage, regardless of success or failure.

This poison gas deflects incoming arrows and bullets and has the same effect as the Fairy Magic spell [Missile Protection].

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Metamagic/Targets], [Rune Master], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Poison Breath/24 (31)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
With "Range: Caster," it scatters smoky poison breath around it and deals to "Target: 1 area (6m Radius)/20" 2d+20 Poison magic damage.

This ability can only be used once every 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Sweeping Attack
abilities.description:
Geldam makes a Weapon attack against all enemies that it can reach. If [üó®Power Strike III] is declared, the damage is added to any one of the hit characters. The effect of [üó® Magic Weapon] becomes the success value of the Accuracy check for all targets.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: üó®Magic Weapon
abilities.description:
Changes the success value of the Accuracy check with the weapon to 35 without rolling any dice.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike III
abilities.description: They can deal an additional +20 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.description:
Against melee attacks, the Upper Body and Head sections receive a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when Lower Body section falls to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description:
A lost soul bound to a shadow, Ghasts live a sorry existence. Originally thought to have been created during the Magic Civilization period, Ghasts continue to spawn and thrive today in the shadows of civilization. The reason for their creation has been forgotten to time, though their extremely gaunt frame and pitch-black body are difficult to forget. Ghasts are not known to be solitary, so if one is seen, others are sure to follow.

Occasionally, Ghasts will be summoned by Barbarous carrying magical stones. These stones are given to the regular members by Drakes, who keep close the secret of manufacturing.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: It is a Ghast that has grown to an immensely powerful level, often leading an army of Ghasts and playing the role of Ghast leader.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected

allmonsters.description: It is called the Ghast King and is the control point of all Ghasts. It looks like a giant Ghast without hands, and has no offensive abilities of its own. However, it can summon an inexhaustible number of Ghast species with its never-ending magic power, and can strengthen them. It can also make Ghasts disappear and create a storm with its mana, making it difficult for even moderately skilled adventurers to deal with it.

abilities.title: ‚óØ3 Actions
abilities.description: It can take 3 Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Ghast Enhancing
abilities.description: The Ghast King enhances all Ghasts, including itself, within "Range: Caster" with "Target: All Areas (20m Radius) / All." Targets gain a +1 bonus to all Skill Checks and +2 points to Damage and Defense for 10 seconds (1 round). This effect is cumulative.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Ghast Summoning
abilities.description:
Ghast King summons a Ghast within "Range: Touch." The Ghast to be summoned is selected from 1 x Ghast Queen, 2 x Ghast Bishop, 3 x Ghast Knight, or 6 x Ghast Lurker. On the same round it cannot summon the same types of Ghasts (but can summon the same Ghasts on different rounds). Summoned Ghasts can start their actions immediately.

This ability cannot be used on the turn when [‚ñ∫Ghast Rampage] is used.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Ghast Rampage / Can't
abilities.description:
The monster causes the magic power of the Ghast it follows to go out of control, creating a storm of mana. This unique skill is effective for ‚ÄúTarget: 1 area (5m radius) / Space with "Range: Caster". Up to 5 Ghasts within the area of this unique skill die and inflict physical damage of (2d x the number of Ghast species destroyed) points to all selected characters within the area.

This ability can be used only once per round. Also, a Ghast King cannot use this ability on the turn it used [‚ñ∫Ghast Summoning].

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

allmonsters.description: These Ghast Knights have been trained to use weapons and still retain some martial prowess from when they were once alive. Now able to fight and move efficiently, their understanding of commands has grown as well. They can be seen commanding other weaker Ghasts.

allmonsters.description:
This is a slightly grown-up Ghast, about the size of an adult Human, otherwise the same as a Ghast.

In rare cases, there are Ghast Lurkers that act of their own volition.

Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: This is a bloated queen of Ghasts who has engulfed other Ghasts. Although she has no unique skills, she has acquired a formidable fighting ability and is a considerable threat to any visitor to her ruins.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
Ghosts are a manifestation of the thoughts of the dead and dying, given an ethereal form after their original body has passed away. They retain their appearance in life and what knowledge they have learned over their lifetime, though this may be of questionable usefulness as time passes.

It also has memories, but most of them are distorted. The strength varies greatly from class to class and from one individual to another (the values given here are those of an ordinary person turned into a Ghost without any particular class, etc.). So, GM might change Ghost data to account for a specific individual.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Tempting Lure/4 (11)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
The Ghost whispers to "Target: 1 Entire Character" in "Range/Area: 1 (10m)/ Target". If the target fails to resist, the Ghost may have that character move according to the Ghost's whim.

Affected characters cannot move very quickly and cannot use magic or attack. If the Ghost does not order the character to move, the character will stand in position unconscious.

This effect is treated as a psychic type (weak) and lasts for 1 day.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
The Ghost Curtain is a fabric-like Construct that was created during the Magic Civilization Period. It moves by hanging down and floating in the air.

This Construct serves as a trap or a guard. Normally, it is invisible and remains vigilant of its surroundings. However, if something approaches within a 10-meter range or if it is attacked, it immediately engages in combat. During combat, it either emits a dazzling light that burns its surroundings or clenches a part of its body like a fist and strikes the enemy.

When the Ghost Curtain comes into contact with another person or experiences interference, it emits light in various ways depending on its strength and type. It is said that during the Magic Civilization Period, the wizard-king Ral, who lived in the rock country of Reckode Country on Floating Rocks, would float this construct in the air and enjoy the sight of it emitting light when birds and other creatures accidentally swooped down on it.

Although most of the Ghost Curtains were destroyed in the battle when Reckode exploded, there are still a few that remain floating and invisible. The Cyrecode Council (see CO) has a policy of preserving them as a tourist resource if they are found at a safe distance from the environment. However, if they are found near a satellite or gondola cable, they are to be removed by an adventurer.

abilities.title: ‚óØConditional Invisibility
abilities.description:
This monster is usually invisible (see CR II, p. 69). It emits light when it successfully passes its Accuracy check, fails its Evasion check, or loses 1 point of HP or MP. After emitting light, the monster becomes visible for the next 10 seconds (1 round).

The color and strength of the emitted light depend on various factors such as the type of attack, whether HP or MP was damaged, and so on (up to the GM).

abilities.title: ‚óØInvisible Assassin / 18 / Danger Sense / Negates
abilities.description: If a character approaches a location where this monster is lurking, they need to make a Danger Sense check with target number 18. If they fail, they will be taken by surprise by this monster.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Burst Light / 8 (15) / Willpower / Half
abilities.description: The ability "Range: Caster" emits a burst of light and deals energy magic damage to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius) / 5". The damage inflicted is "2d+10" if the monster was invisible just before using this ability, and "2d+4" points otherwise. This ability costs 6 MP and cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: A pitch-black horse made of shadow with a mane of flames, the Ghost Horse is dangerous on its own but is often seen as a mount for more powerful undead. Its eyes are a piercing blood-red, and its body will occasionally have gouts of flame burst forth.

abilities.title: ‚óØShadow Body
abilities.description:
When in shadowy areas or at night, the Ghost Horse automatically melds with the shadows, becoming impossible to see without Darkvision. While unnoticed, it can also move through otherwise solid obstacles, such as walls and barriers.

However, while being seen by a character, this unique skill is lost.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Burning Gaze/13 (20)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: The Ghost Horse gazes with "Range/Area: 2 (20m) / Target" and "Target: 1 Character," igniting the target and dealing 2d + 10 Fire magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Kick Away/13 (20)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: The Ghost Horse unleashes a double-barrel kick on a character in the same skirmish area. The character is kicked to the rearguard area (Simplified Combat) or to any direction chosen by the monster (Standard/Advanced Combat) at 20m, and falls down with "20" points of fall damage.

allmonsters.description:
A Ghoul is an undead that eats rotting corpses. Their "prey" is left to decay for a while after the kill, so that the Ghoul can feed off of the rot and corruption. Compared to Zombies, a Ghoul decays at a much slower rate due to the toxin in their system. When the toxin is extracted from the body, it can be used on wood to preserve it.

Additionally, the amber sediment inside a Ghoul's eye can be extracted and solidified into a small disc, which has taken the colloquial name "ghoul coin" among collectors of such objects.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Double Attack
abilities.description: It can attack the same target twice in one action with its Claws.

abilities.title: ‚óØParalyzing Poison/5 (12)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
If a Claw attack hits and deals at least 1 applied damage, the target has a -2 penalty to Evasion checks for 30 seconds (3 rounds). This effect is not cumulative.

This effect is Poison type.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
Seemingly identical to the Ghoul, a Ghoul Mage has the intellect to understand human speech. They prefer to live at the same level as humans, and despite being Ghouls, they eat fresh meat and often use it to trap creatures.

Rarely will one find a Ghoul Mage with enough mana that it even crystallizes in the "Ghoul Coin." These high-quality coins glitter with an unearthly pattern and will undoubtedly fetch quite the price to the right collector.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.description: It can attack the same target twice in one action with its Claws.

abilities.description:
If a Claw attack hits and deals at least 1 applied damage, the target has a -2 penalty to Evasion checks for 30 seconds (3 rounds). This effect is not cumulative.

This effect is Poison type.
