Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
Gian Fomors are incredibly powerful Fomor Giant generals who once led entire legions of Barbarous. At present, however, no Gian Fomors are in command, as the higher-level Drakes are very wary of rebellion and are keeping them subdued.

Usually, Gian Fomors are given nominal assignments and relegated to the far reaches and frontiers of the Barbarous territories. Their subordinates, too, are merely watchdogs, whose movements are constantly reported to the higher Drakes. Gian Fomors, however, have not lost their former vigor. They spend their long years in hiding, believing that one day Fomor's legions will sweep the earth.

abilities.title: ‚óØChain Attack
abilities.description: After an attack, Gian Fomor can attack the same target again, regardless of its success or failure. This ability can add only one additional attack per round.

abilities.title: ‚óØCounter
abilities.description: Identical effect as the Combat Feat [Counter].

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Technique & ‚óØMuscle Mystery
abilities.description: Can use [Cat's Eye], [Beetleskin], [Bear Muscle], [Giant Arms], [Titan's Foot], [Troll Vitals], and [Recovery (14 points)]. These Techniques have twice the normal duration.

abilities.title: ‚è©Stratagem and Maneuver/All Areas (50m Radius)
abilities.description:
Can use [Surging Offense IV: Radiant Strikes] (Accuracy +1, Physical Damage +1).

Every third turn, they can use [Maneuver: Unexpected Blow II] (+4 Accuracy, +4 Damage). They cannot use Stratagems if no other allies will be affected by them.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle +4/None
abilities.description:
Fomor height prevents enemies from attacking it.

The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. When the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

allmonsters.description: Giant Balloon Seeds were first cultivated during the Magitech Civilization but have since begun to grow wild. They resemble flowering plants of about 3 meters in length and attack by firing fist-sized seeds from their flower. They are capable of using their roots as legs to move about and these extended vines to protect their flowers from attack. Some individual Giant Balloon Seeds have grown in size and possess a greater number of flowers.

abilities.title: ‚óØSubstitution
abilities.description:
When the Flower section suffers damage from a melee or ranged attack, either Vine section can take the damage instead. The damage applied to the Flower applied as-is to the Vine (without recalculation). This unique skill can only be used once per round for each Vine.

Giant Balloon Seed cannot use this unique skill against ranged or melee with multiple targets or wide-area attacks.

allmonsters.description: Giant Bats are flying mammals that suck blood from animals. Using ultrasonic waves inaudible to humans, the Bat can find its prey by hearing how the waves echo back to it (echolocation), allowing it to fly around and search for prey in darkness.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Giant Bat receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØBloodsucking
abilities.description: If a Bite attack hits, the monster's HP is restored by a value equal to the applied damage.

allmonsters.description: These huge boars, which live in forests and mountains and reach more than 5 meters in length, are omnivores and are feared as demolishers of the environment because of their appetite for devouring anything and everything they can find and the wildness that they can rampage about on their huge bodies. They are extremely belligerent and territorial and will react with fierce hostility to anyone who approaches them.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Trample
abilities.description:
A melee attack is applied to the targets within "Range/Area: 1 (25m) / Breakthrough", and a melee attack is applied to each target by any one section of this monster.

Once this ability is used, all sections will complete the Major Action.

This ability cannot be used if the HP of the Body section is 0 or less.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Full Speed Rush
abilities.description:
This ability can only be used in a melee.

Giant Bohr rampages around and leaves the melee. It changes position to an adjacent area in the backward direction (Simplified Combat) or to any coordinates within 25m front or back (Standard Combat, Advanced Combat).

allmonsters.description: Measuring on average 2m, a Giant Crab uses its size, bulk, and powerful pincers to take down their prey. It's even said that some land-based animals have been caught and eaten by Giant Crabs.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: Can make two Pincers attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

allmonsters.description:
This huge eagle is 3 meters in length and over 5 meters in height. It preys on animals as large as a human adults by weakening them with its sharp claws and taking them to its nest.

Sometimes flying Barbarous train them and keep them as pets.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Giant Eagle receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: üó®Dive Attack
abilities.description:
The Giant Eagle dives down from a high altitude down on the unsuspecting prey.

The Accuracy check is increased by +2, and the damage increases by 4 points. As a risk, the Giant Eagle receives a -3 penalty on the Evasion checks.

loottable.loot: Feathers of the Bird of Prey (400G/Red A)

allmonsters.description:
Found throughout the continent of Alframe in wastelands with little fruitfulness, this is a huge mass of cottony hairs up to 3 meters in length. They are sometimes seen floating in the wind.

It attacks any creature that comes near it and plants hairs on its body. The hairs absorb the host's life force and sprout as a seedbed.

They are called "Deadly Fluff" by merchants, travelers, and adventurers, who are told to stay away from them and run away if they see them.

abilities.title: ‚óØFluff Body
abilities.description: The monster does not receive a critical hit from blunt weapons and is treated as having a Defense value of 3 points higher against blunt weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Giant FlÔæ∫ll is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØFluff Scatter/Can't
abilities.description: If the target character (a character who is hit by a Slam or a character who hits this monster with a melee attack) automatically gains 1 "fluff point". This effect accumulates until the number of "fluff points" reaches 5.

abilities.title: ‚óØFluff Explosion/Can't
abilities.description:
The Fluff section explodes and scatters cotton wool within "Range: Caster" when its HP becomes 0. In "Target: 1 area (5m Radius)/15," gets 1d x "fluff points." Fluff points are accumulated until the number of points reaches 5 for each target.

After this effect occurs, the Fluff section automatically fails the Death Check.

abilities.title: ‚óØFluff Disease/11 (18)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
A character with 1 or more "fluff points" receives "fluff points" of fixed damage at the end of their turn. This effect is a disease type and lasts for 1 day.

A character can pull out the fluff from "Target: 1 Character" (including itself) within "Range: Touch" with a Major Action. This makes the target's "fluff points" automatically reduced by -1.

allmonsters.description:
This is a gigantic fly with a body length of over 50 cm. They attack mainly animals, cutting them with their sharp mouthparts and sucking their blood to fill their bellies.

They frequently act in herds. Such herds tend to target larger objects because of the ease of attacking them as a group.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: Receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØConstant Attacks
abilities.description:
If an attack by a Giant Gadfly is evaded, the next attack by the Giant Gadfly on that target will gain a +1 bonus to the Accuracy checks until end of the monster's turn.

This modifier is cumulative for all Giant Gadflies and has no upper limit. However, it is lost once the Giant Gadfly hits or the last Giant Gadfly attack of the round is avoided.

allmonsters.description: This subspecies of giant crabs has adapted to life in cold regions, specifically dwelling in riverbanks and shoals. It is characterized by its white shell and measures approximately 1.5 meters in length. While the shell itself is not very durable, the entire exterior of the crab's body is covered in hair that contains sensory organs. This hairy covering is believed to provide protection against the cold as well.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Icebubble Breath / 6 (13) / Fortitude / Half
abilities.description: Within "Range: Touch" it sprays icy bubbles at up to three targets, dealing 2d+3 points of Water/Ice magic damage. This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

loottable.loot: Snow White Shell (600G / Red Gold A)

allmonsters.description:
A carnivorous reptile about 2m long. Adventurers should be wary of lone Giant Lizards, as their companions tend to wait in ambush for unwary stragglers.

In rare cases, there are those specimens with finer scales than usual. If enough of these scales can be harvested and brought to a skilled armorsmith, high-quality scale mail can be made.

For the mount version of this monster, see Giant Lizard (mount).

abilities.description: None.

allmonsters.description: Giant Zombie is born from the corpse of a Giant. These are just a few examples of Giant Zombies, and the strength of Giant Zombies varies greatly depending on the race and the individual.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 10 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, each section of Giant Zombie recovers 10 HP. This has no effect if the section has 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫War Cry/18 (25)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
The Giant Zombie unleashes a powerful yell, causing fear for "Range: Caster" and "Target: 2-3 areas (10m Radius) / All". This fear, treated as a Psychic effect, gives a -2 penalty to all Action rolls for the next 30 seconds (3 rounds).

This effect is treated as Psychic type.

abilities.title: üó®Simultaneous Attack
abilities.description: A Giant Zombie's Weapon can attack all characters in the same skirmish. Each Accuracy Check is made with a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description: A Giant Zombie's height prevents enemies from attacking it. The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description:
Gilmen are Humanoid in shape, with fish-like faces and covered in fine scales from head to toe. Able to breathe and move in water without penalty, Gilmen tend to live close to, if not in, the water. Caves and estuaries near rivers are common Gilman settlements, but there are also underwater civilizations as well.

Gilmen tend to share few to no values with Humanoid races and are fairly emotionless. In combat, a Gilman will fight to win, and will protect allies even if it becomes disadvantageous to do so. They are also rather stoic and will not panic, even if abandoned by their allies.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Feint Attack
abilities.description: The Gilman receives a +1 Accuracy bonus to the next attack. Characters wearing metal armor are unaffected.

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Basilisk, Drakish, Arcana
allmonsters.description:
Glass Basilisks are a higher species of Basilisk possessed of glass evil eye. Their petrification gaze turns the victim into a translucent glass statue. This variant of Basilisk prefers cold climates, and bears a weakness to fire and high heat.

Its second evil eye possesses the power of paralyzation, which, once seen, is difficult to escape from.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: Can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Universal Metamagic], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚è©Glass Gaze / 13 (20) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 2 (50m) / Target," the Glass Basilisk gazes at a "Target: 1 Character", afflicting them with petrification (Dexterity / Agility -6). This effect eventually turns the target into a clear glass statue instead of a stone statue, but can be countered with [Cure Stone].

If the victim is holding a mirror is targeted with this ability, and if the Success Value of the Willpower check is 4 or more points greater than the target value, the gaze can be reflected and its effect applied to the Glass Basilisk, which does not get its own Willpower check.

This effect occurs even if the Glass Basilisk is blindfolded, etc. and is treated as a curse effect.

This ability can only be used once a round.

abilities.title: ‚è©Paralyzing Gaze / 12 (19) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 2 (50m)/Target," the Glass Basilisk gazes at the target, restricting its movement. If affected, the target cannot make a Full Move for 10 seconds (1 round). This also prevents special movement due to the effects of magic or items. The victim can only walk and fly using its own innate physical abilities. The ability to use the Combat Feat [Shadow Sneak] is also lost, along with other movement-assisting effects.

This ability can only be used once a round.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoisonous Blood / 13 (20) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: Anyone within the same Skirmish area who deals damage to this monster receives 2d+4 Poison magic damage at the end of their turn.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Monstrous Form
abilities.description:
The monster transforms into its monstrous form. For data on this form, see Glass Basilisk (Monstrous Form). Its HP and MP are restored to their maximum values, and all effects of spells and the like are removed. When [‚ñ∫Monstrous Form] is activated, the new Body section is treated as if it took a Major Action. The Head section may take Major Action on this turn. Also, [Evil Left Eye] and [Evil Right Eye] sections can use their gaze abilities on their turn if the Basilisk has not already used it for its turn.

The ability [‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after using [‚ñ∫Monstrous Form].

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Basilisk, Drakish, Arcana
allmonsters.sections: 4 (Right Evil Eye / Left Evil Eye / Body / Head)
allmonsters.description: A Glass Basilisk that has shown its true form: A large lizard about 5m long, with one eye milky-white and cloudy and the other colorless and transparent. In this form, unlike its rational human form, the Glass Basilisk is driven by emotion and tramples all those before it.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoisonous Blood / 14 (21) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: This is the same as the Glass Basilisk (Human Form), except for the difference in Resistance value.

abilities.title: ‚è©Glass Gaze / 14 (21) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description: This is the same as the Glass Basilisk (Human Form), except for the difference in Resistance value.

abilities.title: ‚è©Paralyzing Gaze / 14 (21) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description: This is the same as the Glass Basilisk (Human Form), except for the difference in Resistance value.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: Can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Universal Metamagic], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØStanding Upright
abilities.description: If the HP of [Section: Body] is reduced to 0 or less, all other Sections receive a -2 penalty to their Evasion.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Humanization
abilities.description:
It instantly transforms into Human form. Refer to Glass Basilisk (Human Form) for data on the Human form. If the Body section has suffered HP or MP damage or has been affected by magic or other effects, these are carried over to the Human form. If its HP is less than 0, it immediately falls unconscious.

[‚è©‚ñ≥Instant Humanification] cannot be used for 1 hour immediately after using [‚ñ∫Monstrous Form].

allmonsters.description: An earthen fairy, Gnomes are tiny in stature, typically appearing as 1m tall bearded older men. However, there are also female and child Gnomes, though they do not usually appear outside Gnome settlements. The older male Gnomes will fight fiercely to protect these other Gnomes. Because of this, Gnomes have a reputation for valuing strength in the face of adversity and watching friends and family.

abilities.title: ‚óØWind Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Gnome is hit by Wind-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Metamagic/Targets] and [MP Save/Fairy Tamer].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Quake/10 (17)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
Within "Range: Caster" can cause a localized earthquake and makes "Target: all areas (30m radius)/All" fall prone down. Targets cannot get up for 1 minute(6 rounds).

Characters not touching the ground are immune to this unique skill

allmonsters.description:
Shorter and more hunched than Humans, Goblins have green skin, short limbs, large eyes, and a large mouth.

They are small Youma that abuse anyone weaker than them, yet immediately beg for their lives when they are overmatched. They do not reflect or learn from their actions, and are quick to commit treason.

They are highly fertile and mainly work in groups. Generally goblins are not very smart, but they are resourceful. They often steal and rob to survive. They also completely lack the reflex to flee from danger.

abilities.description: None.

allmonsters.description:
A Goblin High King is so powerful that it is called the "Only King" among Goblins. Its height is over 2 meters, and its presence is enough to intimidate even the most powerful Barbarous.

In battle, he sacrifices many of his men while assessing the capabilities of his opponents and exploiting gaps in their defenses to launch a wave of attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØWait Action
abilities.description: If this monster loses initiative at the start of combat, it can perform two Major Actions in the first round.

abilities.title: ‚óØHigh King
abilities.description:
All "Target: 1 Entire Character" within "Range/Area: 2 (50m) / Target" around the Goblin High King are inspired by his presence and gain a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks, increasing their damage by +2 points for 10 seconds (1 round). However, while under this effect, they cannot restore HP and MP. If the affected allies are Barbarous of Level 7 or lower, this effect is considered to be "Resistance: Can't", otherwise it is "Resistance: Optional". It is treated as a Psychic effect with a Success Value of 20.

Although it can be used as many times as the High King wants during its turn, its effects do not stack on a target.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional 4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫King's Authority / 10 (17) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
The Goblin High King makes its presence known to "Target: All Areas (20m Radius) / All". They will be unable to target with melee attacks, ranged attacks, magic, or other effects that harm the Goblin High King for 10 seconds (1 round).

Using this effect consumes 5 points of MP.

allmonsters.description: Dressed in flashy costumes, Goblin Lords represent the royals who lead Goblins from amongst the ranks of Goblin Shamans. They prefer to live under the protection of many other goblins, and thus rarely appear in the Humanoid realm.

abilities.title: üó®Power Attack I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional +4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚è©Aspect/All Areas (20m Radius)
abilities.description: Can use [Heavenly Domain: Invisible Pavilion], [Earth Domain: Healing Earth], and [Spirit Domain: Determination] with 2 Qi points.

abilities.title: ‚óØKing's Pride
abilities.description: Gains +1 to Skill Checks it performs as long as there is a goblin other than the Goblin Lord in the same battlefield (defined as any creature with "Goblin" in its name [except for High Goblins] that is also Barbarous).

allmonsters.description: This is a higher class Goblin Youma. They look like ordinary Goblins, but they are decorated with dark-colored bird feathers and gems. They are more intelligent than ordinary Goblins and can use magic.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 5 Level/Magic Power 8 (15)
abilities.description: Types used are "Earth", "Fire", "Wind", and "Dark".

abilities.title: üó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: Can use [Metamagic/Targets] Combat Feat.

allmonsters.description:
Godbells are subservient daemons, also known as "formless daemons." They are completely invisible, even after death, so their true appearance is unknown. Their unique skills, however, allow Godbells to be extraordinary assassins.

It is feared as a Daemon that is difficult to counter since it can permeate space and can slip through walls to surprise its enemies.

abilities.title: ‚óØComplete Invisibility
abilities.description: Godbell is always invisible. See rules for invisibility (CR II, p. 69).

abilities.title: ‚óØInvisible Assassin/20/Danger Sense/Negates
abilities.description: If a character approaches a location where this monster is lurking, they need to make a Danger Sense check with target number 20. If they fail, they will be taken by surprise by this monster.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Godbell can make two Claws attacks each round. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Space Warp
abilities.description:
The monster can move 2 meters through the space itself without being affected by any obstacles or magic effects. There must be no other objects or characters at the destination.

Note that this ability has a very limited effect in combat (it is meaningless in Simplified Combat, and even in Standard Combat, the distance is insufficient to get past the skirmish).

allmonsters.description:
Golden Ash is a swarm of very small insects with golden shells. The entire swarm shares a single consciousness and acts as a single organism.

Golden Ash inhabits ruins and underground labyrinths and usually remains still and calm. In this state, Golden Ash looks like a pile of gold dust, and adventurers dazzled by its treasures may carelessly approach it and become its victims. The Golden Ash devours the bones of its poor victims, and then once again mimics gold dust as it waits for the next victim to come along. When the Golden Ash is defeated, the silver coins and jewelry of its former victims can be found buried among its remains.

abilities.title: ‚óØMimicry / 25 / Danger Sense / Negates
abilities.description:
It mimics gold sand. While mimicking, characters cannot perform a Monster Knowledge check on this monster. If a character approaches it unintentionally, they need to make a Danger check with Target Number 25, and if it fails, they will be surprised. Mimicry will automatically end once the monster starts to act.

This monster can be detected with [Sense Magic].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Devouring Swarm/Can‚Äôt
abilities.description: Countless swarms of golden dust crawl up and attack the target. It deals 2d + 1/5 of Golden Ash remaining HP (rounded down) magic damage to a character within a Melee Attack range.

abilities.title: ‚óØWriggling Swarm
abilities.description:
It is immune from criticals from any weapon attacks.

It cannot be the target of Throw or similar attacks.

It can receive only 1 applied magic damage from "Area: Target" and "Target: 1 Character" magic and effects.

Characters cannot use Combat Feats [Targeting] or [Magic Control] in the skirmish areas where this monster resides on any character within, including Golden Ash.

allmonsters.description:
This is a construct in the shape of a human head from the neck up. It is gigantic, 3 meters in height, and is floating with the help of magic. It is made of a special metal, and its surface is golden and shiny. It has a few curved surfaces, and many small planes are connected by sharp corners and edges to form the face.

During the Magic Civilization Period, they were mainly used as gatekeepers of important facilities such as treasuries. Even today, when encountered inside the ruins, the gatekeepers protect such places and act to keep intruders out.

abilities.title: ‚óØSuperalloy Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from magical or weapon attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØ3 Actions (At Random)
abilities.description: The monster can take 3 Major Actions in one round. Each Major Action is randomly selected by the table with 1d rolled. The same Major Action may be selected more than once.

allmonsters.description: This is a large nut, about 1m long. They are soft and moderately teardrop- shaped. When provoked, it sprinkles juice around it to protect itself.

abilities.title: ‚óØChange Color
abilities.description: The color of the whole body changes according to the remaining HP; it turns red when the HP is less than half (24) and purple when the HP is less than one-fourth (12). Once the color is changed, it does not change back even if the HP is recovered.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Juice Splash/7 (14)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
Sprays juice around itself. Within "Range: Caster" deals 2d+2 magic damage to "1 area (3m radius)/5".

If the color of the monster is red, the target is blinded for 1 day after failing the resistance check. If the color of the monster is purple, the Gradient Plum gains a +2 bonus to the Standard Values of this unique skill. Damage and its accompanying effects are all of the disease types.

This unique skill costs 5 MP.

allmonsters.description: Among the Coast Lizards, this particular individual possesses exceptional vitality and hunting abilities, growing significantly larger than others. It is a dangerous specimen.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
The monster can use its tail to attack up to 3 targets in the same skirmish. An Accuracy check is made on all characters at once, and damage is determined individually.

This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

allmonsters.description: This is a large golem in the shape of a sea turtle with a granite shell.

abilities.title: ‚óØRock Body
abilities.description: A Granite Shell is immune to criticals from edged weapons and all magic damage, except Energy-type damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater Specialization
abilities.description: Can move in water without penalties and restrictions. Conversely, all action checks are subject to a -2 penalty on the ground.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Shell Guard
abilities.description:
The Granite Shell can retract into its shell, increasing its Defense by +10 for 10 seconds (1 round).

[[div class="golemitems"]]

abilities.title: ‚ÄªHead Only
abilities.description:
Spinel Horn (Large) (3,000) (‚ñ∫Charge)

Blue Lotus Jade (Large) (8,000)

‚ñ∫Blizzard Breath/14 (21)/Fortitude/Half

Golem sprays a jet of water with "Range/Area: 20m/ Shot" in a "Target: 4m Radius/10", dealing 2d+12 water/ice magic damage. This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

Calcite Compound Eyes (Large) (4,000) (‚óØBreath Control)

abilities.title: ‚ÄªBody Only
abilities.description:
Obsidian Shield (Large) (3,000) (üó®‚ñ≥Cover II)

Corundum Protection (Large) (2,000) (‚óØGuardian II)

Lapis Lazuli Weight (Large) (4,000) (üó®Tail Swing I)

‚îîQuartz Counterweight (Large) (6,000) (üó®Tail Swing II)

abilities.title: ‚ÄªAny Section
abilities.description:
Amber Eye (Large) (10,000) (‚óØUltimate Aim = +4 Accuracy)

Garnet of Vitality (Large) (4,000) (‚óØHP Enhancement = Max HP +15)

‚îîFocused Garnet of Vitality (Large) (6,000) (‚óØImproved HP Enhancement = Max HP +15)

Shimmering Onyx (Large) (3,000) (‚óØMana Coating = Magic damage -3)

abilities.title: ‚ÄªAll Section Must be Equipped
abilities.description: Red Iron Blood (Large) (2,000) (‚óØMobility Enhancement = Movement +5) [[/div]]

allmonsters.description:
This is a plant that floats by its roots and absorbs nutrients from the atmosphere. The total height of the plant is about 3 meters, but the root part is heavier than a piece of iron of the same size. How it floats is a mystery, and the wise men who are trying to figure it out are eagerly waiting for the roots to be brought back.

Gravity Roots can control gravity around itself, preventing flight and movement, and send leaves flying like arrows to finish off prey.

abilities.title: ‚óØGravity Wedge / 16 (23) / Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
It alters gravity, increasing weight and burden and interfering with the actions of creatures. Within "Ranger: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (30m Radius)/Space," must perform a Willpower check at the start of each turn, and if they fail, their movement is halved (rounded up) for 10 seconds (1 round) and they cannot fly.

Furthermore, if the success value of the resistance for this unique skill is 4 or more points lower than the Target Number, the character will fall prone and will not be able to perform any movement, Minor Actions or declare Combat Feats for the same duration.

abilities.title: ‚óØSwarm
abilities.description:
When targeting the Gravity Root or another character in the same skirmish with a ranged attack or magic, the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Magic Control] cannot be used.

If all Leaf sections fall to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Throw Leaves
abilities.description: The Bladed Leaf attack can be performed as a thrown attack with "Range: 1 Area (30m)." Accuracy check and damage are the same as for normal attacks, and the number of leaves is infinite.

loottable.loot: Heavy Root (2,300G / Gold Green Black S)
Keenly Sharpened Leaves (500G / Green A) x 1d

allmonsters.description: This is one of the strongest Vargs, reaching over 2.5 meters in height. If in a herd, they act as leaders. As a mutual recognition of strength, they often carry the Dark Trolls on their backs.

abilities.title: ‚óØRage
abilities.description:
When another Varg (of any type) in the same skirmish is defeated, the Brutal Varg gains a cumulative +2 bonus to damage for 10 seconds (1 round).

The GM decides when a Varg is defeated (incapacitated or dead).

abilities.title: ‚óØFinal Reprimand
abilities.description:
When its HP falls to 0 or below, it emits a cry that inspires and empowers surrounding Vargs. All Vargs (of any type) within "Range: Caster" and "Target: All areas (30m radius)/All" gain a +4 bonus to Accuracy checks and +4 to Damage until the end of their next turn.

This effect is not cumulative.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike II
abilities.description: A Great Varg can deal an additional +12 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

loottable.loot: Beautiful Mythical Beast Hide (800G/Gold Red A)
Silver-white Mythical Beast Hide (3,600G/Gold Red S)

allmonsters.description:
This is a mature dragon, about 2,000 years old. Its total length is nearly 20 meters, and its strength rivals that of the armies of great nations. For this reason, most people think of them more like a natural disaster than an enemy to be defeated.

They are sensitive and will not tolerate any interference. They will direct all of their dragon clan to destroy unwanted intruders if they come to their territory uninvited.

They are also well known in history and magic but often cannot remember the details of incredibly old matters and may add fictional details to fill those gaps.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: The Greater Dragon can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic], and [Rune Master].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Flame and Brilliant Breath/22 (29)/ Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 2 (50m) / Shot", spits out breath to "Target: 1 area (6m Radius)/20" and deals magic damage to the target. In this case, the monster can arbitrarily choose one of the following two types, which differ in damage and type.

Flame Breath: Spits out fire, dealing 2d+30 Fire type.

Brilliant Breath: Spits out an energy mass, dealing 2d+24 Energy type.

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns (whichever breath is used, neither breath can be used in the next turn).

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Wordbreak
abilities.description: Greater Dragon uses [Wordbreak] combat feat using Head's Magic Power.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
The Greater Dragon's size hinders attacks.

The Head of the Greater Dragon cannot be attacked with melee attacks. This unique skill is lost when the Body section has 0 or less HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight II
abilities.description:
All sections receive a +2 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If one of the Wings falls to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: üó®All-Out Attack
abilities.description: A Wing can deal an additional 8 damage on its next attack. However, any Evasion check made by this section this turn receives a -3 penalty.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
The monster can use its tail to attack up to 5 targets in the same skirmish. An Accuracy check is made on all characters at once, and damage is determined individually.

This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

allmonsters.description:
This is a mottled, glowing moss that clings to the outer walls of ruins. The moss and its spores refract light, creating illusions for approaching characters.

The illusion cannot directly harm, but while it is perceived as a threat, the spore poison slowly drains the target's strength, leading to death.

abilities.title: ‚óØWall Moss
abilities.description: It cannot fall prone, nor is it affected by any effect that moves its position (coordinates or area). Also, it is immune to Throw attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited 2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform a Major Action twice in one round. However, it is limited to one each of [‚ñ∫Illusory Light] and [‚ñ∫Toxin Spores].

abilities.title: ‚óØInviting Light/12 (19)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
It produces light that attracts creatures.

Any character within a 50m radius of this monster (in Simplified Combat, all areas) must perform a Willpower check at the start of their turn. If this check fails, the character tries to get as close as possible with its Normal Move. The character can choose any actions they want to make (actions that can only be made with a Limited Move are not allowed).

A character already in the same position (coordinates or area) as Green Cemetery is not affected.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Illusory Light/Can't
abilities.description:
It gives a hallucination, so it fights with itself to "Target: 2-3 areas (10m Radius) / All" and "Range: Caster."

The target must immediately perform an Accuracy check, a Spellcasting check, or a Performance check (the one with the highest standard value). Then, the same target must counter it with an Evasion check or Willpower (those who have mastered the combat feat [Counter] may use an Accuracy check) and compare the success value against each other.

The target is unaffected if there is a tie or the opposing side's success value is higher. However, if the opponent fails to do so, the target is knocked prone by the illusion. In addition, the target will not be able to move or take a Major Action on its turn.

In this comparison of success values, all permanent effects or duration apply to both checks. In the opposite Evasion check or Willpower check, it is possible to use an item to affect the check.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Toxin Spores/11 (18)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: Sprays Toxin Spores within "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (6m Radius) / All", and deals 2d+8 poison magic damage to the targets.

allmonsters.description:
This plant mimics settlements and ruins lined with simple buildings. The plant is a giant flower with a radius of about 30 meters, with six petals that open in a radial pattern. Mimicry is achieved by deforming the numerous tentacles that line the petal's surface. Still, there is also an element of magical illusion, and the monster is assumed to have been modified during the Magic Civilization Period. In the center of each petal is a stamen with a greenish light at the tip. To the uninitiated, it looks like a tower of green lights that brightly illuminate the entire settlement. This light is due to the same effect as the symbiotic organisms of the Lunoicos.

During predation, the tentacles on the surface of the petals break their mimicry, bunch together, and strike at moving objects. The central stamen also attacks using its luminescent ability. The roots beneath the petals must be eliminated in order to defeat it, making it a troublesome monster that should be treated with caution.

abilities.title: ‚óØMimicry/25/Danger Sense/Negates
abilities.description:
It mimics uninhabited settlements and ruins. While mimicking, characters cannot perform a Monster Knowledge check on this monster. If a character approaches it unintentionally, they need to make a Danger check with target number 25, and if it fails, they will be surprised (see CR I, p. 144). Mimicry will be automatically ended once the monster starts to act.

This monster can be detected with [Sense Magic].

abilities.title: ‚óØUnder the Petals
abilities.description: Any character wishing to attack or interfere with this monster must roll 1d at the beginning of its turn. If the number of 1d is not greater than the number of Petal sections of this monster alive, the Roots section of this monster cannot be chosen as a target, including those affecting a wide area, and cannot become a target for that turn. Exceptions are magic and effects that have "Range: 2 (Infinite)" and do not require visibility.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Nutrient Replenishment
abilities.description: Select any Petal sections with HP of 1 or more, and heal their HP by 60 points. Roots can arbitrarily allocate the HP in units of 10 points.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Nutrient Augmentation
abilities.description: In the turn, when this ability is used, the Stamen section will be able to perform [‚ñ∫Light Wave] twice.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Light Wave/20 (27)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: With "Range/Area: 2 (30m) / Shot," deals 2d+16 energy magic damage to "Target: 1 Character".

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Undulating Petals/20 (27)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
The entire petal undulates violently, shaking the character standing above it. The character is knocked prone within "Range: Caster," dealing 2d+25 physical damage to "Target: 1 area (6m Radius) /2 0". Flying, floating, and other characters that do not have their feet on the ground are not affected by this effect.

Only one Petal section can use this unique skill each turn.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Confusing Scene/20 (27)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Petal's tentacles disorient the surrounding characters.

All characters within "Range: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (30m Radius)/All" should roll 1d. If the roll is "1-2", the character cannot take a Major Action on their turn for 10 seconds (1 round). This effect does not apply to characters other than with five senses perception.

Only one Petal section can use this unique skill each turn.

allmonsters.description:
Gremlins look like infants with hair all over their bodies, with small fangs and bat-like wings. They work hard and are mischievous, sometimes tricking and kidnapping Humanoid children or robbing livestock.

They like to break things like watermills and windmills. Because of that, Humanoids use "Gremlin laughed" as a synonym for failing devices.

Gremlins have the same position as Bolgs in the Barbarous army.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Gremlin receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

allmonsters.description:
These are Giants of about 4 meters in length that inhabit seashores, reefs, lakes, etc. They are sometimes found together with Tannoz.

They are especially dangerous underwater.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Water Blast/12 (19)/Fortitude/Neg
abilities.description:
It slams the water's surface as hard as possible, generating waves.

Within "Range: Caster" and "Target: 1 area (4m radius) / 10," the target falls prone. This effect does not apply to characters not restricted while in the water by abilities such as [‚óØUnderwater Aptitude], [‚óØUnderwater Specialization], [‚óØUnderwater], or [Sword's Grace/Gentle Water].

This unique skill can only be used on or underwater.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Grendel's height prevents enemies from attacking them. The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description:
This large wildcat has grown to a size of 2m. The Grey Lynx is keen on hiding itself and avoids Human-sized prey, which leads children to think of these cats as myths.

While fur is not quite a luxury, there is still a steady enough demand for it. There may also be seeds from unknown plants stuck in the fur, some of which may yet still sprout.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If a Grey Lynx successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

allmonsters.description:
A large bear with grey-brown fur, Grizzlies can stand on their hind legs to intimidate would-be predators, standing around 2-3m tall. In the summer, they will rarely appear to those wandering in the wilderness, but as the seasons change, they will attack livestock to build up bulk for their winter hibernation. Grizzlies are especially dangerous during the springtime, as they are ravenously hungry after hibernation.

Bear paws, specifically the right paw, are used as ingredients in high-end cuisine, as the right paw is used to scoop honey. It is said that honey has infused itself into the bear's skin, giving the paw an almost sweet, gamey flavor. The left paw, however, is rarely used and often discarded as there is little demand for it.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Double Attack
abilities.description: A Grizzly Bear can make two Claw attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØBear Hug
abilities.description:
If the Grizzly Bear successfully hits with [‚ñ∫Double Attack], it will hold the target, and the target will not be able to move or make melee or ranged attacks. Each round, the held target is hit automatically by the Grizzly Bear, dealing 2d + 16 damage.

When the target tries to escape, use the de-bonding rules.

While entangled by this unique skill, the Grizzly Bear cannot attack other characters. If the monster itself wants to release the target, it can do so with a Minor Action.

abilities.title: üó®Power Attack
abilities.description: They can deal an additional +4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

allmonsters.description: A Wight born with a stronger grudge than a normal Wight. Although it appears indistinguishable from a Wight, it possesses enlarged claws that have the ability to bestow curses on the target they strike.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison Claw / 8 (15) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: If a Claw attack hits and deals at least 1 point of applied damage, it deals an additional 5 poison magic damage to both the target's HP and MP.

abilities.title: ‚óØGrudge Wight's Curse
abilities.description:
Anyone reduced to 0 HP or below by the Grudge Wight's attack is automatically cursed, without any Resistance Check.

Only after the curse is lifted can the victim recover from its unconscious state. If left attended, one Soulscar will be accumulated for every three days (72 hours) that pass. If the fifth Soulscar is acquired by this fact, the character immediately becomes a Grudge Wight.

A Success Value of 16 or more is required to remove this curse by magic or other means. The character does not lose any Soulscars accumulated by this effect when the curse is removed.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Grudge Return / 7 (14) / Willpower / Half
abilities.description: At "Target: 1 Character" with "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/Target," the Wight expresses its resentment for taking damage. The target will be dealt (20 - the monster's current HP) (minimum 1) Curse magic damage (just 20, not Power 20).

allmonsters.description:
A humanoid daemon with bronze skin and a height of about 3m, Grunels have long tails that they treat like whips.

Some individuals may have magic weapons as well (increasing both Accuracy and damage by +1), and with their aptitude for magic, it is assumed that the Grunel handmade this weapon. If a Grunel with a magic sword is killed, the sword is automatically looted. The GM may decide the sword's type at their own discretion.

Oddly enough, Grunels have been seen in the company of Grassrunners. It is not quite sure what the relationship between the two races is, and neither side is willing to talk about it. However, this has led to the rumor that Grassrunners come from another world.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting] and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +10 damage
abilities.description: A Grunel may deal an additional +10 damage to their next melee attack. If they do, they receive a -2 penalty to Fortitude, and Willpower checks until their next turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØEntangling Tail
abilities.description:
A successful hit from a Tail entangles the target. In each round, the entangled target is hit automatically by the Tail and makes all Accuracy and Evasion Checks with a -2 penalty. This penalty is not cumulative.

When the target tries to escape, use the de-bonding rules.

While entangled by this unique skill, the Tail section cannot attack other characters. If the monster itself wants to release the target, it can do so with a Minor Action.

allmonsters.description:
A mythical beast with the head and wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. Gryphons are surprisingly agile in the air for their bulk and often nest in holes dug into cliffsides. A Gryphon is attracted to and tends to collect shining objects, such as precious metals and gemstones. If they find an intruder trying to steal their shinies, a Gryphon will attack violently. Rarely some Gryphons understand the Trade Common language.

For the mount version of this creature, see Gryphon (mount).

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If a Gryphon successfully hits a target in melee, they may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description:
A Gryphon receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If one of the Wings falls to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

allmonsters.description:
This large Barba is about one meter in length and holds a Bursting Shell and a restore fluid to support front-line Magitech. The fluid solidifies quickly when it touches the damaged part of the Magitech and closes it temporarily.

Both Bursting Shell and the restore liquid are loaded only enough for one use.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bursting Shell Drop/8 (15)/Willpower/ Half
abilities.description:
The bursting shell is dropped on the top of the target. Within "Range: Caster" deals 2d+7 Fire magic damage to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius) / 5".

This ability can only be used once.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Sprinkle Repair Liquid/Can't
abilities.description:
Sprays Magitech restoring liquid to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius) / 5" in "Range: Caster." If the target is a Magitech character, its HP is restored by 2d+7 points.

This effect can be used only once. This monster is always excluded from this effect.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is a mythical beast inhabiting the sea and rivers, with the front half of its body as a crocodile and the back half as a fish.

It circulates in a large territory and attacks violently against those it perceives to be violating its territory. As a result, its territory is a place where there are few dangerous predators. It is often is called the guardian of marine life by fishermen and others who live in the sea. However, they are rarely seen. In some areas, a folk song says, "They live hard and sleep at the bottom of the sea."

For the mount version of this creature, see Gurangatch.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Front Legs attacks each round, though each attack requires its accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 10 Level / Magic Power 12 (19)
abilities.description: It can use Water/Ice, Wind, Light, and Dark types.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description:
They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Wordbreak].

[Multi-Action] can be declared when the monster uses [‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack], and it can cast the spell after the second Accuracy check. The monster instead can use [‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack] after it casts the spell, but not after using [‚ñ∫Jaw Bite].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Jaw Bite/13 (20)/Danger Sense/Negates
abilities.description:
It feints with its arms and attack by biting with its jaws.

Within "Range: Touch" deals with a "Target: 1 Character" 2d+25 physical damage.

This unique skill cannot be used in consecutive turns. Once a character becomes a target of this effect, they gain a +4 bonus on Danger Sense checks to resist this effect until the end of combat.

abilities.title: ‚óØFurious Tail
abilities.description:
In response to the threat to its own life, it becomes furious.

If the current HP of Front is less than 70 points, the Tail damage is increased by +2 points; if it is less than 40 points, another +2 points (total +4 points); if it is less than 15 points, another +4 points (total +8 points).

abilities.title: üó®All-Out Attack
abilities.description: A Tail can deal an additional 8 damage on its next attack. However, any Evasion check made by this section this turn receives a -3 penalty as a risk.

allmonsters.description:
A quadrupedal animal with a large and rigid head, resembling that of a small rhinoceros in overall shape. These creatures are gentle and live in herds in different locations. They have an omnivorous diet and will consume almost anything. During territorial disputes, they surround their enemies and use headbutts as a form of attack.

However, they are not physically strong and are not suitable for domestic tasks such as pulling carts.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

loottable.loot: Fine Quality Rocky Skin (320G / Red A)

allmonsters.description: This is a heavy warrior armed with a large shield and metal armor, a one- handed weapon. They are knights who protect important Humanoid strongholds, such as royal castles and customs posts.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ≥Bodyguard Knowledge
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Block] and [Cover II].

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional 12 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Cat's Eyes], [Beetleskin], and [Bear Muscle] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides and adding +2 to it.

allmonsters.description: This is a 12-armed Giant of about 6 meters in height. When fighting, they carry weapons on 6 arms and shields on the other 6. They value bravery and respect those who come at them fairly and squarely, but they are angry at those who act cowardly. Because of this, they are often entrusted with guarding important places such as the treasury and are not often seen outside.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Swords Dance/Can't
abilities.description:
The Hecatoncheires does a strange, flailing dance that deals (2d x (Remaining Arms) + 5) Physical damage to one target in the same skirmish.

This ability cannot be used when even one Arm has completed its Major Action. Also, after this ability is used, Major Actions of all Arms are completed.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Attacks
abilities.description: Due to the size of the Hecatoncheires, only two Arms can attack the same target in 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike II
abilities.description: They can deal an additional +12 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØLayered Protection
abilities.description: The Defense of Upper Body section is increased by +2 points for each remaining Arm section.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description: Hecatoncheires' height prevents enemies from attacking it. The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description:
Hellhounds are large dogs with jet-black fur, often seen spitting gouts of flame. It is sometimes found in and around a Shallow Abyss, which is why it is also called "Watchdogs of Hell".

Rarely, a red stone with a faint heat may be found inside its body.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fire Breath/5 (12)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
A Hellhound breathes fire in a "Range: Touch", dealing 2d + 4 Fire magic damage to up to 3 targets.

This unique skill cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

allmonsters.description: This is a priest who is not accepted by the Humanoid community and has turned to the worship of Barbarous gods associated with the Second Sword. While hiding their true identity, they work as a spy for Barbarous.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Heretic Priest can use the Combat Feats [Universal Metamagic], [Targeting], [Hawk Eye] and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides and adding +1 to it.

allmonsters.description: This Manticore subspecies knows a deep prophecy about not only magic but also Geomancy. They retreat deep into the mountains and refuse contact with Humanoids and others.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic 7 Level / Magic Power 10 (17)
‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 5 Level / Magic Power 8 (15)
abilities.description:
Can use Earth, Fire, Wind, and Dark types.

This does not change even if the contract pattern is adopted (see MA, p. 136).

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Metamagic/Targets], [Targeting], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚è©Aspect/All Areas (20m Radius)
abilities.description: Knows [Heavenly Domain: Descending Thunder], [Earthly Domain: Quicksand], and [Spirit Domain: Terror] Aspects. The Qi Points to be used are all 3 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØNumbing Poison / 10 (17) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: If the Tail's attack hits and deals 1 or more points of applied damage, it has the effect of Petrifaction (Dexterity/-6) (see CR II, p. 329, or ML, p. 71).

loottable.loot: Beautiful Mythical Beast Hide (800G/Gold Red A)

allmonsters.description:
Hibrayzan is a Magitech soldier designed for close combat, with long arms. Its body is comprised of two spheres, one above the other and one below the other, with the head buried in the body and shaped like a plate. The blades on both arms can be heated red-hot, and the power of their slashes is fearsome.

The blade grows directly from the lower half of the body, spinning as it approaches and cleaving surrounding enemies.

Hibrayzans appear to be intended for operation on top of Kagners, and are often seen working together simultaneously.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two attacks with Cutting Blade each round, though each attack requires its Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØCutting Blade
abilities.description: Any attacks with Cutting Blade treat Defense as halved (rounded up).

abilities.title: ‚óØCool Blade
abilities.description: If the Cutting Blade's HP is reduced by 1 or more points due to physical damage or magical damage of water/ice or lightning type, the Cutting Torch's damage is reduced by 4 points until the end of the next turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +5 points.

abilities.title: ‚è©Combat Maneuver
abilities.description: Hibrayzan flies around in a complex trajectory while floating. The Upper Body section gains a +1 bonus to its Accuracy and Evasion checks. At the same time, Lower Body receives a -1 penalty on Accuracy and Evasion checks. This effect can be used only once per round and cannot be used in consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Rotating Blade/10 (17)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description:
Lower Body of Hibrayzan with its blade attack targets around it.

It attacks with its Melee Attack up to 5 targets around it.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description:
High Goblins were created in the Magic Civilization Period by a Drake wizard-king using a Goblin as a base material. This Youma is often compared to the Humanoid Newmen, who were also created through magical experimentation.

Their skin is morbidly pale and they have huge red eyes. Although they are rather large for Goblins, their body is thin and bare, and they are relatively powerful aside from Goblin Lords and other even larger types. However, their resistance to magic, which they gain from the anti-magic enchantment crests that appear on their body, and their unwavering aggressiveness due to their lack of fear, make them a great threat to their opponents. They have been deployed in many battles as the ultimate soldiers against other wizard-kings.

abilities.title: ‚óØAnti-Magic Enchantment
abilities.description:
When this monster performs a Willpower check against magic and sÏ≥Æds, the result is treated as Negated regardless of the type of magic. If the Willpower check fails, the effect of the magic is applied as if it had sÏ≥Æded and costs 5 MP to the High Goblin.

This effect does not occur if no MP was consumed. This ability does apply to effects other than spells, even if they require a Resistance Check.

abilities.title: ‚óØPsychic Resistance
abilities.description:
High Goblin is immune to Psychic (Weak) effects.

High Goblin also gains a +4 bonus when it makes a Willpower roll against any Psychic-type spell or unique skill.

allmonsters.description:
This is a higher species of High Goblin and is considered something akin to a knight in Goblin society. They are fearsome mad warriors who wear heavy armor and use massive weapons far beyond their height to ravage their enemies.

They were created to take pleasure in blind obedience to the High Goblin Maiden, and they are fanatically loyal to her, even to the point of cutting off their own heads with a smile if they are told to die on the spot.

Therefore, the combination of High Goblin Fanatic and High Goblin Maiden is a vicious fighting force, as Fanatics can be strongly enhanced by the High Goblin Maiden.

They believe in fighting as a shield of the High Goblin Maiden with their life. If they should lose the High Goblin Maiden they are supposed to protect, they will start a desperate fight to the end involving everything and everyone around him.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover I
abilities.description: High Goblin Fanatic can use the [Cover I] combat feat (see p. 33).

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike II
abilities.description: A High Goblin Fanatic can deal an additional +12 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by the High Goblin Fanatic this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave II
abilities.description:
High Goblin Fanatic can attack with a weapon up to 5 target characters within the skirmish in which it resides.

If declared at the same time as a [Power Strike II], only one of the hit characters will be dealt additional damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØMaiden Fanaticism
abilities.description:
It is blindly fanatical to the High Goblin Maiden (see p. 116). The bonus to Accuracy checks received by its [‚ñ∫Frenzy Aroma] is increased to +2.

If a High Goblin Maiden is killed within a radius of 30 meters, it becomes enraged and gains a +2 bonus on Accuracy checks and +8 to damage for 10 seconds (1 round). If more than one High Goblin Maiden is killed within 10 seconds, this effect is cumulative.

This effect is of the Psychic type.

abilities.title: ‚óØAdvanced Anti-Magic Enchantment
abilities.description:
When this monster performs a Willpower check against magic, if Willpower sÏ≥Æds, the result is treated as Negated regardless of the type of magic. Furthermore, even if the Willpower check fails, the effect of the magic is still Negated and costs 10 MP to the High Goblin. This effect does not occur if no MP was consumed.

This ability does apply to effects other than spells, even if they require a Resistance Check.

abilities.title: ‚óØPsychic Resistance
abilities.description:
High Goblin is immune to Psychic (Weak) effects.

High Goblin also gains a +4 bonus when it makes a Willpower roll against any Psychic-type spell or unique skill.

allmonsters.description:
Created as the leader of High Goblins, she is almost always followed by another species of High Goblin, especially High Goblin Fanatics.

Although she is stunningly beautiful, she is otherwise no different from other High Goblins with her pale skin, huge red eyes, and the Anti- Magic Enchantment that covers her entire body. Although she is not a powerful fighter, she can make High Goblins go crazy with her body and can emit an aroma that heals wounds. This strengthens the High Goblins around her and protects her, thus ensuring her own safety. They also have the ability to regenerate her own strength by being bathed in the blood of those who have been offered to her.

They are arrogant, selfish, brutal, and cunning. However, it is said that she instinctively feels strong affection for the stronger Drakes and is willing to obey their commands. For this purpose, she will expend the lives of any number of High Goblins under her command.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Frenzy Aroma
abilities.description:
It releases a frenzied scent from its entire body that disperses over a wide area, making High Goblins go into a frenzy. This ability costs 5 HP for this monster.

For 10 seconds (1 round), within "Range: Caster" "Target: All Areas (20m Radius)/All" all High Goblins (of any type) receive a +1 bonus on Accuracy checks and +4 to damage. At the same time, it gives a -4 penalty to Evasion checks.

This effect is of the psychic type and is not cumulative.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Healing Aroma
abilities.description: The entire body releases a scent that activates High Goblin's resilience and disperses it over a wide area. When using this ability, the High Goblin Maiden consumes its own HP in any range from 1 to 25 points (chosen by this monster). At the same time, all High Goblins (all species except High Goblin Maiden) within "Range: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (20m Radius) / All" will regain the same number of points of HP.

abilities.title: ‚è©Blood Offering/Can't
abilities.description:
High Goblin Maiden instantly kills within "Range: Touch" one High Goblin (except another High Goblin Maiden). At the same time, it's own HP is restored to the same number of points as the High Goblin's HP had immediately before dying from this effect.

This effect can only be used once per round and before the Maiden takes a Major Action.

abilities.title: ‚óØAdvanced Anti-Magic Enchantment
abilities.description:
When this monster performs a Willpower check against magic, if Willpower sÏ≥Æds, the result is treated as Negated regardless of the type of magic. Furthermore, even if the Willpower check fails, the effect of the magic is still Negated and costs 10 MP to the High Goblin. This effect does not occur if no MP is consumed.

This ability does apply to effects other than spells, even if they require a Resistance Check.

abilities.title: ‚óØPsychic Resistance
abilities.description:
High Goblin Maidens are immune to Psychic (Weak) effects.

They also gains a +4 bonus when they makes a Willpower roll against any Psychic-type spell or unique skill.

allmonsters.description:
These are High Goblins trained specifically for surprise attacks.

They are feared for appearing seemingly from nowhere to wreak havoc on the battlefield.

abilities.title: ‚óØFast Action
abilities.description: If High Goblin Raider wins the initiative during the first round of combat, it may take two Major Actions that round.

abilities.title: ‚óØShadow Sneak
abilities.description: Can leave or pass through skirmishes without movement blocking or requiring the Prepare to Withdraw action.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 9 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +8 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØAnti-Magic Enchantment
abilities.description:
When this monster performs a Willpower check against magic and sÏ≥Æds, the result is treated as Negated regardless of the type of magic. Furthermore, even if the Willpower check fails, the effect of the magic is applied as if it had sÏ≥Æded and cost 5 MP to the High Goblin.

This effect does not occur if no MP is consumed. This ability does apply to effects other than spells, even if they require a Resistance Check.

abilities.title: ‚óØPsychic Resistance
abilities.description:
High Goblin is immune to Psychic (Weak) effects.

High Goblin also gains a +4 bonus when it makes a Willpower roll against any Psychic type spell or unique skill.

allmonsters.description:
They are creatures resurrected by powerful hatred or obsessions from the dead.

The significant difference from the regular Revenant is that it retains almost all of its original knowledge and memories. It is often distorted by delusions, but you can converse with High Revenants and negotiate with them. However, they are rarely interested in anything other than relief from their own grudges.

High Revenants can be created from Humanoids, Barbarous, Animals, or Mythical Beasts of Adventurer Level or Monster Level 7 or higher.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 8 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, the High Revenant recovers 8 HP. This has no effect if High Revenant has 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØPast Life
abilities.description:
This monster's strength depends on its strength before it is reborn as a High Revenant.

In the various numerical fields, apply the numerical value of the monster before it was reborn to the places marked with "‚Äª" The level of this monster is equal to "Previous Level + 1".

High Revenant also inherits combat feats and unique skills and spells.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description: A subspecies of Hugl that dwells in tall, snow-capped mountains and colder regions. Perhaps as part of adapting to the environment, it has grown larger than other Hugls, and its scales have become as white as powdered snow.

abilities.title: ‚óØWintry Adaptation
abilities.description: Receives no penalties for poor footing due to snow, ice, etc.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying
abilities.description:
It gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion checks for melee attacks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns. When used in Combat Preparation, it cannot be used in the first round, regardless of the result of the Initiative check.

abilities.title: ‚óØWinged Pursuit
abilities.description:
If it hits with a Claw attack, it can make an additional melee attack with wings. Accuracy bonus, damage, and other values are the same as for the claw attack.

This ability cannot be used on the same turn in which [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying]

is used. Also, once an additional attack is made with this ability, [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] cannot be used on that turn.

loottable.loot: Rainbow Hued Scales (220G / Gold Red A) x 1d

allmonsters.description: Standing around 5m tall, the Hill Giant is the smallest of the Giants. Not too bright either, a Hill Giant will chase down prey and attempt to eat just about anything once. While other barbarous do use the services of Hill Giants because of their immense power and strength, it's also fairly easy to exploit the poor giants, and more than a few end up as butts of jokes.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫War Cry/12 (19)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description: The Hill Giant unleashes a mighty yell, causing fear in those who fail to resist within a 10-meter radius around Hill Giant. This fear, treated as a psychic effect, gives a -2 penalty to all Skill Checks for the next 30 seconds (3 rounds).

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Hill Giant's height prevents enemies from attacking it. The Upper Body receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description: This is a Hoodling Youma who is used to handling animals and fights by riding on them. The riding animal is carried around for food and may be a variety of small to medium size animals, not limited to pigs.

abilities.title: ‚óØDismounting
abilities.description:
This monster's Rider section is mounted on the Pig section. If the Rider is dismounted, all sections suffer a -2 penalty on all Skill Checks and have their damage reduced by -2 points.

See the Rider class and the Riding Rules (see CR III, p. 87) for rules for this monster on how to dismount and mount back at the mount.

allmonsters.description:
Holgrad is a Daemon whose entire body is composed of black mist (see ML p. 5). It looks like a silhouette of a woman wearing a shimmering cloak or a deformed figure with numerous tentacles fluttering in the air.

It is familiar with many systems of magic and has a strong attachment to them. It is furious when magic is used in front of it and takes the initiative in eliminating and weakening enemy magicians.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic, Summoning Arts 12 Level /Magic Power 15 (22)
‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Hawk Eye], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Mana-binding Fog/15 (22)/Willpower/Temporary
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/ Target" this fog will cause black mana to cling to the "Target: 1 Character" and inhibit the casting spell.

The target has all Magic Power reduced by -5 for 3 minutes (18 rounds).

This effect cannot be used in consecutive turns and costs 10 MP.

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +15 damage
abilities.description: May deal an additional +15 damage to their next melee attack. At risk, they take a -2 penalty to their Fortitude and Willpower checks.

allmonsters.description:
This is an artificial Human that is believed to have been created during the Ancient Magic Civilization period. Although they are completely Human- like in appearance, they are always expressionless and do not change their facial expressions.

Homunculi were a major source of inspiration for the creation of Runefolk.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic 3 Level / Magic Power 6 (13)
‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Hawk Eye], [Metamagic/Targets] and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: They are Hoodling Youma who quickly appear on the outer edges of towns inhabited by Humanoids and carry out destruction and looting. They carry 10-meter-long hooked ropes in their hands, which they use to hook ceilings and other objects, and move about by swinging down like a pendulum.

abilities.title: ‚óØHook Rope
abilities.description: Attacks with Grappling Hook are treated as melee attacks that reach up to Range: 1 (10m).

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Hanging by a Rope
abilities.description:
The piece of rope is used to hang from an overhead structure or other object. The Hook Hoodling does not receive the usual poor-footing penalty until the beginning of their next round. Additionally, they receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks, and damage is reduced by -2.

Note that this ability can only be used in environments with ceilings or tall structures overhead, such as in a city.

allmonsters.description:
This Youma has a lizard-like face, brown scales, and a long tail. It has large, strong, leathery wings on its back and can fly.

Although smaller in stature than Humans, they are strong enough to grab a Human child or goat and fly away.

The Hugl can attack simultaneously with sharp claws on both arms and wings on their back. However, it is not good at flying and fighting simultaneously.

Hugls live in family units on rocky mountains, but are often seen accompanying other Barbarous as bouncers.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying
abilities.description:
The Hugl gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion checks for melee attacks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns. When used in Combat Preparation, it cannot be used in the first round, regardless of the result of the Initiative check.

abilities.title: ‚óØWinged Pursuit
abilities.description:
If it hits with a Claw attack, it can make an additional melee attack with wings. Accuracy bonus, damage, and other values are the same as for the claw attack.

This ability cannot be used on the same turn in which [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] is used. Also, once an additional attack is made with this ability, [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] cannot be used on that turn.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Youma warrior of the Hugl clans with sharper fingers and enhanced fighting skills.

Skilled at fighting multiple opponents, they use their claws and wings to strike down one foe after another. They are carefree and are sometimes asked to serve as guards for weaker Barbarous.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying
abilities.description:
It gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion checks for melee attacks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns. When used in Combat Preparation, it cannot be used in the first round, regardless of the result of the Initiative check.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: They can make two Claws attacks each round. After checking the result of the first attack, the monster can choose whether to make a second attack on the same target further or on a different target of their choice.

abilities.title: ‚óØWinged Pursuit
abilities.description:
If it hits with a Claw attack, it can make an additional melee attack with wings. Accuracy bonus, damage, and other values are the same as for the claw attack.

This ability cannot be used on the same turn in which [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] is used. Also, once an additional attack is made with this ability, [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] cannot be used on that turn.

allmonsters.description:
Perhaps once a servant of an evil magician, some Hugls can use magic. Such individuals become leaders of small groups of Youma or preside over evil rituals.

Sometimes they collaborate with Bolgs and others to plan evil acts, such as an attack on a Humanoid settlement.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Spells with "Area: Shot" fired into a skirmish will not cause stray shots.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying
abilities.description:
It gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion checks for melee attacks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns. When used in Combat Preparation, it cannot be used in the first round, regardless of the result of the Initiative check.

allmonsters.description: This is a skilled warrior of the Hugl Youma tribe who knows how to use Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying
abilities.description:
It gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion checks for melee attacks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns. When used in Combat Preparation, it cannot be used in the first round, regardless of the result of the Initiative check.
