abilities.description:
If it is hit with a Claw attack, it can make an additional melee attack with wings.

Accuracy bonus, damage, and other values are the same as for the claw attack. This ability cannot be used on the same turn in which [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] is used. Also, once an additional attack is made with this ability, [‚è©‚ñ≥Mobile Flying] cannot be used on that turn.

abilities.title: ‚è©Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Cat's Eyes], [Bear Muscle], [Daemonfinger], and [Giant Arms] Techniques.

allmonsters.description:
A Hydra is a beast with numerous snake-heads, about 10 meters long. Each head has an independent ego and each prey on instinct. They usually emerge from swamps and lakes and attack animals in the lakeshore with only their heads protruding. The number of heads of a Hydra is often reported to be 7-9, but various accounts suggest that the number may vary, and each individual is thought to have a different number of heads.

When the body is attacked, all heads concentrate on this enemy. Hydras have exceptional regeneration ability. It is said they are able to revive heads repeatedly unless the wound is burned.

allmonsters.description: This is a monster who died in a snowfield or a snowy mountain and became undead. Except for the pale discoloration and coldness of the skin, it looks almost the same as before its death. The blocks of ice cling to various parts of their former equipment, and they sometimes attack with ice blocks by throwing them, freezing anything they touch.

abilities.title: ‚óØSnow and Ice Mastery
abilities.description: On snow and ice, it has no penalties due to poor footing.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Throw Ice Block/9 (16)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: Throws a block of ice at "Target: 1 Character" with "Range: 1 (100m)", dealing 2d+8 water/ice physical damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØFreeze/Can't
abilities.description:
If a fist attack or [‚ñ∫Throw Ice Block] hits, it will freeze the opponent. This is treated as a Petrifaction (Dexterity or Agility/-6) effect.

This effect is Water/Ice type. Also, if the target receiving this effect has HP or MP being reduced by a Fire type effect, this effect will be removed entirely.

If its Dexterity or Agility reaches 0, the target becomes completely petrified (frozen).

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Nosferatu, Regional Dialect, Arcana
allmonsters.description:
A vampire who has received the 'Blood Kiss' but is not yet at full strength (see CR II, p. 353, or ML, p. 97).

They are unable to use the gaze power that is so synonymous with vampires, and the spawns they produce are weak. Even so, they are more powerful than the average Barbarous commander and are an object of fear and awe.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 5 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, an Immature Vampire recovers 5 HP. This does not affect the Immature Vampire at 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØVampire Body
abilities.description: As long as an Immature Vampire is under sunlight, it takes 5 magic damage at the end of its turn and receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. Additionally, the Immature Vampire cannot use their [‚óØRegeneration] or [‚óØNormal Weapon Immunity] abilities.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: An Immature Vampire receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: üó®Magical Aptitude
abilities.description: The Immature Vampire has mastered the combat feats [Metamagic/Targets] and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Vampire Bite / 10 (17) / Evasion / Negates
abilities.description:
The Immature Vampire bites the target, dealing 2d+7 physical damage. The Immature Vampire heals HP equal to the applied dealt.

If the target is reduced to 0 HP or lower from this attack, they receive a -10 penalty to their next Death Check. If the character fails this Death Check, they receive an extra 5 soulscars and rise as a Blood Sucker.

Immature Vampires lose 4 HP and MP per day (cumulative) that they do not drain blood via [‚ñ∫Vampire Bite] and also cannot use their [‚óØRegeneration] unique skill. These penalties immediately disappear once the Immature Vampire successfully drains blood via [‚ñ∫Vampire Bite].

allmonsters.description: Imps are small hairless daemons with brown skin, bat-like wings, and a tail pointed like a spear. Often used as messengers for the Daemons, Imps are typically sent to help others who may do the work of the Daemons. As such, seeing an Imp nearby may mean stronger Daemons are not far off.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: An Imp receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØParalyzing Poison/3 (10)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
If the Imp hits with its Tail attack and inflicts 1 or more applied damage, the target receives a -2 penalty to Evasion checks for 30 seconds (3 rounds).

This effect is not cumulative and is of the poison type.

allmonsters.description: Some Grudge Wights, upon their resurrection, receive the blessing of Zeides the Immortal Queen or other deities closely associated with the Undead. These more powerful individuals are termed "Implicit Grudge Wights." They gain intelligence and the ability to plan and move deliberately, and even wield a limited form of Divine Magic.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison Claw / 12 (19) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: If a Claw attack hits and deals at least 1 point of applied damage, it deals an additional 9 Poison magic damage to both the target's HP and MP.

abilities.title: ‚óØGrudge Wight's Curse
abilities.description:
Anyone reduced to 0 HP or below by the Grudge Wight's attack is automatically cursed, without any Resistance Check.

Only after the curse is lifted can the victim recover from its unconscious state. If left attended, one Soulscar will be accumulated for every three days (72 hours) that pass. If the fifth Soulscar is acquired by this fact, the character immediately becomes a Grudge Wight (see p. 129).

A Success Value of 20 or more is required to remove this curse by magic or other means. The character does not lose any Soulscars accumulated by this effect when the curse is removed.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Grudge Return / 11 (18) / Willpower / Half
abilities.description: At "Target: 1 Character" with "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/Target," the Wight expresses its resentment for being hurt. The target will be dealt (36 - the monster's current HP) (minimum 1) Curse magic damage (just 36, not Power 36).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Limited Divine Magic/Magic Power 12 (17)
abilities.description: Can use the Divine magic spell [Fist of God]. (Note the Zeides is a Major God.)

abilities.title: üó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: The Grudge Wight can use the Combat Feat [Multi-Action].

allmonsters.description:
It is a custom model of Barba with the ability to hold explosive bullets removed and replaced with a laser blade that emits high heat and a drop tank to increase overall output.

Its operating time is short when running at full power, and parts of the machine itself seem to frequently break down.

abilities.title: ‚óØLaser Blade
abilities.description: Attacks with the Laser Blade treat the target's Defense as being reduced by half (rounded up).

abilities.title: ‚è©Tracking Function
abilities.description:
Detects enemies using multiple sensors.

The Insaid Barba gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks for 10 seconds (1 round).

Using this ability consumes 4 HP. This ability can only be used once a round.

abilities.title: ‚è©Increase Output
abilities.description:
Overloads its power output in an effort to defeat enemies, gaining +4 damage for 10 seconds (1 round).

Using this ability consumes 4 HP. This ability can only be used once a round.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

loottable.loot: Crude Magitech Components (100G / Black White A)

allmonsters.description: An assault soldier from among the Sabinga, highly skilled in combat. They confront the enemy directly, delivering swift and varied attacks with their weapons. However, they are not known for their intelligence, nor are they adept at strategy or negotiations.

abilities.title: üó®Somersault Attack
abilities.description:
Flips and flutters back and forth in front of the target, attacking at an irregular trajectory.

Declaring this before a melee attack grants the Sabinga a +1 bonus to its Accuracy Check, but incurs a -1 penalty to its Evasion Check.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave I
abilities.description: It can attack up to 3 characters with melee attacks that can be reached, but the damage will be reduced by -3.

allmonsters.description: This is a massive golem made of iron which stands about 5 meters tall.

abilities.title: ‚óØIron Body
abilities.description:
The Iron Golem is immune to criticals from edged weapons and all non-Energy-type Magic damage.

[[div class="golemitems"]]

abilities.title: ‚ÄªAny Section
abilities.description:
Obsidian Shield (Large) (3,000) (üó®‚ñ≥Cover II)

Corundum Protection (Large) (2,000) (‚óØGuardian II)

Jet Sign (Large) (2,000) (üó®Aimed Attack = +2 Accuracy and -4 damage)

Sunstone Brilliance (Large) (6,000) (‚ñ∫Brand=Next attack cannot be evaded, damage +7)

Amber Eye (Large) (10,000) (‚óØUltimate Aim = +4 Accuracy)

Garnet of Vitality (Large) (4,000) (‚óØHP Enhancement = Max HP +15)

‚îîFocused Garnet of Vitality (Large) (6,000) (‚óØImproved HP Enhancement = Max HP +15)

Shimmering Onyx (Large) (600) (‚óØMana Coating = Magic damage -3)

abilities.title: ‚ÄªAll Section Must be Equipped
abilities.description:

Red Iron Blood (Large) (2,000) (‚óØMobility Enhancement = Movement +5)

allmonsters.description: The Iron Maiden is a torture device in the shape of a woman's body, affected by mana and granted sentience. Its entire body is made of iron and is hollow inside. The hollowed-out body is covered with countless thorns, which lock up people and squeeze out their blood, causing them to suffer and bleed.

abilities.title: ‚óØIron Body
abilities.description: The Iron Maiden is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Lock Up / 15 (22) / Evasion / Negates
abilities.description:
Traps a "Target: 1 Character" at "Range: Touch" inside its own body.

The Iron Maiden cannot attempt to [‚ñ∫Lock Up] a new target while one is trapped inside. The Iron Maiden may release the imprisoned character with a Minor Action. Unless it declares [üó®Hold On], the trapped character automatically escapes on its turn.

abilities.title: üó®Hold On
abilities.description:
Closes its own lid for 10 seconds (1 round). By doing so, the Iron Maiden gains +5 points to its Defense.

If this declaration is made first, [‚ñ∫Lock Up] cannot be used later. It is possible to use [‚ñ∫Lock Up] first and declare this ability immediately after the first use of [üó®Hold On].

When this declaration is made, [üó®Hold On] deals 2d+14 points of physical damage to the trapped character, if any, and heals its HP by the same amount as the applied damage.

With this ability declared, a character trapped inside can escape only by de-bonding (see ML, p. 71) (if no declaration of [üó®Hold On] has been made, the character can escape automatically at the beginning of its turn).

If de-bonding causes the character to escape from the inside, the effect of the Defense increase is also lost.

loottable.loot: Magic Iron Ingot (680G / Gold Black A)

allmonsters.description: This large turtle, ranging anywhere from 1 to 3 m in size, gets its name because its shell is as hard as iron. These turtles are fairly docile, slow to move, and unlikely to cause any harm. However, because their shell is used in a variety of crafts, overfishing has led to a decline in their population and the Iron Turtle is becoming harder to find in the wild.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Shell Guard
abilities.description: The Iron Turtle can retract into its shell, increasing its Defense by +10 for 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover I
abilities.description: The effect is the same as the combat feat [Cover I] (see CR I, p. 255).

allmonsters.description:
The Jabberwock is a mythical beast with a dragon-like head, long neck, four wings, and a long tail, and its total length exceeds 20 meters.

They are extremely vicious and aggressive. They are also relentless in the pursuit of their prey.

Because of these characteristics and its use of the Summoning Arts, some believe that Jabberwock is a type of Daemon, while others believe that it originated as a crossbreed between a Daemon and a Dragon.

Jabberwocks are found primarily in forests and mountains but may also occur in deserts, wildernesses, and archaeological sites. Often, the habitat of the Jabberwock is oddly tranquil, as there are few other animals.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic, and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Shockwave Breath / 20 (27) / Fortitude / Half
abilities.description:
Jabberwock breathes a mighty wave with "Range / Area: 2 (30m) / Shot" in a "Target: 1 Area (6m Radius) / 20", dealing 2d+30 Bludgeoning magic damage to the targets and causing them to fall prone.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description: Jabberwock's tremendous height prevents enemies from attacking it. The Head section receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks. When the Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

abilities.title: üó®All-Out Attack
abilities.description: A Wing can deal an additional 8 damage on its next attack. However, any Evasion check made by this section this turn receives a -3 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description:
A Jabberwock receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If two Wings fall to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description: A Jabberwock can use its Tail to attack up to 5 targets with a Melee Attack. This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

loottable.loot: Shining Red Eyes (5,000G/Gold Red S) x 2

allmonsters.description:
This is a pumpkin-headed monster dressed in a black veil. They wear white gloves and hold a scythe in both hands, which is larger than their height, and attack with the scythe.

They haunt and roam the remote villages at night, looking for victims. When they kill their prey, they are said to light up their mouths and eyes with bright lights.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Hawk Eye], [Metamagic/Distance], [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØSoul Harvesting
abilities.description: If the target is reduced to 0 HP or lower from a Jack O'Lantern's Scythe attack, they receive a -10 penalty to their next Death Check.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

loottable.loot: Soul Harvesting Scythe (3,000G/Gold Black White S)

allmonsters.description:
Jahgrad is a strange-looking Daemon with a shark-like upper body and a human-like lower body with two legs.

Although they are over 5 meters tall, they rarely seen in full size, as they are mainly live in the water. In the water, they move with amazing speed as they hunt down their prey.

Despite their strange appearance, they are cunning and brutal, never letting their prey escape. Its back and chest fins are flexible and become sharp blades that slice through the enemy.

They may lurk in the vicinity of underwater ruins and will attack approaching creatures. They can also walk on land if necessary but rarely leave the water.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magical Aptitude
abilities.description: Jahgrad can use the combat feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Universal Metamagic] and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: üó®All-out Attack
abilities.description: A Bite attack can deal an additional 8 damage on its next attack. However, any Evasion check made by this section this turn receives a -3 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚óØCatch and Hold
abilities.description:
If a Bite attack hits, the target is caught and held in the Jahgrad's jaws. The target cannot move, and will be automatically hit by further Bite attacks from the next round onwards.

When the target attempts to escape, it follows the de-bonding rules (see ML, p. 71). The Jahgrad can automatically release the target it holds in its mouth with a Minor Action.

While Catch and Hold is in use, the Body Section cannot attack other characters or use magic. Likewise, the Fin sections cannot attack the character being held by Catch and Hold in the Jahgrad's mouth.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack II
abilities.description: If the Dorsal Fin successfully hits a target in Melee, it may make a second attack against the same target. If the second attack also hits, it may then make a third attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Pull / 16 (23) / Evasion / Negates
abilities.description: Extends its fins and wraps them around "Target: 1 Character" with "Range/Area: 2 (20m) / Shot". This deals 2d+12 physical damage to the target and moves it into the same area or coordinates as the Jahgrad.

allmonsters.description: It is a Lesser Daemon that resembles a 1m long snake with feathered wings. Primarily used as an aerial vanguard, it spits fire from its mouth and possesses powerful fangs. They often appear in groups and prefer cunning tactics, such as striking from above in mountainous areas.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: Receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fireball/5 (12)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 2 (20m) / Shot" and "Target: 1 Character," a fireball is spits out at the target, dealing 2d+3 Fire magic damage.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description:
The Jii is a creature with the body of a cow and a human face. It has well- developed hind legs that allow it to walk on two legs. According to tradition, the Jii appears before major disasters and utters prophecies. In some nations, the mere appearance of the Jii is considered a sign of an impending disaster.

Although typically kind and hospitable, the Jii can become aggressive towards those with malicious intentions. The origin of the Jii is unknown, but sightings have been reported in deep forests and on high mountain peaks.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Divine Magic, Fairy Magic 7 Level / Magic Power 11 (18)
abilities.description:
Can use Earth, Wind, Dark, and Light types.

If a contract pattern is adopted (see MA, p. 136), it knows all types (5 ranks, special 2 ranks).

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Accuracy], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: üó®Foresight
abilities.description:
This ability can be declared only before the Major Action.

For 10 seconds (1 round) Jii gains a +2 bonus to Evasion checks. At the same time, it receives a -2 penalty to its Accuracy check.

allmonsters.description: Jinn are fairy giants that look like regal old men, around 5 meters tall. They move on the wind in wide hills and deserts, and usually swim leisurely in the sky. However, when danger arises, they manipulate the wind and rush to the scene.

abilities.title: ‚óØType: Wind/Magic Power 23 (30)
abilities.description: Only the Upper Body section can cast spells.

abilities.title: ‚óØWind Body
abilities.description: Slashing weapons treat the Jinn's Defense as 5 points higher.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Jinn receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØEarth Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Jinn is hit by Earth-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Jinn can make two attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: üó®Wind Mana Strike = +23 damage
abilities.description: A Jinn can deal an additional 23 damage on their next attack and turn the attacks into Wind-type damage. At risk, it takes a -2 penalty to its Fortitude and Willpower checks.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If a Jinn successfully hits a target in melee, they may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚è©Windblade Storm/23 (30)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Jinn causes their entire body to twist and recoil, creating a storm of wind blades. Within "Range: Caster" causes "Target: All areas (Radius 30m)/All" to be hit by 2d+24 wind magic damage and fall prone.

This unique skill can only be used once per round.

abilities.title: ‚óØWind Spirit Barrier
abilities.description: The Lower Body section is always under the effect of the Fairy Magic spell [Missile Protection] (see CR II, p. 174).

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
A Jinn's great size hinders attack.

The Upper Body cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower

allmonsters.description:
This Daemon resembles a black horse that is about 5 meters in length. It has red eyes and a 1-meter-long black horn on its forehead.

It is brutal and ruthless and prefers to lure and trick lone Humanoids with its words.

abilities.title: ‚è©Red Eye Menace/9 (16)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Stares at "Target: 1 Character" within "Range/Area: 1 (10m) / Target", filling them with fear. A target who fails the resistance check suffers a -2 penalty on Accuracy and Evasion checks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This effect can be used only once per round. It also consumes 5 MP when used.

abilities.title: ‚óØVital Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll determining damage is 9 or more, the damage is increased by +6 points.

allmonsters.description: This construct is a pile of junk that has gained consciousness. Its body is composed entirely of debris, garbage, pieces of wood, and stone, and it changes shape as it moves. In rare cases, special objects or rare ores may be mixed in with its body. When it moves violently, it self-destructs and scatters junk around itself.

abilities.title: ‚óØJunk Self-destruction/Can't
abilities.description:
Its body self-destructs.

Immediately after both the Right and Left sections' body have finished their turns, one of the randomly selected sections receives 1d+2 fixed damage to its HP, and all other characters in the same area (area, coordinates) except the character itself receive double that amount of physical damage.

This ability is lost when the HP of any section falls to 0 or less.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is a transportation Magitech used to carry Magitechs during the Magitech Civilization Period in the Alfleim region. It is about 1m high and 3m long with wheels.

The pedestal has fasteners and fixations for mooring another Magitech, making it suitable for long-distance transportation. It was capable of moving by itself and being towed by a train to carry the Magitech in succession.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted Magitech = 2 Characters
abilities.description: Up to 2 Magitech characters (2 sections) can be mounted.

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted Person Protection = +2 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description: A character mounted on this monster has a +2 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: Kamawets are sea-based mythical beasts, similar in appearance to a dragon without wings. Only a few meters long, they are mild-mannered and rather friendly, and are able to coexist with Humanoids quite easily. Subsisting on a mostly fish diet, they rarely travel outside of the water. Sometimes, it even can carry humanoids on its back.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater Specialization
abilities.description: Can move in water without penalties and restrictions. Conversely, all action checks are subject to a -2 penalty on the ground.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Daemon that can use Fairy Magic. It is approximately one meter long and looks like a thin old man, but its face resembles that of a bird of prey.

It can create a space that mysteriously reverberates magic and delights in disrupting it. It casts Fairy Magic, which is believed to be different in principle from the Fairy Magic used by Humanoid and others.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 3 Level / Magic Power 5 (12)
abilities.description: It can use Earth and Fire types.

abilities.title: ‚óØMagic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feat [Targeting].

abilities.title: ‚è©Spell Echo/Can't
abilities.description:
Within "Range: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (Radius 30m)/Space," Kekkubak creates a mysterious space in which it repeats spells.

For 10 seconds (1 round), when any characters in the affected area cast a spell with "Target: 1 Character", another character is selected at random at the same time.

A random character is selected from the characters existing within the effect's area, excluding the original target and ignoring the spell's original range and shielding. If the spell is expanded by [Metamagic/Targets], this effect repeats for each target.

Using this unique skill costs 5 points of MP.

allmonsters.description: A huge coniferous tree that can reach up to 10 meters in length. They posses the ability to walk on their roots and can appear in places beyond just forests. They indiscriminately attack enemies that come within its branches, and they further defend themselves by scattering pollen to create Poison Pollens.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Action
abilities.description: The Killer Cedar attacks twice with countless roots. After the results of the first attack are determined, the target for the second attack can be decided.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Poison Pollen Production
abilities.description:
The Killer Cedar shakes its branches and spawns a Poison Pollen. Once created, the Poison Pollen can immediately take its turn.

This ability cannot be used by the same Branch section in consecutive turns, nor can it be used by more than one Branch section on the same turn.

When this ability is used, the Branch section that uses it loses 10 HP.

allmonsters.description: This is an olden fairy looking like a small fat boy of about 1 meter in height. They live in tunnels and caves and are always busy mining.

abilities.description: **‚óØOlden / Type: Earth & Light / Magic Power 3 (10)*

allmonsters.description:
Kobolds are the weakest Youma among the Barbarous. They are about 1.2m tall and resemble upright dogs. Other Barbarous treat them like slaves or emergency rations, and some of them flee to the Humanoid cities to escape persecution.

They are obedient to everyone and loyal to those who feed them. Because of their dexterity and culinary skills, they can often be seen working in the dining hall attached to the Adventurers' Guild.

abilities.description: None.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Kobold Youma who has the Artificer class and can attack at long range with their dexterity.

On the other hand, they are extremely bad at hand-to-hand combat, so once they get caught up in a melee, they can be easily defeated by even a newbie adventurer. As a Barbarous gunslinger, they are often slaves of Androscorpions.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Gunfire / 3 (10) / Evasion / Negates
abilities.description: The max magazine is 2 with Range: 2 (20m).

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

allmonsters.description:
This is a mythical beast in the form of a huge hairy buffalo that emits blue phosphorescent light. It has two humps on its back, which crystallize over time and are known to yield high-quality garnets and rubies.

Legend has it that they are the embodiment of the will of the mountain itself and that they have the power to control the climate of the mountain where they live, albeit to a limited extent.

In many mountains, they are revered as mountain saints, and Kujata himself behaves as such. Although strict in nature, Kujata is basically mild- mannered.

Because of the constant approach of back gem hunters, Kujata's reaction to Humanoids, Barbarous, and some Mythical Beasts tends to be one of wariness and caution.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 12 Level/Magic Power 15 (22)
abilities.description: Can use Earth, Water/Ice, Wind, and Light types.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], [Rune Master], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Limited Weather Control
abilities.description: Kujata can change the weather and temperature in a 10 km radius centered on itself. The weather can be selected from clear skies to heavy rain/heavy snow with 100 mm of rainfall per hour, cloud cover, and rainfall (snowfall). Fog and haze can also be added. This effect works only in mountainous areas and is also limited to the weather-temperatures that can occur in that location and season.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
Kujata's great size hinders attack.

The Head cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

If the HP of either the Front or Back falls to 0 or lower, this unique skill changes to [‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None (only +4 bonus to Head's Evasion against melee attack)]. If both HPs fall to 0 or lower, the unique skill is completely lost.

allmonsters.description: Lada Adroda is a high-ranking daemon in the same family as the Ragnakang. However, the Lada Adroda is much larger and has two heads instead of one. These daemons are commonly seen as commanders of daemon attacks and incursions, and hundreds of lesser daemons wait at their disposal.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Lada Adroda can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Metamagic/Targets], [Hawk Eye], [Multi- Action], [Rune Master], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: A Lada Adroda can use the [Gazelle Feet], [Cat's Eyes], [Recovery (10 pts.)], [Scale Leggings], [Strong Blood], [Beetleskin], [Bear Muscle]], [Centaur Legs], [Giant Arms] and [Daemonfinger] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚óØDeadly Poison/22 (29)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If a Bite attack hits and deals 1 or more points of applied damage, the target receives extra 2d+12 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Lady Adroda can make two Claws attacks each round. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Against melee attacks, the Head section receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when the Body section falls to 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description:
All sections receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If one of the Wings falls to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
The monster can use its tail to attack up to 5 targets in the same skirmish. An Accuracy check is made on all characters at once, and damage is determined individually.

This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

allmonsters.description:
This is the largest type in the Kagner series. It is equipped with a powerful air-blowing mechanism and is capable of floating and moving by blowing wind.

It is also equipped with a small cannon for self-defense. Connecting an air-blowing mechanism here can launch wind cannonballs to eliminate enemies. Since this mechanism cannot work for weapons and floating systems simultaneously, the weapon is operatable only when moved by wheels.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted Magitech = 2 Characters
abilities.description: Up to 2 magitech characters (2 sections) can be mounted.

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted Person Protection = +2 ‚Ä¢ +2
abilities.description: A character mounted on this monster has a +2 bonus to Evasion checks against melee and ranged attacks.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Gale Artillery/9 (16)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot", spews a gale of wind, dealing 2d+8 wind magic damage to "Target: 1 Character" and knocks prone.

This ability can be used only when this character's movement method is "Wheeled" (grounded).

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: This former Humanoid's head is the only undead part of its body, drifting in midair. The entire head is enveloped in a blue luminescence, attacking all living things without regard. At times, it can use the Divine Magic of Immortal Queen Zeides.

abilities.title: ‚è©Fear Curse/8 (15)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
Within "Range/Area: 1 (10m) / Target," Lanternhead whispers a word of fear curse into the "Target: 1 Character's" ear and inflicts 1d magical damage to the target MP.

Using this ability consumes 3 points of MP. Also, once the target sÏ≥Æds in Willpower, it cannot be used on this turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØNimble
abilities.description: Lanternhead gains a +2 bonus to the Evasion check against ranged attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
They are approximately 2 meters tall and resemble a wall of swirling flames. Their fire is intensely hot and possesses the ability to harden metal. Although they are unable to speak in sylvan, they comprehend the languages of others and actively assist the summoner and their companions in combat.

These fairies serve as barriers in ruins and volcanoes, preventing animals and other creatures from accessing hazardous areas.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlame-walled Body
abilities.description: It does not receive critical hits from non-Water/Ice-type weapons, magic, etc.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlame Wall In the Way
abilities.description: Knows [Block] Combat Feat.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚è©Instant Forged Iron / Metal Armor
abilities.description:
For 10 seconds (1 round) within "Range: Touch" gives +2 points to Defense of "Target: 1 Character". Using this effect consumes 3 MP.

This ability can be used only up to 3 times per round, and only affects targets equipped with the metal armor.

abilities.title: ‚è©Instant Forged Iron / Shield
abilities.description:
For 10 seconds (1 round) within "Range: Touch" gives +1 points to Defense of "Target: 1 Character". Using this effect consumes 3 MP.

This ability can be used only up to 3 times per round, and only affects targets equipped with the shield. If the target changes shield during the duration of this ability, this effect is lost immediately

allmonsters.description: This fish-shaped golem is made from animal skin. It does not have scales and has a slimy texture.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater
abilities.description:
Leather Fish doesn't receive penalties for moving or taking action in the water. However, it can't perform any Action without water.

[[div class="golemitems"]]

abilities.title: Maximum of Enhancing Items = 3
abilities.description:
Lapis Lazuli Weight (Small) (200) (üó®Tail Swing I)

‚îîQuartz Counterweight (Small) (300) (üó®Tail Swing II)

Blue Lotus Jade (Small) (600)

‚ñ∫Water Gun/5 (12)/Fortitude/Half

Golem sprays a jet of water with "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot" onto "Target: 1 Character", dealing 2d+4 water/ice magic damage and causing it to fall prone. Stray shots cannot occur with this ability.

Amber Eye (Small) (500) (‚óØUltimate Aim = +4 Accuracy)

Garnet of Vitality (Small) (200) (‚óØHP Enhancement = Max HP +5)

Anisotropic Anorthite (Small) (150) (Ground movement 10 (crawling), [‚óØUnderwater Specialization]) [[/div]]

allmonsters.description: They are adorable mouse-like creatures, about 50cm long. They are rarely seen alone but are sometimes seen crossing grasslands in groups of several hundred.

abilities.title: ‚óØSwarm
abilities.description: Lemming gains a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks and +1 to HP for each other Lemming in the same skirmish area. The maximum bonus modifier and increase in HP due to this effect are +5.

allmonsters.description:
A young dragon, less than 500 years of age, yet older than a Draconet. Even though it is relatively young for a Dragon, Lesser Dragons tend to be around 10m long, so any sort of melee attack on the head is nigh impossible.

Able to spit flames and cast spells while flying over the skirmish, a Lesser Dragon's offensive power is second to none. Because of this, Lesser Dragons tend to be very self-centered and overconfident, looking down on others they consider "lesser creatures." Lesser Dragons look to hoard treasure and valuables, just like any other dragon.

Any brave adventurer (or adventuring party) that can kill a Lesser Dragon will not only earn the title "Dragon Slayer" but will have access to the vast hoard that the dragon had acquired. Additionally, very rarely do dragons have Dragon Eggs inside their bodies, which are incredibly valued on their own due to their use in several magical experiments.

For the mount version of this creature, see Lesser Dragon (mount).

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Flame Breath/15 (22)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot", spits fire at "Target: 1 area (6m Radius) / 20", dealing 2d+20 Fire magic damage.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Strong Blood], [Beetleskin], and [Recovery (7 points)] Techniques.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
The monster can use its tail to attack up to 5 targets in the same skirmish. An Accuracy check is made on all characters at once, and damage is determined individually.

This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
The Lesser Dragon's size hinders attack.

The Head cannot be attacked in melee. When the Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

abilities.title: üó®All-Out Attack
abilities.description: A Wing can deal an additional 8 damage on its next attack. However, any Evasion check made by this section this turn receives a -3 penalty as a risk.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Lesser Dragon receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks. If any Wings fall to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Mythical Beast with the body of a lion, bat wings on its back, a scorpion tail, and an old man's face. The Lesser species is approximately 3 meters long.

Highly intelligent, Lesser Manticores possess extensive knowledge of magic and history. They have a deep understanding of the world, sword mythology, and various civilizations. However, they are vile creatures, both mentally and physically twisted, and do not share their knowledge honestly.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic 5 Level  / Magic Power 8 (15)
abilities.description: If you have introduced Deep Magic, it can also cast Deep Magic at the same level and Magic Power.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 3 Level / Magic Power 6 (13)
abilities.description:
Can use Earth, Water/Ice, Fire, and Dark types.

This does not change even if the contract pattern is adopted (see MA, p. 136).

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Cat's Eyes] and [Beetleskin] Techniques.

abilities.title: ‚óØNumbing Poison / 8 (15) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
If the Tail's attack hits and deals 1 or more points of applied damage, it will paralyze the target and reduce its Dexterity by -6 points (to a minimum of 0). This effect is cumulative, and when the Dexterity reaches 0, the target will be unable to make any melee or ranged attacks.

If the character has a fixed value, its Accuracy check is reduced by -1 for each effect of this poison, and the character cannot be attacked after three such effects.

This effect is Poison type and lasts for 1 hour.

loottable.loot: Beautiful Mythical Beast Hide (800G/Gold Red A)

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Ogre, Drakish, Arcana
allmonsters.description:
Standing about 2 meters tall, a Lesser Ogre is a fearsome flesh-eating behemoth of pure muscle. Lesser Ogres are still small among Ogres (see ML p. 58). A Lesser Ogre's most distinctive feature is its ability to take on Human form.

Those who actively take on Human form often have a deep knowledge of Human culture, which may be why some have a Human-like personality and mindset. A Lesser Ogre can automatically take one unique Humanoid form which is considered "theirs," but if it eats the heart of a Humanoid, it can also take that individual's form. The more hearts they eat, the more forms they can take.

It is difficult to detect a Lesser Ogre disguised as a Humanoid. The PCs must have sufficient reason to be suspicious (as judged by the GM) to perform a Detect check (see CR I, p. 111).

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Personification
abilities.description:
A Lesser Ogre may take on the appearance and mannerisms of a character they have eaten or can change back. It can be either innate or something that once had its heart eaten out of it.

When transformed, the Lesser Ogre's maximum HP and MP are decreased by 5. Accuracy, Evasion, Fortitude, and Willpower are also reduced by 1 point each. This form can be held up to 18 hours per day.

The [‚è©‚ñ≥Personification] can also be canceled by Minor Action and Combat Preparation.

allmonsters.language: Trade Common, Barbaric, Nosferatu, Regional Dialect, Arcana
allmonsters.description:
Immortalized by a Blood Kiss from an older Nosferatu, Lesser Vampires are incredibly powerful, even among the Barbarous. Often, they are followers of Zeides who were once Humans that have fallen into the good graces of other vampires and left their humanity behind. Despite this, they are often stunning, and even their gaze can paralyze and fascinate lesser creatures.

Lesser Vampires must still drink blood daily to keep themselves at peak performance. The actual source of the blood can be any living being, but often, they will prey upon beautiful members of the opposite gender. Occasionally, they will even starve themselves to fit into society and get closer to their desired target, making the drinking all sweeter. Care has to be taken, however, as it is effortless to drain a target entirely and raise them as a subordinate Blood Sucker, and often a Lesser Vampire has a small retinue of followers.

Despite their powers, sunlight is the bane of the Lesser Vampire, reducing them to ash in a small amount of time. After only a few minutes outside during the day, all that will be left of the Lesser Vampire is a pile of ashes and possibly some clothing. Because of this, Lesser Vampires will be reluctant to move out of their roost during daylight hours.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic 8 Level / Magic Power 11 (18)
‚è©Gaze/13 (20)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
A Lesser Vampire may attempt to paralyze with "Range/Area: 50m/Target". If the target fails to resist the Gaze, they are paralyzed for 10 seconds (1 round), cannot take any Minor Actions, and may not use active combat feats. If the target's resistance roll is 16 or less, the target is instead charmed by the Lesser Vampire and will move to aid and defend it for the next minute (6 rounds). This effect is treated as a Psychic type.

This ability can be used only once per round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Vampire Bite/13 (20)/Evasion/Neg
abilities.description:
The Lesser Vampire bites the target, dealing 2d+10 physical damage. The Lesser Vampire heals HP equal to the applied dealt.

If the target is reduced to 0 HP or lower from this attack, they receive a -10 penalty to their next Death Check. If the character fails this Death Check, they receive an extra 5 soulscars and rise as a Blood Sucker.

Lesser Vampires lose 6 HP and MP per day (cumulative) that they do not drain blood via [‚ñ∫Vampire Bite] and also cannot use their [‚óØRegeneration] unique skill. These penalties immediately disappear once the Lesser Vampire successfully drains blood via [‚ñ∫Vampire Bite].

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 7 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Lesser Vampire recovers 7 HP. This does not affect the Lesser Vampire at 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØVampire Body
abilities.description: As long as a Lesser Vampire is under sunlight, it takes 7 magic damage at the end of its turn and receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. Additionally, the Lesser Vampire cannot use their [‚óØRegeneration] or [‚óØNormal Weapon Immunity] abilities.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Lesser Vampire receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

allmonsters.description: Lethe is a woman with long, wet, and supple hair. She is said to always have a sad expression on her face and to take away the memories of those she likes in order to make them her attendants.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic], [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Oblivion/16 (23)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Lethe stares at "Target: 1 Entire Character" within "Range: 1 (10m)", and it changes memory.

For 3 minutes (18 rounds), the target forgets the actions that they are casually performing. The target must roll 1d to perform Minor Action during the effect duration. If the roll is "1-3", the target cannot perform the action because they cannot remember the procedure, which should be easy. A Minor Action that fails in this effect may not be tried again during its turn. Casting spells with Minor Actions and the use of Techniques are considered different Minor Actions if they have different names. If an Evocation fails once, another Evocation cannot be used in the same turn.

This effect is Curse + Psychic type.

Using this unique skill consumes 10 MP.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Disruption of Consciousness/16 (23)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
This unique skill can only be attempted with the target under the [‚ñ∫Oblivion] effect. When the effect of this ability occurs, [‚ñ∫Oblivion] ends.

The "Range: 1 (10m)" stares at the "Target: 1 Entire Character" and disrupts concentration.

During the duration of the effect, the target may be momentarily unconscious. The target must roll 1d at the beginning of each turn. If the roll is "1-2", the target cannot move or operate at all during the turn.

This effect is a "Curse + Psychic" type.

Using this unique skill consumes 15 MP.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Amnesia/16 (23)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
This unique skill can only be attempted with the target under [‚ñ∫Disruption of Consciousness] effect. When the effect of this ability occurs, [‚ñ∫Disruption of Consciousness] ends, and this unique skill.

Lethe stares at "Target: 1 Entire Character" with "Range: 1 (10m)" and make it lose its memory.

The target immediately loses all their memories and falls comatose. The comatose state lasts for 1 hour, after which the target awakens spontaneously but does not regain their memories.

The comatose state is a psychic type and can be awakened by the [Awaken] spell. No need to compare the different values.

On the other hand, the memory loss effect is permanent of the "curse +psychic" type. To cancel it, a comparison of difference values is required.

Using this unique skill consumes 20 MP

allmonsters.description:
It is a crossbred born from the mating of a Lion and a Tiger. They have the stripes of a tiger and the mane of a lion ,and are so large that they can weigh twice as much as their parents.

Ligers are rarely fertile and rarely have offspring with lions, tigers, or even with other ligers. It is also unlikely that Lions and Tigers will naturally mate, and they are usually never seen together.

However, there are constant reports of Ligers being seen in the Barbarous territories. Apparently, the Barbarous are conducting various breeding experiments, and the Liger seems to be one of such experiments. It is also considered a sighting report because the work of creating Ligers is still being carried out.

abilities.title: ‚óØFast Action
abilities.description: During the first round of combat, if the Liger won the initiative, it may take two Major Actions that round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Triple Attack
abilities.description: The Liger can bite and attack twice with its claws making 3 attacks per round with Bite and Claws.

loottable.loot: Golden Mane (900 G / Gold Red A)

allmonsters.description:
A Lesser Daemon that looks like an adorable young girl at first glance. They seem cute, but this is merely a disguise to throw off Humanoids, and their true nature is that of a very dangerous Daemon. They specialize in insidious acts of corruption and destruction, deceptively tricking people into committing evil acts or driving a wedge between individuals.

Their hair and costume are both a part of their own flesh and when they engage in combat, the nails of their hand grow long and become terrifying sharp claws. However, their girlish appearance remains in order to assist in catching their opponents off guard.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Double Attack
abilities.description: A Lilim can attack the same target twice in one action with its Claws.

abilities.title: ‚óØMagic Aptitude
abilities.description: Lilim possesses the Combat Feat [Metamagic/Targets].

allmonsters.description: This fierce four-legged feline carnivore is known as the king of all beasts. They hunt in small groups, setting up territories in grasslands and plains. The males have a magnificent mane, which is highly prized.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If a Lion successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚óØCoordination
abilities.description: A Lion gains a bonus to their Accuracy equal to the number of other Lions in the same skirmish area, up to a maximum of +4.

allmonsters.description:
These are giant walking trees that boast of their huge size and monstrous strength. Some trees are around 5 meters tall and more than 1,000 years old.

They are not very intelligent, but they are mild-mannered and honest. They are proud to be the protectors of the forest and can become friends with anyone they meet as long as they are respectful and considerate of the forest.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 2 Level/Magic Power 3 (10)
abilities.description: Can use Earth, Water/Ice, Light, and Dark types.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike II
abilities.description: They can deal an additional +12 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: üó®Improved Aimed Attack
abilities.description: When attacking, the Living Tree can gain a +4 bonus to Accuracy but receives a -8 penalty to damage dealt when doing so.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 10 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, Living Tree recovers 10 HP. This has no effect if the Living Tree has 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description:
Lizard Flies appear to be larger than average lizards, ranging in size from about 50cm to 1m, with two pairs of thin, translucent wings on their back.

Carnivorous, they will stay buried under sand until prey comes near, then spring out and attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Lizard Fly receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

allmonsters.description:
Lizardmen are one of the more aquatically inclined Barbarous, preferring to spend time in swamps and other wetlands worshiping their dragon gods. Standing just shy of 2 meters tall, they look like upright lizards, though they take offense if mistaken for Lildraken.

While they cannot breathe underwater, like Elves, Lizardmen can hold their breath for up to an hour and similarly have houses with dry and wet sections.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
The monster can use its tail to attack up to 5 targets in the same skirmish. An Accuracy check is made on all characters at once, and damage is determined individually.

This attack cannot be used in consecutive rounds.

allmonsters.description: This is one of the Lizardmen caste. Their fighting ability is no different from that of an ordinary Lizardman, but they carry a battle flag attached to their spear. In battle, they stay in the rear or beside their regiment, inspiring and supporting their comrades.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Inspiring Flag Spear/Can't
abilities.description:
Lizardman Bearer raises its flag spear high, inspiring allies.

Lizardmen (regardless of gender) within "Range: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (30m radius) / All" get +1 bonus to Accuracy check and Magic Power of unique skill for 10 seconds (1 round) and regain 5 HP immediately.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description: These are members of an elite group of Lizardmen trained to rush into enemy territory and create openings for other Barbarous from within. In the past, there was concern that these elite Lizardmen could take down cities under united leadership. Today, they are rarely seen.

abilities.title: ‚óØCoordination
abilities.description: A Lizardman Mariner gains a bonus to their Accuracy equal to the number of other Lizardman Mariners in the same skirmish, up to a maximum of +4.

abilities.title: ‚óØRage
abilities.description:
When another Lizardman (regardless of type) in the same skirmish is defeated, the Lizardman Mariner gains a cumulative +2 bonus to damage for 10 seconds (1 round).

The GM decides when a Lizardman is defeated (so it cannot recoverounds).

allmonsters.description: A golem made from clay is the hopes and desires of its creator-given form. Typically standing around 1m, a Loam Puppet is often humanoid, though it can be any shape the creator wishes. The shape does not make any difference in performance.

abilities.title: ‚óØMud Body
abilities.description:
Blunt weapons treat the Loam Puppet's Defense as 5 points higher.

In addition, a Loam Puppet is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

[[div class="golemitems"]]

abilities.title: Maximum of Enhancing Items = 4
abilities.description:
Obsidian Shield (Small) (150) (üó®‚ñ≥Cover I)

Corundum Protection (Small) (100) (‚óØGuardian I)

Cat's Eye Rivet (Small) (200) (‚ñ∫Double Attack)

‚îîGolden Cat's Eye Rivet (Small) (200) (‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack)

Amber Eye (Small) (500) (‚óØUltimate Aim = +4 Accuracy)

Garnet of Vitality (Small) (200) (‚óØHP Enhancement = Max HP +5)

Red Iron Blood (Small) (100) (‚óØMobility Enhancement = Movement +5) [[/div]]

allmonsters.description: This is a martial artist who has been training to master the secrets of kicking techniques. They have won much respect for their kicks by striking vital points with their ever-changing kicks.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Double Attack
abilities.description: It can attack the same target twice in one action with its Kick.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides and adding +1 to it.

allmonsters.description: Humans wielding longbows that are taller than their own body. Boasting considerable range and Strength that can be further enhanced through Techniques, they become a formidable foe that cannot be ignored.

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll, by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

abilities.title: ‚óØBow
abilities.description: Bow attacks are treated as Ranged attacks with Range 2 (50m).

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: Can use the techniques [Gazelle Feet], [Cat's Eyes], [Strong Blood], [Bear Muscle], and [Beetleskin].

abilities.title: ‚óØMako Stone
abilities.description: The Longbowman possesses 5 Mako Stones with 3 MP remaining each, which can be consumed when using skills or transferred to other characters. Mako Stones that are not consumed before the Longbowman's HP falls below 0 are automatically acquired when determining loot.

allmonsters.description: They are a tribe of Barbarous who live in rivers and riverbanks and take the form of beautiful, light-robed women. They charm Humanoid men with their magical singing voices and kidnap them to live in their dwellings. However, it is said that when they are bored or their prey are no longer needed, they will leave their captives to drown.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Special Spellsong [Love Song] /7 (14)/All areas (40m Radius)
abilities.description: Can use the [Love Song] (see CR II, p. 194) spellsong. This unique skill can only be used if a male is in the opposing faction and if [‚ñ∫Basic Spellsongs] were used on the previous turn.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫[Finale: Spring Breeze]/7 (14)
abilities.description:
Uses [Finale: Spring Breeze] at "Range: 2 (40m)" to deal 1 character 2d+4 Wind magic damage.

This unique skill could be used only if [‚ñ∫Basic Spellsongs] or [‚ñ∫Special Spellsong] were used on the previous turn.

allmonsters.description: These are the frontline commander of Bolgs, leading their Youma troops through fear.

abilities.title: ‚ñ≥Frightful Commander/Can't
abilities.description:
Gives the order and forces subordinates to follow it.

All Accuracy and Evasion checks for "Target: All areas (30m Radius)/All" with "Range: Caster" are increased by +1. User can exclude any character from the target when used. The character itself is always excluded. This effect is treated as a psychic type with a success value of 0. This ability can only be used in Combat Preparation and lasts until it is individually removed or until this monster is no longer on the battlefield.

abilities.title: üó®Repeated Strike II
abilities.description: Can make two Accuracy checks; if either one hits, damage is dealt once. If the first Accuracy check is successful, the damage is increased by +4; if the second check instead is successful, the damage is determined as usual.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

allmonsters.description:
A giant reptile which walks on all four legs, covered with glowing scales. The glowing effect is believed to be created by microscopic insects living symbiotically on the body's surface. They receive nutrients from the main body of Lunoicos and protect them from approaching foreign enemies by strongly glowing.

Lunoicos themselves are herbivores and do not actively attack other organisms. However, they have learned to harness the power of their symbionts and tend to confront danger rather than flee from it.

After the death of the Lunoicos, the symbionts reduce their activity to an extremely low level to survive. The scales become pale and luminescent, which lasts for a long time. This makes them highly prized as accessory materials. Each individual has a slight difference in the light's hue, making it collectible to enthusiasts.

abilities.title: ‚óØLight Protection
abilities.description:
It protects itself with a light covering its entire body. A character who makes a melee attack against this monster, regardless of success or failure, suffers 6 Energy fixed damage for each attempt.

This monster illuminates an area of 2 to 3 areas (10m Radius) centered on itself.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Light Ray/16 (23)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
It attacks by firing a huge beam of energy light from its horns.

With "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/Line" dealing 2d+12 energy magic damage.

This effect cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
The Head cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when either Front or Back section falls to 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +12 points.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Swing
abilities.description: The monster can use its Tail to attack up to 5 targets in the same skirmish.

allmonsters.description:
This Daemon wears a giant wooden mask reminiscent of a shield and has a body that looks like layers of strong fibers bound together. The mask is decorated with a pattern of straight lines that affect the creature's spirit if one tries to look at it.

As sparkling fibers make it difficult to see Lunzemase, powerful weapon attacks mercilessly reap the lives of creatures while dazzled.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚óØSparkling Fibers
abilities.description: It isn't easy to see a Lunzenmase from a distance. A character who is more than "Range: 1 (10m)" away from this monster receives a -2 penalty on checks (Accuracy check, Spellcasting check, Performance check, etc.) when making ranged attacks, casting a spell, Finale, and other unique skills that require visibility of this monster.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: Can make two Weapon attacks each round, though each attack requires its Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: üó®Abyss Blade
abilities.description: If the target is hit by a Weapon attack, the target's Defense is halved for that attack (rounded up). At risk, the monster takes a -1 penalty to Evasion checks.

allmonsters.description: This is a more powerful Blood Sucker. It is rumored that only the most powerful Nosferatu can create these monsters.

abilities.title: ‚è©Gaze/11 (18)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Mad Blood may attempt to paralyze with "Target: 1 Character" within "Range/Area: 2 (50m)/ Target". If the target fails to resist the Gaze, they are paralyzed for 10 seconds (1 round) and cannot take any Minor Actions or declare Active Combat Feats.

This unique skill can be used only once per round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Vampire Bite/12 (19)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: The Mad Blood bites the target, dealing 2d+9 Physical damage. The Mad Blood heals HP equal to the applied damage dealt.

abilities.title: ‚óØRegeneration = 6 points
abilities.description: At the end of each round, a Mad Blood recovers 6 HP. This has no effect if the Mad Blood is at 0 HP or lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØVampire Body
abilities.description: As long as a Mad Blood is under sunlight, it takes 6 magic damage at the end of its turn and receives a -2 penalty to all Accuracy and Evasion Checks. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. Additionally, the Mad Blood cannot use their [‚óØRegeneration] unique skill.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
Maeve appears as an old woman with pale skin and a black cloak. She doesn't have a particular preferred habitat and lives alone in impoverished places with rich histories.

She delights in creating feelings of dread and fear in everyone she meets, and is associated with gloom.

Maeve's appearance sometimes leads people to mistake her for an Undead or Daemon, but it will show its sympathy to those who mistake her.

abilities.title: ‚óØType: Dark/Magic Power 24 (31)
abilities.description: Only the Upper Body section can cast spells.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: They receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Wordbreak], and [Rune Master].

abilities.title: ‚è©Veil of Darkness
abilities.description:
Maeve's Robe can absorb damage using mana and absorb mana of others.

When the Upper Body section receives physical or magical damage, applied damage can be split to HP and MP.

If the Upper Body section deals physical damage to another character, it is applied to MP.

This effect lasts for 10 seconds (1 round).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Cocoon of Darkness/Can't
abilities.description:
This skill creates a giant cocoon of darkness and makes it burst. It inflicts magic damage within "Range: Caster" to the "Target: All Areas (Radius 30m)/All", and its damage is equal to the maximum MP value of the target minus the current MP value.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns. Also, when Maeve uses this ability, it costs 30 MP to the Upper Body.

abilities.title: ‚óØRealm of Darkness/23 (30)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description:
The surrounding area around Maeve is covered with darkness.

All characters in the same skirmish area as Maeve need to do a Willpower save at the end of their turn, losing 10 MP if they fail.

This effect is treated as Psychic type.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
Maeve's enormous size hinders attack.

The Upper Body cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower

allmonsters.description:
This Construct was created during the Magic Civilization Period. At first glance, it appears to be a large urn, but inside it lives a 60-centimeter-long, dark-skinned Ogre-like construct with a gaping mouth and eyes. Inside, the construct hides in the jar to skillfully fend off attacks.

The pot has the ability to move by bouncing and rolling.

The Construct was created to serve as a secret guardian among its owner's furnishings, and those that remain in the labyrinths and ruins today will attack intruders in an attempt to fulfill that role.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Pot Shot
abilities.description:
The attack is made by something radiating or being fired from the pot's mouth.

There are the following types of attacks, which are performed at random. The target of an attack, or the targets of an "Area: Line" attack, are selected at random from among the enemies within range.

  1. Fire Storm / 10 (17) / Willpower / Half: Within "Range: Caster" spreads fire over "1 area (6m Radius) / 20". Targets are dealt 2d+10 Fire magic damage.
  2. Discharge / 10 (17) / Willpower / Half: Within "Range / Area: 2 (20m) / Line," fires a lightning bolt, dealing 2d+10 Lightning magic damage to targets.
    3. Acid Spray / 10 (17) / Fortitude / Half: Within "Range / Area: 2 (30m) / Shot," spits acid on "Target: 1 Character", dealing target 2d+12 Poison magic damage.
  3. Iron Ball Shot / 9 (16) / Evasion / Negates: Within "Range / Area: 2 (20m) / Line," shoots an iron ball. Deals 2d+12 physical damage to the target, and the target falls prone.
  4. Long Arm Attack / 11 (18) / Evasion / Negates: Attacks with Claws "Target: 1 Character" within "Range: 1 (10m)". Long Arms jumping out of the jar can ignore any skirmish area.
  5. Claws Attack / 11 (18) / Evasion check / Negates: Within "Range: Touch," attacks "Target: 1 Character" with its Claws (same as regular melee attack).

Which attack will be made is random, but predictable if the PC has successfully completed a Monster Knowledge check. The GM should determine immediately after the attack what the "next attack" will be and tell the players (only the first attack is unpredictable, and they do not know the target of each attack).

abilities.title: ‚óØCeramic Body
abilities.description: A Magic Pot is immune to criticals from edged weapons and all magic damage, with the exception of Energy-type damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØMana Coating
abilities.description: Any magic damage the Magic Pot suffers is reduced by -3.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

loottable.loot: Magical Ceramic Shards (250G/Gold Black White A)

allmonsters.description:
Maginohek is essentially a self-propelled "wall."

It features four legs on the back side of a square wall measuring about 5 meters on each side. When in motion, it walks flat on its back, and it is possible to place materials or soldier gunners on top of it.

Originally, several Maginohek were operated simultaneously, with their role being to construct makeshift field fortifications. To achieve this, several Maginohek would stand on two legs and interweave their remaining two legs with each other in a horizontal line.

The Maginohek is equipped with several inlays, through which another magitech soldier or shooter can attack using guns. However, the Maginohek seen today lacks accompanying soldiers and attacks with spears and other weapons. It has a balance issue, and when it stands on two legs, it is highly prone to falling over on its own.

Although they can be seen at the remains of military bases, they are currently few in number and rarely form huge walls. Even so, their defenses are extremely hard, and getting caught in a fall by accident could easily result in being crushed to death.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited 3 Attacks
abilities.description:
Maginohek can make three Spear attacks with one Major Action.

It can only choose the same target twice in the same round.

abilities.title: ‚óØGiant Wall
abilities.description: Maginohek counts as 5 characters for the purpose of determining blocking movement and the size of the skirmish area.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Morphogenesis
abilities.description:
This monster has two forms, the "Mobile Form" and the "Combat Form", which can be changed to each other with Minor Action or during Combat Preparation. In each turn, the Maginohek can perform [‚è©‚ñ≥Morphogenesis] only once.

Maginohek cannot make Melee Attack cannot be performed in Mobile Form. Also, it gains [‚óØMounted = 3 Characters].

Melee Attack can be performed in Combat Form. Also, Maginohek gets the [‚óØGun-Proof Armor].

abilities.title: ‚óØMounted = 3 Characters
abilities.description:
Up to 3 characters can be mounted.

This ability is only available when the Maginohek is in Mobile Form. If a character is mounted and then [‚è©‚ñ≥Morphogenesis] is used to change into Combat Form, all mounted characters will fall off this monster (see CR III, p. 89).

abilities.title: ‚óØGun-Proof Armor
abilities.description:
Defense is useful when the Maginohek receives magic damage from Ranged Attacks, Area: Shot, or Area: Line spells or effects.

This ability can be obtained only when Maginohek is in Combat Form.

abilities.title: ‚óØOut of Balance/14 (21)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description:
Maginohek can fall prone depending on its HP.

Roll 1d at the start of the turn, and Maginohek will fall prone depending on its HP and the roll. If it falls prone, it deals 2d+30 physical damage to "Target: 1 area(Radius 6m) / 20" within "Range: Caster". After that, it changes to the Moving Form.

The Maginohek needs a Major Action to get up from the fall, and cannot perform [‚è©‚ñ≥Morphogenesis] on turn it fell from this ability.

Tumbling Table

allmonsters.description:
The Magireplica is a Magitech modeled after an Animal. Except for the fact that it is obviously made of metal, it looks exactly like the modeled animal and behaves very similarly. Even if the animal has unique skills, they are reproduced by magitech.

In the history of Magitech development, it is said to be the result of the attempt to gain various knowledge by "learning from nature," but it seems that many of them were created as a hobby.

abilities.title: ‚óØMechanical Body
abilities.description: It is immune to criticals from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØBy Model
abilities.description:
The strength of this monster depends on the modeled animal. Please apply the modeled animal monster's values to the place marked with ‚Äª in the various values and data columns.

Its level is equal to the Animal Monster's Level + 1. In the case of a multi-section model, the Main Section is always "None".

Basically, Magireplica has the same unique skills. However, it does not have the effect of regenerating its own HP (such as [‚óØRegeneration] and [‚óØBloodsucking]).

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description:
This is a daemon with the head of an elephant and the body of a raptor, frequently seen in Shallow Abysses.

They prioritize offering sacrifices to the god they believe in, and the more brutal the sacrifice, the better. They believe that the act of fighting is itself an offering to the gods.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Multi-Action].

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +12 damage
abilities.description: May deal an additional +12 damage to their next melee attack. At risk, they take a -2 penalty to their Fortitude and Willpower checks.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Claws attacks each round, though each attack requires its Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description:
All section receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

If the Wings section falls to 0 HP or lower, this unique skill cannot be used.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Wind-Edge Blade/12 (19)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
With "Range/Area: 2 (30m)/ Target", Garuda uses a blade made of feathers to deal with dealing 2d+12 slashing magic damage.

This ability costs 6 MP.

allmonsters.description:
This is a runaway construct of a magical mirror stand used by the nobility in the Magic Civilization Period. It is equipped with three large mirrors reflecting the whole body and is supported by a sturdy base.

Its original purpose was to place the reflected image outside the mirror in order to be able to check it from all angles, but what is now running amok in ruins is to take the reflected character into the mirror and manipulate only its shadow.

uniqueskills.section: All Sections‚óØPoison Immunity, ‚óØDisease Immunity, ‚óØPsychic Type Immunity

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Invitation to the Reversed World/10 (17)/ Willpower/Negates
