abilities.description:
Engulfs the person reflected in the mirror, making it impossible to interfere with the real world.

Engulfs "Target: 1 Character" in the mirror within "Range: Touch." The captured target will not be able to perform any movement or actions (Major Action, Minor Action). The target can attempt to escape at the beginning of its turn by comparing the success value of the ability to its Willpower (with the escaping player being the active player). If the success value is higher than the ability value, the target is released and can continue its turn. Otherwise, the target suffers 2d+5 Curse magic damage.

This effect is automatically canceled when the HP of the Mirror section that used this ability becomes 0 or less or the target dies.

A Mirror section that already captured another character cannot use this ability.

As a general rule, this ability does not allow a character in multiple sections to be the target. However, suppose multiple Mirror sections have not engulfed the character. In that case, using this ability, it is possible to take in as many sections of the target by the same number of Mirror sections. Each check of this ability and each check of escape attempts is performed only once to compare to the success value. Damage incurred in case of escape failure is given to each section individually.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Mirroring
abilities.description:
This ability can only be used if another character has been taken in by [‚ñ∫Invitation to the Reversed World].

The mirror creates the shadow of the character captured in the mirror and manipulated at will. The abilities and numerical values of the character captured in the mirror are used as they are. The GM controls the shadow.

When a shadow performs an action involving an item's consumption, it does so by consuming that item from the character captured in the mirror (but it does not needlessly discard items, etc.).

The shadow itself has no HP or MP, and if it must be dealt damage or consumed, the HP and MP of the Mirror section controlling it are reduced instead.

When Mirror's turn is over, the shadow disappears.

Only one Mirror section can perform the [‚ñ∫Mirroring] per turn. Once one Mirror section has done so, no other section Mirror can use it.

When multiple Mirror section is used to capture the character with multiple sections, it is possible to create the shadow of only one of the sections.

abilities.title: ‚óØOak Wood Body
abilities.description: It is immune to a critical hit from edged weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Size prevents enemies from attacking it.

All Mirror sections receive a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

This effect disappears when the Foundation section falls to 0 HP or lower.

loottable.loot: Large Fragments of Mirror (1,220G/Black White S)

allmonsters.description:
A plant whose roots are shaped like a human. The root is about 60cm in length and is typically buried in soil most of the year, with only the head, from which a small amount of leaves grow, exposed. Under normal circumstances, a Mandrake will prefer to grow in dimly-lit sections of deep forests, and have distinctive pale, pink flowers.

As winter grows near, the Mandrake will uproot itself and wander in search of a mate, looking to create a new batch of seeds.

Due to their purported uses in medicines and other concoctions, Mandrakes have been overhunted by both Humanoids and Barbarous, and so hold grudges against both groups. A Mandrake can call upon Fairy magic in order to help protect itself, as well as the signature screaming, they are known for. It's said that those who hear the scream and live will still be afflicted with any number of mental disorders.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fairy Magic 4 Level / Magic Power 6 (13)
abilities.description: The types used are Earth, Water/Ice, Light and Dark. This does not change even if the contract pattern is adopted (see MA, p. 136).

abilities.title: ‚óØScream / 10 & 14 / Fortitude & Willpower / Negates
abilities.description:
Once per day, when it suffers HP damage, the Mandrake can unleash a terrifying, deadly scream.

Character in "Range: Caster" and "Target: All Areas (30m Radius)/All" around Mandrake must immediately make both a Fortitude and Willpower check. The target must immediately perform a Fortitude check with a Target Number of 10. If the target fails to do so, it is immediately unconscious and remains unconscious for 1 hour unless it is restored by a spell such as [Awaken].

If the Fortitude sÏ≥Æds, the next must be Willpower with a Target Number of 14. Characters that fail the subsequent Willpower check cannot perform any Major or Minor Actions and receive a -4 penalty to Evasion for 10 seconds (1 round).

allmonsters.description:
A superior species of Manogaryu who are reputed to have subdued Mythical Beasts and large animals. Manogaryu customarily incorporate the name of the animal or Mythical Beast they have tamed into their own name, which can be used to guess at how strong an individual is.

It is said one legendary Manogaryu is said to have tamed a dragon, but it has not been confirmed whether this was a true story or a boast.

abilities.title: ‚óØTwin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: Can make two Whip attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØSubjugation II
abilities.description: Adds +2 bonus to Accuracy/Evasion versus Animals and Mythical Beasts.

abilities.title: üó®Whip Feint
abilities.description: Deliberately leaves an opening in its attack to bait the opponent into evading. This has the same effect as [Decoy Attack I].

abilities.title: üó®Vital Aim
abilities.description: Aims the whip for a weak point and attacks. If the Accuracy Check roll result is 9 or greater, +5 damage is added to the attack's damage roll. As a risk, the Manozalyu receives a -2 penalty to its attack.

abilities.title: üó®All-Out Offense
abilities.description: Puts all of their strength behind the whip and launches a vicious blow. This adds +8 damage to the attack's damage roll, but as a Risk, the Manodanryu suffers a -2 penalty to its Evasion.

allmonsters.description:
A small but strong Barbarous, it has light green skin and stands about 1m 50cm tall as an adult.

They wield a whip in each hand and are often tasked with commanding and herding lesser beasts, livestock, and war animals. The sight of their dance-like motions in a fight is impressive and sometimes even fascinates their opponents.

They take pleasure in subjugating Humanoids, especially Lykants, and sometimes go out of their way to target them.

abilities.title: ‚óØDouble Attack
abilities.description: A Manogaryu can make two Whip attacks against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚óØSubjugation
abilities.description: Adds +1 bonus to Accuracy/Evasion versus Animals and Mythical Beasts.

abilities.title: üó®Whip Feint
abilities.description: Deliberately leaves an opening in its attack to bait the opponent into evading. This has the same effect as [Decoy Attack I].

allmonsters.description:
A superior species of Manogaryu known for subjugating numerous beasts and presenting them to high ranking Barbarous. Identical to Manozalyu in size, their skin is instead a dark green.

They possess greater skill at handling whips, but their intelligence is still low, and thus their status in Barbarous society is not much improved.

Their is no skill or technique to their beast taming, as it seems to stem from intuition. As such, it is unique to each individual and cannot be taught to others.

abilities.title: ‚óØDouble Attack
abilities.description: A Manozalyu can make two Whip attacks against the same target.

abilities.title: ‚óØSubjugation
abilities.description: Adds +1 bonus to Accuracy/Evasion versus Animals and Mythical Beasts.

abilities.title: üó®Whip Feint
abilities.description: Deliberately leaves an opening in its attack to bait the opponent into evading. This has the same effect as [Decoy Attack I].

abilities.title: üó®Vital Aim
abilities.description: Aims the whip for a weak point and attacks. If the Accuracy Check roll result is 9 or greater, +5 damage is added to the attack. As a risk, the Manozalyu receives a -2 penalty to its attack.

allmonsters.description:
A parasitic, mobile plant whose ivy is usually tangled around the carcass of an animal. At first glance, it looks as if the tentacle and flowers are growing out of a moving corpse, and as a result, it is sometimes confused with the undead. However, this corpse is simply a corpse, and the plant that it is moving it about is the real body.

It wanders through forests and swamps in search of its next host. They are overly aggressive and attack by entangling and otherwise blocking movement.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Marionette Ivy can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Snaring Vines / 12 (19) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
The Marionette Ivy can use its Vine to ensnare a target within "Range: Touch" and "Target: 1 Character". If the target fails to resist, they are ensnared, unable to move, and receive a -4 penalty to Evasion checks. This effect is not cumulative. When the target tries to escape, use de-bonding (see ML, p. 71).

Because of its countless number of vines, Marionette Ivy can attack or use [‚ñ∫Snaring Vines] even if it is already ensnared another target.

loottable.loot: Remains of the Dead (500G / White A)

allmonsters.description:
This is a mid-air support type of the larger Barba series. At the end of the Magitech Civilization Period, Maris Barba's troops in formation were recorded to have attacked and defeated all the Barbarous.

However, there is a record of problems such as inferior fighting capability and increased cost as a result of the larger size.

uniqueskills.section: All Sections‚óØPoison Immunity, ‚óØDisease Immunity, ‚óØPsychic Type Immunity

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚óØGun
abilities.description:
The Machine Gun is treated as a gun weapon with a "Range: 2 (20m)" and a maximum magazine of 3.

When the bullets run out, Maris Barba cannot attack at all.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Reload (One Time Only)
abilities.description: Completely reloads the bullets of the Machine Gun. This effect can only be used once.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting & Hawk Eye
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur. It also can aim through skirmishes at targets on the other side.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bursting Shell Drop/10 (17)/Willpower/ Half
abilities.description:
The bursting shell is dropped on the top of the target. With "Range: Caster," this attack deals 2d+10 Fire magic damage to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius) / 5".

This ability can only be used once.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Sprinkle Repair Liquid/Can't
abilities.description:
Sprays Magitech restoring liquid to "Target: 1 area (3m Radius)/5" in "Range: Caster." If the target is a Magitech character, its HP is restored by 2d+7 points.

This effect can be used only once. This monster is always excluded from this effect.

allmonsters.description:
This large, fat, balloon-like reptile inhabits the south-central part of the Alframe continent. It is about 8 meters long and prefers arid land, but its body surface resembles that of a crocodile and is also covered with hard scales. Some call it crocodile skin, but it is superior to crocodile skin and is used as a material for leather products.

With a voracious appetite, any animal they see is prey for them, as large as a horse. When they find their prey to be a threat, they will spit out the fire to weaken it, and then, bouncing their whole body, they will try to finish it off.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Body Press/11 (18)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
The Marsavra's body leaps up, carrying all the weight on its belly.

All characters in the skirmish it resides are dealt 2d+18 physical damage.

To use this ability, all sections (Head, Body, and Tail) must be able to make a Major Action, and at least one must perform a Major Action. Then, the Major Action of all sections is completed when this ability is used.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fire Breath/13 (20)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Spits out a fire mass at "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot", dealing 2d+12 Fire magic damage to "Target: 1 Character".

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Potbelly Defense (Attack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4)
abilities.description: Extends belly to prevent attacks on the head. For 10 seconds (1 round) after this ability is used, the Head section cannot be the target of melee attacks and gains a +4 bonus on Evasion checks against ranged attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØContinuous Attack
abilities.description: If the section successfully hits a target in melee, it may make a second attack against the same target.

allmonsters.description:
This is a Human-shaped Magitech on a cart that houses a large number of magispheres and material cards. From the back of the Magitech, a number of dexterous arms extend to provide entertainment in all directions, including cards and magic tricks.

It is said to have existed on the Alframe continent during the Magitech Civilization Period and was used in prosperous underground gambling establishments. In order to suppress a disturbance in an emergency, it can incapacitate the customers who caused the disturbance. Because of its elaborate structure, it is quite rare to find one left in the present age.

abilities.title: ‚óØCard Throwing
abilities.description: The Card attack is treated as a thrown attack with "Range: 1 (10m)", and if it hits, it deals slashing physical damage. The Cards can be used as many times as it wants since they are infinitely generated and replenished.

abilities.title: ‚óØTargeting & Hawk Eye
abilities.description: Stray shots cannot occur. It also can aim through skirmishes at targets on the other side.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫‚è©Evocations/15 (22)
abilities.description:
It can use [Vorpal Weapon], [Critical Ray], [Paralyze Mist], [Heal Spray], and [Slash Field] evocations. All Evocations are used at A rank. There is no limit to the number of cards; Material Dealer can use as many cards as needed.

When used with a Major Action, the Evocation check is performed with the standard value, success value, described in the heading of this ability; when used with a Minor Action, the success value is treated as 0.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Frenzy Card Deal/Can't
abilities.description:
Within "Range: Caster," Material Dealer makes countless cards fly up and attack "Target: 1 area (6m Radius)/20", deals 2d+10 points of damage. In this case, roll 1d for each target. If the result is 1-3, slashing magic damage is dealt, and if the result is 4-6, slashing physical damage is dealt to that target.

When this ability is used, it consumes 10 points of HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

loottable.loot: Trove of Magical Components (7,600G/Black White S)

allmonsters.description: Often mistaken for a human female, Medusae are Barbarous with multiple thin snakes for hair. Not only can a Medusa slowly petrify unlucky adventurers, but the hair snakes are also poisonous. Rarely, a Medusa's eyes may retain their fearsome gaze after death. These magical eyes can be used to make magical armor and command a high price in the markets.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Simultaneous Attack
abilities.description: A Medusa's Snake Hair attacks all characters in the skirmish, but a separate Accuracy Check is needed for each character.

abilities.title: ‚óØSnake Venom/5 (12)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If the Snake Hair attack hits, it inflicts 3 Poison magic damage to the target.

abilities.title: ‚óØEyes of Stone/4 (11)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
At the end of each round, if a character faces a Medusa, they need to roll a Willpower Check or receive effects of Petrification (Dexterity, Agility/-6).

This effect is treated as Curse type.

loottable.loot: Eyes of Stone (1,200G/Gold, Red, Black S)

allmonsters.description:
Drifting in the water, this dangerous seaweed gets its name from the fact that it looks at first glance like the head of a medusa, with snakelike hair flowing.

The part that looks like the hair is a transformed root originally intended to stick to rocks and other objects. The roots are covered with numerous fine thorns, which petrify the victim of their wounds. This ability is one of the reasons for its name.

Medusa Heads often drift through the water in groups and attack their prey. They then sink to the seafloor with their petrified prey, gradually chipping away at their poor, stoned victims for sustenance.

This fearsome seaweed is found mainly in the ocean, but there are also subspecies present in freshwater and rarely in rivers and lakes, where it is intentionally cultivated by Gilman and Mermen to protect their territories. In such cases, they are roped and wired together to prevent them from becoming adrift.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater
abilities.description: The Medusa Head doesn't receive penalties for moving or taking Action in water. However, it can't perform any Action without water.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Medusa Head can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚óØCounter
abilities.description: A Medusa Head can use [Counter] Combat Feat.

abilities.title: ‚óØPetrifying Tentacle / 12 (19) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
If a tentacle attack hits and this Resistance Check fails, the target becomes Petrified (Agility ‚Äì12).

This effect is Poison type.

loottable.loot: Deadly Petrifying Poison Gland (500G / Green A)

allmonsters.description:
This white-haired deer is revered as the guardian god of the snowfields and hail. From the time they are born, their antlers continue to grow, and by the time they reach adulthood, they are over one meter long.

As the antlers grow, they become harder and more translucent, giving them a mineral-like appearance. The antlers create cold air around them, and can be wielded to create snowstorms or freeze moisture in the air to form ice cubes.

abilities.title: ‚óØAdapted to Snow
abilities.description: Megaloceros is not subject to adverse modifications for poor footing due to snow, etc. or cold weather.

abilities.title: ‚óØIce Deer Rationale
abilities.description:
Megaloceros have a lot of experience in combat, and they judge the combat situation correctly and act accordingly.

In judging the actions of combat, treat it as "Intelligence: Average."

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Summon Snowstorm/15 (22)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Megaloceros swings its antlers in complex gestures, creating a blizzard. This unique skill has "Range: Caster" and deals 2d+12 water/ice magic damage to "Target: 1 area (Radius 6m)/20".

If the value of the target's resistance check for this effect is lower than the value of this unique skill by 3 or more, the target cannot take a Minor Action for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns, and it consumes 10 MP when used.

abilities.title: ‚è©Ice Shards/16 (23)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Antlers become covered with ice, and it throws it. It deals 2d+14 Water/Ice magic damage to "Target: 1 Character" to "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Shot".

This unique skill can only be used once per round, and costs 6 MP.

allmonsters.description:
Megalomor is a massive perennial herb that can grow several meters high with stems and leaves. It thrives in areas with heavy pollution, such as poison or dense mana, and is known to eliminate them.

It is not considered a threat unless touched, but the juice of its leaves has potent disease-curing properties. People with power and wealth sometimes hire others to collect the leaves. Megalomor sometimes grows in areas where Mako Stones can be mined in abundance because of its mana- removing properties. It is sometimes requested to be exterminated, but some Barbarous who prefer a polluted environment may try to kill it. In such cases, the plant will defend itself with all its might.

If left alone, Megalomor will eventually die out without leaving anything behind when pollution and mana levels in the environment are sufficiently reduced. How this non-flowering, non-fruit-bearing, and non-bulb- producing plant continues to grow and reappear in new places remains a mystery.

abilities.title: ‚óØMana Interference
abilities.description: If this monster sÏ≥Æds in any Willpower check, treat resistance as "Negates".

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Devour Mana/19 (26)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Megalomor absorbs mana from surrounding entities and regains life force.

"Target: All Areas (30m Radius) / All" are dealt magic damage to MP of (1/10 of the target's current MP (rounded up)) within "Range: Caster".

After that, the HP of the Stem section is recovered by the sum of the applied damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Full Wave Release/20 (27)
abilities.description:
Megalomor releases a wave that removes all effects on "Range: Caster" and "Target: All areas (30m radius) / All".

This unique skill Success Value is compared with the Success values of all effects to be removed, and if Success Value is higher, those effects are canceled.

However, the effects of poison and disease types are automatically canceled. Using this effect consumes 15 MP.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover I
abilities.description: The effect is the same as the combat feat [Cover I]. Exceptionally, a Leaf can only cover a Stem section.

abilities.title: ‚óØBloodsucking
abilities.description: If the Leaf hits, the HP of the Leaf section is restored by the same value as the applied damage.

allmonsters.description: Melbiz is a low-rank daemon adapted to water, sporting shiny green scales and a dorsal fin. Standing just slightly taller than an average human at 2.5m tall, they are adapted to the water and will sneak into civilized lands through rivers and canals. High-ranking daemons will often use a contingent of Melbiz to spearhead an attack, coming from the water to attack unsuspecting cities.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Melbiz can make two Claws attacks each round. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Acid Saliva/12 (19)/Evasion/Neg, Underwater/Can't
abilities.description:
The Melbiz spits a gob of acid with "Range/Area: 2 (20m) / Shot" and "Target: 1 Character" and deals 2d+7 Poison physical damage. In addition, the target's armor and defense are damaged.

If the target is a character that has PC data, the Defense of any equipped armor or shield chosen by the target must be reduced by -1.

This effect is cumulative, and if Defense becomes 0, it will be completely destroyed. Armor with reduced Defense can be repaired by paying 10% (up to 90%) of the armor's price for each reduction.

Each time a character with the monster data is affected by this effect, its Defense is reduced by -1. The effect is cumulative but only down to 0. Defense is restored by +1 point per day.

If this ability is used underwater, the acid will dissolve and spread in the water, having "Range: Caster", "Target: 1 area (5m Radius) / 15", and "Resistance: Can't" and deal 2d Poison magic damage. This form of attack cannot be evaded but also does not damage armor.

This unique skill cannot be used on consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description:
Menehune is a fairy who is about half the height of a human but has a muscular and strong body. They are good-hearted fairy who likes to help others and is good at civil engineering work.

Although they do not often appear in public, if you find them, it is said that if you wish for construction work while offering their favorite food, shrimp, as an offering, they will fulfill your wish during the night.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Exclusive Spell [Mud Spot]
abilities.description: Casts exclusive Fairy Magic [Mud Spot] (see below).

abilities.title: ‚óØPainful Strike
abilities.description:
If the 2d roll of the damage roll is 10 or more, the damage is increased by an additional +6 points.

Exclusive Spell: Mud Spot

abilities.title: Casting Time: 1 Major Action
abilities.description: For the duration of the effect, the target's feet will always be muddy, and the target will receive a -2 penalty for unstable footing. The muddiness will follow the target's feet, and the ground will immediately return to normal after the target's feet have left it

allmonsters.description: Mengle is a Daemon that looks like a skinny child about one meter long. Known as "Confusing Child," it approaches with a hideous smile and confuses its victims by glaring at them with its red glowing eyes.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Eyes of Confusion/3 (10)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description: Mengle stares within "Range/Area: 1 (10m)/ Target" at "Target: 1 Character" and disrupts it. The opponent receives a -1 penalty on action checks for 10 seconds (1 round). Using this effect costs 2 MP.

allmonsters.description:
This is a plant that parasitizes other species and absorbs nutrients from them. It looks like a clump of sand daisies and usually crawls on the ground.

It is characterized by its ability to frequently change parasite hosts. It generally parasitizes plants, but occasionally it parasitizes Humanoids, Barbarous, and animals. Among Humanoids, the parasite often targets and parasitizes Meria or Arbors, probably because of their origins.

It is dangerous to encounter it alone, as it's a parasite that can quickly take the life of its host. Since they do not attack Constructs, Conjurers are very useful for their cleanup.

abilities.title: ‚óØNutrients Consumption
abilities.description: If a character of the Meria or Arbor race is the target of a melee attack, it is preferentially selected as the target. On the other hand, a character with [‚óØPoison Immunity] will not be chosen as a target.

abilities.title: ‚óØImplantation/8 (15)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
The target hit by the attack with Ivy is put to sleep, and the attack is implanted with a parasite.

The target falls asleep on the spot. This sleep is not awakened by the passage of time or by natural means. While asleep, the target's maximum HP is reduced by 1 point every 10 seconds (1 round). If this effect causes the maximum HP to reach 0, the target dies without making a Death Check.

This effect is of the Psychic type. It can be removed by the [Awaken] spell, [Early Bird] spellsong, or other awakening effects, but the success value must be compared. An Awake Potion cannot be used to remove this effect.

allmonsters.description:
Also called mermaids, these Barbarous have the lower half of a fish. Since they live in the sea, they have had little contact with other Barbarous and Humanoids, so they have remained neutral and were not eradicated in the Magitech Civilization era.

As a race, Mermen tend to avoid fighting except in self-defense and are often neutral towards most other races. However, they have a hostile relationship with some marine Barbarous, which could theoretically be leveraged into an alliance with Elves against the other aquatic races.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater Specialization
abilities.description: Can move in water without penalties and restrictions. Conversely, all action checks are subject to a -2 penalty on the ground.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ≥Cover I
abilities.description: Can use the [Cover I] Combat Feat.

allmonsters.description:
Bishops are one of the strongest Mermen. They follow the gods and lead their tribes as prescribed by their words. Bishops even have the ear of Merman chiefs, giving them considerable political power.

While Merman Bishops tend to follow the Ancient Gods, regardless of whether they're gods of the First Sword, Lumiere, or the Second Sword, Ignis, some will follow gods that have recently found apotheosis and are thus unknown among the land-dwelling races.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnderwater Specialization
abilities.description: Can move in water without penalties and restrictions. Conversely, all action checks are subject to a -2 penalty on the ground.

allmonsters.description:
Miga is a Magitech that resembles a giant Humanoid with two arms. It was developed as a general-purpose machine to accompany infantry during the Magitech Civilization Period.

Miga attacks by striking repeatedly with its huge arms, but it can also shoot one arm to attack a wide area. Although Migas were often found without arms and considered to be used for work, the discovery of a complete body has overturned this assumption. Nowadays, some countries and organizations are manufacturing reconstructors.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Arms attacks each round, though each attack requires its Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Rocket Arm/7 (14)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description:
Shoots with the whole arm. Deals "2d+8" physical damage within "Range: 2 (30m)" and "Area: Shot".

This ability can only be used once. If Miga uses it, it loses [‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack]. On the other hand, the ability "‚ñ∫Faint Arm" becomes available.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Faint Arm/Can't
abilities.description:
The auxiliary arm is used to detect the opponent's moves, and to evade their attacks. Within "Range: Touch" and "Target: 1 Character," Evasion checks get a -2 penalty. This effect lasts for 10 seconds (1 round).

This ability can be used only once per round. Also, this ability can be used only after using [‚ñ∫Rocket Arm] in combat.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Magitech HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Magitech's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Magitech can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

allmonsters.description: Mimir is a fairy that appears in snowfields and snowy mountains. They have the appearance of muscular giants, around 5 meters in height. They are usually the kings of Frau and Skadi and live like kings. He is calm and thoughtful, but if his people are harmed, he will not hesitate to retaliate with his immense power.

abilities.title: ‚óØType: Water/Ice/Magic Power 23 (30)
abilities.description: Only the Upper Body section can cast spells.

abilities.title: ‚óØIce Body
abilities.description: If a Mimir takes damage from a blunt weapon, it is treated as if Mimir had additional 5 points of Defense.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When a Mimir is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: A Mimir can make two attacks each round, though each attack requires its own Accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Icy Mana Strike = +23 damage
abilities.description: A Mimir can deal an additional +23 damage on their next attack and turn the attacks into water/ice-type damage. At risk, it takes a -2 penalty to its Fortitude and Willpower checks.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚è©Raging Blizzard/23 (30)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description:
Mimir creates a blizzard within "Range: Caster" that surrounds and engulfs the "Target: All areas (30m Radius)/All" in a blizzard. It deals 2d+19 Water/Ice magic damage to all targets. Targets that fail a Fortitude save will be swept away from Mimir. In Simplified Combat, they will be swept away to their rearguard. In Standard or Advanced Combat, they will be swept away 30m in a straight line from Mimir to the target. If the target is in the same skirmish area as Mimir, their direction of removal will be determined at random.

This ability can only be used once per round.

abilities.title: ‚óØThick Legs
abilities.description:
Mimir does not fall over even if they are subjected to a prone effect. Also, they do not receive any penalties due to poor footing.

When the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower, this effect disappears.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
A Mimir's great size hinders attack.

The Upper Body cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when the Lower Body falls to 0 HP or lower

allmonsters.description:
This gigantic creature has the body of a human and the head of a bull. It has low intelligence and is ferocious, becoming uncontrollable when enraged.

It is skilled at finding sword labyrinths and sometimes lives inside them like a guardian.

It prefers to kidnap Humanoid women, frightening and tormenting them for several days before devouring them.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave I
abilities.description: It can attack up to 3 characters within reach with melee attacks, but the damage will be reduced by -3. If more than one is hit, the damage is determined individually.

abilities.title: üó®Power Strike I
abilities.description: They can deal an additional 4 damage on their next attack. However, any Evasion Check made by them this turn receives a -2 penalty.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Bear Muscle], [Beetleskin], [Cat's Eyes], [Gazelle Feet], and [Recovery (5 pts.)] Techniques.

allmonsters.language: Barbaric, Minotaur, languages by magic system
allmonsters.description: A much smarter variety of Minotaur, these masters of magic are ferociously cunning. Willing to lie in wait in their labyrinth, a Minotaur Caster will use a variety of traps, spells, and other monsters to wear down any intruders before joining the fray themselves.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Magic (2 Systems) 8 Level / Magic Power 11 (18)
abilities.description: Can use any two of Truespeech Magic, Spiritualism Magic, Divine Magic, and Fairy Magic at 8 levels. Fairy Magic has Earth, Water/Ice, Fire, and Dark types.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó® Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: A Minotaur Caster can use the Combat Feats [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], and [Targeting].

abilities.title: üó®Cleave I
abilities.description: It can attack up to 3 characters with melee attacks that can be reached, but the damage will be reduced by -3. If more than one is hit, the damage is determined individually.

allmonsters.description:
This is a subspecies of the Sky Whale. This smaller species measures less than 10 meters in length. However, it surpasses the common Sky Whale in both flying speed and maneuverability.

These creatures are carnivorous and ferocious. They will charge at prey or anything they perceive as a threat to their territory, regardless of size or whether it is in the air or on the ground.

In the floating island of Sandokia in the Burlight Region, the "Sky Temple" and "Noahs" airships used for trading with the ground have been increasingly rammed by this subspecies, creating a significant problem.

abilities.description: This ability can be used only on rounds when a Normal Move is made; it charges and Headbutts an enemy as per the Melee Attack, dealing 2d+18 points of physical damage instead.

All sections receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks. This also applies to [‚ñ∫Charge].

When the Body section HP becomes 0 or less, this ability ends.

allmonsters.description: A humanoid golem created entirely out of the magical metal mithril, the Mithril Golem is a 10m tall behemoth. However, the Mithril Golem is one of the most dangerous monsters known to exist in the entirety of Raxia, so defeating one and taking the treasure it guards is much easier said than done.

abilities.title: ‚óØKnowledge = Conjurer Class
abilities.description: Those with Conjurer will automatically sÏ≥Æd in the Monster Knowledge check for this monster. But they still must roll to know its weak point.

abilities.title: ‚óØMithril Body
abilities.description: The Mithril Golem is immune to criticals from edged weapons and all Magic damage. The Mithril Golem's melee attacks are treated as silver weapons.

abilities.title: ‚óØLimited Healing
abilities.description:
Effects which can heal Construct HP are very limited, and mostly come from Spiritualism Magic and some special items.

Healing effects such as Divine Magic, Fairy Magic, and Nature Magic cannot restore a Construct's HP.

abilities.title: ‚óØCan Be Detected
abilities.description: Constructs can be detected with the [Sense Magic] spell and similar effects.

abilities.title: ‚óØ2 Actions
abilities.description: Can perform two Major Actions in one round.

abilities.title: üó®Improved Aimed Attack
abilities.description: When attacking, the Mithril Golem can gain a +4 bonus to Accuracy but receives a -8 penalty for damage dealt.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Glowing Fists
abilities.description: Wraps its fists with magical light for 10 seconds (1 round), and the damage it generates in a melee attack becomes energy magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Simultaneous Attack
abilities.description: A Mithril Golem's Kick attacks all characters in the same position.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Earthshaker/25 (32)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: The Mithril Golem shakes the ground, and those who fail to resist immediately fall prone.

abilities.title: ‚óØBalance Loss
abilities.description: If the HP of any Lower Body section is reduced to 0 or less, the remaining Lower Body sections lose their [‚ñ∫Earthshaker] and [‚ñ∫Simultaneous Attack] abilities.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = Impossible ‚Ä¢ +4
abilities.description:
Upper Body sections cannot be attacked in melee. Against any ranged attacks, Upper Body sections receive a +4 bonus to Evasion checks.

This effect disappears when all Lower Body sections fall to 0 HP or lower.

allmonsters.description:
The Monocerous is a holy bull. The horns on his forehead enhance its Magic Power, allowing it to perform powerful magic. It is highly intelligent, but it does not speak.

It is calm and quiet but can defend itself. It is especially unrelenting when it comes to those who offend its pride.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Truespeech Magic, Divine Magic 8 Level / Magic Power 11 (18)
‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Hawk Eye], and [Metamagic/Targets].

abilities.title: ‚è©Powerful Magic
abilities.description: Monoceros fills an area with mana and enhances Magic Power, gaining a +2 bonus to the Spellcasting checks for one round (10 seconds). This effect is not cumulative and using this unique skill costs 10 MP.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Techniques
abilities.description: They may use the [Bear Muscle], [Beetleskin], and [Recovery (5 pts.)] Techniques.

allmonsters.description: Riding on horseback, these thugs attack travelers and peddlers. Armed with spears, they block the way of their prey with their horses, threaten them, and take their money and goods. They work in groups of up to ten.

abilities.title: ‚óØDismounting
abilities.description:
This monster's Rider section is mounted on the Horse section. If the Rider is dismounted, all sections suffer a -1 penalty on all Skill Checks and have their damage reduced by -1 point.

See the Riding Rules (at CR III, p. 84) for how to dismount and mount back on a mount. If not on the mount, this monster's Normal Speed becomes "12".

abilities.title: ‚óØSword's Grace/Change Fate
abilities.description: Once per day, they may choose to change the result of a Skill Check or Damage roll by switching the faces of the rolled 2d to the opposite sides.

allmonsters.description: This is a spider-like Daemon with a complex purple pattern on its belly. Numerous tentacles extend from the jaws of the spider, and when connect, they drain the life of a living being. Tail needles have a poison that makes the target hallucinate.

abilities.title: ‚óØBloodsucking/Can't
abilities.description: When a Tentacle attack hits, it deals 3 fixed damage to the target in addition to the normal physical damage. At the same time, Head section's HP is recovered by 3 points.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fasten with Many Legs/8 (15)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: Within "Range: Touch" it captures "Target: 1 Character" with its eight legs and tightens them. The target is dealt 2d + [Chest section's HP/5 (rounded up)] physical damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØHallucinogenic Poison Needle/6 (13)/ Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
The target of the needle attack will hallucinate and lose their judgment. The target cannot use weapon attacks, cast spells, or other unique skills that might make any section of this monster a target, or include any section of this monster as a target, or make any section of this monster a target, even if only probable, for the next 10 seconds (1 round). If the target has multiple sections, this effect is applied to all sections.

This effect of Poison type.

loottable.loot: Poison Stinger with Intact Poison Sac (800G/Red A)

allmonsters.description: Guardians of the wizard-kings of ancient times, Mummies are dried corpses wholly covered with bandages. Their loyalty is unwavering even in death, and they will mercilessly attack anyone venturing into their king's crypt. A Mummy can also cause a debilitating curse just from touching the living, so contact is highly discouraged.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Arm attacks each round, though each attack requires its accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

abilities.title: ‚óØDecaying Curse
abilities.description:
If an Arm attack hits, it will reduce the target's maximum HP by the same amount as the applied damage (never less than 0). If a character's maximum HP is reduced to 0 in this way, they immediately die (no Death Check needed).

This effect is treated as a Curse type and is permanent. This effect can also be removed with a spell such as the [Remove Curse] spell (which requires a success value of at least 20), but it is also automatically removed if the Mummy who bestowed the curse is defeated. A character who dies with a maximum HP of 0 can only be revived after the curse has been removed.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Mummy is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

allmonsters.description:
It is believed that, in ancient times, royal families from the Magic Civilization period would often have themselves bound and buried in ornate crypts to keep their family together and protect them from what may lie beyond. A Mummy Lord is unliving proof of such claims and wields incredible power to preserve the family's crypt. Able to command other Mummies that were buried alongside them, a Mummy Lord also has great combat prowess and magical power at its command.

While a Mummy Lord is typically only roused from its slumber to deter any intruders into the crypt, there are stories of large armies of the undead attacking settlements under the watchful eye of a Mummy Lord.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Metamagic/Targets], and [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØDecaying Curse
abilities.description:
If a Cane attack hits, it will reduce the target's maximum HP by the same amount as the applied damage (never less than 0). If a character's maximum HP is reduced to 0 in this way, they immediately die (no Death Check needed).

This effect is treated as a curse type and is permanent. This effect can also be removed with a spell such as the [Remove Curse] spell (which requires a success value of at least 22), but it is automatically removed if the Mummy Lord who bestowed the curse is defeated. A character who dies with a maximum HP of 0 can only be revived after removing the curse.

abilities.title: ‚óØFire Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Mummy is hit by Fire-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚óØUnstable Healing
abilities.description:
Healing effects such as Divine Magic and items like Unicorn's Horn will damage Undead instead.

Magitech, Fairy Magic, Nature Magic, etc. healing has no effect on the Undead.

Spiritualism Magic and a few other healing effects can restore an Undead's HP.

loottable.loot: Staff of the Wizard-King (3,000G/Gold White S)

allmonsters.description:
Murcielago serve the high Nosferatu Barbarous, and look no different from a Humanoid.

In addition to their high fighting prowess, they have the ability to shapeshift into bats. They are also resistant to Swords of Protection, and their abilities and appearance allow them to carry out important missions such as infiltrating Humanoid cities.

They are considered dangerous because they often treat those they have bonded with as "lovers" and use them as stepping stones to infiltrate or plot against them by forcing them to do as they wish.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Murcielago receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØSwords of Protection Resistance
abilities.description: If the Murcielago is within the influence of Swords of Protection, the Murcielago's Soulscars are treated as 2 points lower.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic],[Multi-Action], and [Rune Master].

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bonds of Love and Blood/14 (21)/Willpower/Neg
abilities.description:
Murcielago extract the blood of the character they have chosen to fight for life, and offer their own bodily fluids to strengthen the bond between them.

This ability can be used once a week during combat, and each time it is used, Bonds of Love and Blood points will accumulate by one point. As the points accumulate, the target will start to develop feelings for this monster, eventually loving it like a partner and protecting it as such. The target's love for the Murcielago will become stronger each time it receives this ability (up to a maximum of 7 points).

Guidelines for the Number of Times Bonds of Love and Blood has been Received and its Effects

loottable.loot: The Lustrous Blood of Murcielago (2,000G/Red S)

allmonsters.description:
Among the Murcielago , Latigo vampires are especially favored by Nosferatu. While Murcielagos excel at seducing and cajoling Humanoids, Latigo vampires are known to be equally skilled and even better fighters.

They educate and direct the regular Murcielagos, serving as a Nosferatu's close associates and personal guards, protecting them with their lives. They also boast of their overwhelming good looks and sometimes use them to discredit superior heroes in humanoid society or even to seduce and take them as their own servants.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Murcielago receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØSwords of Protection Resistance
abilities.description: If the Murcielago is within the influence of Swords of Protection, the Murcielago's soulscars are treated as 2 points lower than it originally was.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Universal Metamagic],[Multi-Action].

abilities.title: üó®Mana Strike = +19 damage
abilities.description: May deal an additional +19 damage to their next melee attack. At risk, they take a -2 penalty to their Fortitude and Willpower checks.

abilities.title: üó®Cleave II
abilities.description: It attacks with a weapon up to 5 characters within the skirmish in which it resides.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Bonds of Love and Blood/18 (25)/Willpower/Neg
abilities.description: The same ability as of a Murcielago.

abilities.title: ‚è©‚ñ≥Bat Shapeshifting
abilities.description:
Murcielago changes its own appearance into a bat about 20 cm in length. Or, it returns to its original form from the state of being a bat.

When in the form of a bat, the physical abilities of the bat will be equivalent to its appearance (enough to fly as a bat), and all unique skills will be ineffective. Also, the bat form is not treated as a character and is not a target of any effect. If the character is changed during a battle, it can leave the battlefield.

This ability can be used only once per hour, and unless this ability is used, the shape never changes.

loottable.loot: The Lustrous Blood of Murcielago (2,000G/Red S) x 1d

allmonsters.description:
Enormous bees, each one measuring a staggering 2 meters, roam the forests and grasslands of the northern Alframe continent. These majestic creatures hunt larger animals and build nests so massive that they could easily be mistaken for flying boulders.

So great is their weight that ancient structures and towering trees alike are said to have collapsed under their burden. But it is not just their size that is awe-inspiring. The needle on their abdomen is equally massive, nearly 20 cm in length, and coated with a deadly poison that can blind with a single touch.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Murder Hornet receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØVital Strike
abilities.description: If the 2d roll determining damage is 9 or more, the damage is increased by +8 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØDeadly Poisonous Needle/14 (21)/Fortitude/Half
abilities.description: If the Needle hits, it deals 2d+6 Poison magic damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Murderous Wing Noise/13 (20)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description:
The Murder Hornet flaps its wings at high speed and sprays deafening noise to "Target: 2-3 areas (10m radius) / All" within "Range: Caster", which interferes with the concentration. The targets lose their hearing, and at the same time, suffers a -2 penalty to Spellcasting check and action checks.

This effect is of Psychic type. It cannot be used for consecutive turns.

allmonsters.description: They are fairies resembling majestic giants whose entire bodies are wrapped in constant fire. Despite their fierce appearance, they prefer order and equality and are often summoned as part of the army of Blazing Emperor Grendal. Some humanoids and barbarous worship Muspell as if it were a Minor God.

abilities.title: üó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Multi-Action], [Universal Metamagic], [Wordbreak].

abilities.title: ‚óØWater/Ice Vulnerability
abilities.description: When the Muspell is hit by Water/Ice-type damage, it takes an extra 3 damage.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Fire Rush/17 (24)/Evasion/Negates
abilities.description: Muspell becomes engulfed with fire and charges through. This is an ability with "Range/Area: 2 (20)m / Breakthrough", and deals 2d+20 Fire physical damage to the affected targets. In addition, the target is covered in fire. The target continues to take 5 Fire magic damage at the end of their every turn for the next 3 minutes (18 rounds). When this effect is to be removed, this effect is considered to have a Success Value of 23

allmonsters.description:
This 5-meter-long daemon is found mainly in and around Shallow Abysses. It is octopus-shaped with only two tentacles, its body is the head, and it has only one huge eye without eyelids.

A daemon tends to remain where it is thought to have been summoned or come through and does not significantly shift where it is active.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Intimidating Gaze/6 (13)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Nazrak stares at "Target: 1 Character" within "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Target" and terrifies it. The target takes a -2 penalty on all action checks for 10 seconds (1 round).

This effect is Psychic type.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Frenzied Gaze/6 (13)/Willpower/Negates
abilities.description:
Nazrak stares at "Target: 1 Character" within "Range/Area: 2 (20m)/ Target" and drives it temporarily insane. The target receives a +2 bonus to any action check for 3 minutes (18 rounds), but it loses 5 points of HP at the end of its turn. This may result in a zero or negative HP. If the target becomes unconscious, the effect is automatically removed.

This effect is Psychic type.

abilities.title: üó®Tail Sweep
abilities.description:
It can attack up to 3 characters that can be reached with Tentacle attacks. The Accuracy check should be rolled once, and if multiple characters are hit, the damage is determined individually.

This ability cannot be used on consecutive turns.

abilities.title: ‚óØAttack Obstacle = +4 ‚Ä¢ None
abilities.description:
Nazrak's height prevents enemies from attacking it. The Head receives a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against melee attacks.

If any of the Tentacle sections have 0 HP or less, this effect is lost.

allmonsters.description: This plant is named after the arrow-like needles that grow from it. It shoots these needles at prey that enter its network of vines. The vines are concealed on the forest floor by dirt and dead leaves. Once unsuspecting prey walks into the area, they are violently attacked as the needles are shot at their feet and lower legs.

abilities.title: ‚óØVine Network
abilities.description:
A Needle Archer has thin vines stretching out 2-3 Areas (10m Radius) around itself. If characters don't successfully make a Danger Sense check against Target Number of 12, they will step into it unknowingly and become surprised by Needle Archer.

In the event of a Surprise attack, the Needle Archer is placed in the Frontline Area in Simplified Combat. In Standard and Advanced Combat, all PCs are placed within a 10m radius of the monster.

abilities.title: ‚óØLight Needles
abilities.description: The Needle Archer can fire its Needle attack as a ranged attack with Range: 2(20m), though any attacks made at targets outside the [‚óØVine Network] receive a -1 penalty to Accuracy.

abilities.title: ‚óØNo Blind Spot
abilities.description: Within the [‚óØVine Network], Needle Archer can ignore shielding (Standard/Advanced combat) with Needle attacks, and will not suffer Stray Shots if it shoots into the skirmish.

abilities.title: üó®Million Needles
abilities.description: A Needle Archer may attack all characters (enemies and allies) within range of the [‚óØVine Network] simultaneously during its turn.

allmonsters.description:
Pamana Bees are large bees that inhabit the Farveld Plains in the Burlight Region. They can grow up to 1 meter in length and have a massive body. These bees fly across the plains, primarily collecting nectar and pollen from pamana flowers. They have a vast radius of activity, extending over 10 km.

Generally, Pamana Bees have a calm temperament. However, some bees, known as Nest Guards, are assigned to protect their nests and mates. These Nest Guards are larger than the others and can be dangerous and aggressive. They accompany their allies during nectar and pollen collection but may attack foreign enemies.

Since Pamana Bees have a wide range of activity, encountering multiple bees at the same time is rare. Usually, only one Nest Guard accompanies the others. If you come across them near their nests, be prepared to face multiple attackers.

The nectar stored in Pamana Bee nests is highly regarded for its quality. Due to the large size and quantity of the nests, some individuals have found them and made a fortune. However, this task is dangerous and involves fighting off numerous Nest Guards.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Nest Guard Pamana Bee receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison /5 (12) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description: If a Poison Stinger attack hits and deals 1 or more points of applied damage, the target is dealt an additional 7 Poison magic damage.

allmonsters.description:
This foul monster is a Ghoul that can fly at night with bat-like wings on its back. The wings are thought to be evidence of a Soulscar mutation from feeding on corpses.

Flying in the darkness of the night, they find their poor victims and snatch them away.

abilities.title: ‚óØParalyzing Poison / 12 (19) / Fortitude / Negates
abilities.description:
If a Claw attack hits and deals at least 1 applied damage, the target has a -2 penalty to Evasion checks for 30 seconds (3 rounds). This effect is not cumulative.

This effect is of a Poison type.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: A Night Ghoul receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

loottable.loot: Ghoul Toxin Extract (20G / Gold Red B) x 2
Rare Ghoul Coin (350G / Gold A) x 1d

allmonsters.description: This type of rattlesnake boasts a vast body that can reach nearly 10 meters in length and a body thickness of over 20 centimeters in diameter. The intimidating sound they make with their tails is so loud that it is said to send anyone who hears it into a panic.

abilities.title: ‚óØPoison/11 (18)/Fortitude/Negates
abilities.description: If the Bite attack hits, it deals additional 8 points of poison magic damage to the target.

abilities.title: ‚óØCounter
abilities.description: This is the same effect as the combat feat [Counter].

abilities.title: üó®Strength Burst
abilities.description: It is always ready to make a move. The monster receives a +1 bonus to Accuracy checks and a -1 penalty to Evasion checks until the beginning of its next turn.

abilities.title: ‚óØNoise Disturbance/Can't
abilities.description:
The sound made by the Tail disturbs mental concentration. The Tail gives a -4 penalty to Spellcasting checks and Performance checks for "Range: Caster" and "Target: All areas (50m radius)/All".

This effect has "Resistance: Can't," but it does not extend to characters that cannot hear (see CR II, p. 71).

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack
abilities.description: It can make two Tail attacks each round, though each attack requires its accuracy check. They may choose to attack different characters with each attack.

allmonsters.description:
Nuzumal is a small daemon, about 1.2 meters tall. Its green skin resembles that of amphibians, and its head is also reminiscent of a frog, with large protruding eyes and a wide, side-slit mouth.

The green blood they shed has cursed power that burns the skin of those it touches.

It is said that they like humidity, lives in swamps and other places, and attack in groups, dragging their poor victims with them.

abilities.title: ‚ñ∫Greenblood Curse/4 (11)/Willpower/Half
abilities.description: Within "Range: Touch," Nuzumal deals 2d+2 Curse magic damage to "Target: 1 Character". Using this ability consumes 4 points of its HP and MP each.

allmonsters.description: This fairy takes the form of a glowing, naked girl with two pairs of transparent wings on her back. She is tolerant of all living beings and grants them the benefits of Fairy Magic as much as they desire. However, she is strict against those who harm nature or seek senseless death. After warning them by making her whole body glow strongly, she tries to get rid of them.

abilities.title: ‚óØLight Protection
abilities.description: Any magic damage it receives is reduced by -5 points.

abilities.title: ‚óØFlight
abilities.description: They receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and Evasion only for melee attacks.

abilities.title: ‚óØüó®‚ñ∫Magic Aptitude
abilities.description: They can use the Combat Feats [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Universal Metamagic], [Rune Master], and [Wordbreak]

allmonsters.description: Oak Golems are made from oak wood. They are humanoid, with a short and stocky form.

abilities.description:
None.

abilities.description:
Cat's Eye Rivet (Small) (200) (‚ñ∫Double Attack)

‚îîGolden Cat's Eye Rivet (Small) (200) (‚ñ∫Twin Strike & Double Attack)

Jet Sign (Small) (100) (üó®Aimed Attack = +2 Accuracy and -4 damage)

None.

abilities.description:

‚îîGolden Tiger's Eye Rivet (Small) (300) (‚óØContinuous Attack II)

Spinel Horn (Small) (150) (‚ñ∫Charge)
